This patch enables it to vote.

commit_message:
[goal] Migrate cinderlib jobs to focal

As per victoria cycle testing runtime and community goal[1]
we need to migrate upstream CI/CD to Ubuntu Focal(20.04).

Move ceph functional job to focal nodeset.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/731207/
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/743083/

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/victoria/migrate-ci-cd-jobs-to-ubuntu-fo$

Change-Id: I7da5c1c8dddfa19d08cdb28b2a5b5fddb470b655
Story: #2007865
Task: #40179

commit_message:
tests: Remove 'agent' functional tests

The 'os-agents' API was recently removed from nova [1]. Remove the
functional tests, since they will always fail going forward but will
continue to run on older stable branches.

Also Squeeze https://review.opendev.org/#/c/762559/ inside, since those
2 are simultaneously blocking gate

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/749309/

Change-Id: I0bf7d4c0ba2a9d4637db0d209d8d52163d772f12
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

'}]
commit_message:
[CI] Set 0 swap size

Infra has recently changed the way the swap works and it might
be impacting disk usage more than it used to. [1]

We should try to run our jobs without having to resort to
swap usage as it is always much slower.

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-infra/%23openstack-infra.2020-11-03.log.html#t2020-11-03T15:18:01

Change-Id: Ic3e97ada11b953e28a36b9594b710bf7b09b05b7
(cherry picked from commit ba6e73078c6c67d9023ef628cc4897fcfd66d551)
(cherry picked from commit 4ad4429f26176971a54fb0e5bf67a5a79f219a8f)

commit_message:
Reduce number of processes on small systems

Even the most modest 4C/8T system would run with the maximum 16 processes
due to the calculation being VCPU*2.

We devide amount of CPUs to number of threads for hyperthreaded CPUs

Change-Id: I1181959604a59d0f599f5a0f0a43e348649ba74f

subject: Add support to set ovs_nb_connection
messages: [{'account_id': 6681, 'date': '2020-09-22 16:19:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6681, 'date': '2020-09-22 16:19:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow-1\n\nI'm pretty sure this isn't going to work but thought I'd give it a try anyways."}, {'account_id': 6681, 'date': '2020-11-16 19:07:10.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-22 16:19:17.000000000', 'message': 'Add support to set ovs_nb_connection

Semantic backport of If8eb685dd21791b65845afd44fb483592b8bcc0c. Several
patches were submitted around requirements for configuring the OVN
provider driver but most introduced bugs and ended up being overridden
by follow up patches. This was the cleanest way of backporting support
for these two variables.

commit_message:
Add support to set ovs_nb_connection

Semantic backport of If8eb685dd21791b65845afd44fb483592b8bcc0c. Several
patches were submitted around requirements for configuring the OVN
provider driver but most introduced bugs and ended up being overridden
by follow up patches. This was the cleanest way of backporting support
for these two variables.

Depends-On: I46a8c379b389e72865dc386a259ac7edce912340
Change-Id: I3e9e18c0d17e914acdfbbf9ed638cb404c876294
Closes-Bug: #1825146

commit_message:
Fix pep8 failures in gate

Some package must have moved forward recently, causing
the pep8 job to start failing.  Fix the issues since
they're all valid.

Also changed other messages using an exception string
to use str(e) to avoid any possible py3 issues.

Fixes the grenade job to properly build the test server.

Change-Id: I5c98c6d41cc4bce907e09dcb20ede3a9e7268b44

commit_message:
Build containers for single consumer job

Make standalone job build containers when there is one single
consumer job in layout. Do not run content provider jobs in
this case.

commit_message:
Fix undesirable raw Python error

Using the manilaclient without a subcommand while
passing an optional argument triggers the raw Python
error `ERROR: 'Namespace' object has no attribute
'func'`. This bug can be reproduced by issuing the
command `manila --os-cache`.
Added a default value to `func` and an empty value to
`command` as placeholders so that a help message is
shown instead of the Python error.
This patch uses the same fix implemented in the
python-cinderclient.

Closes-Bug: #1902873
Change-Id: I5fcafd4bdfb40b2054e1205c14493c2f4be1f77a

commit_message:
Support QoS by meter action

Currently, QoS is implemented by TC command of HV OS.
This solution has many drawbacks, such as not supported
VLAN network or VMs from same HV.

Meter is a comfortable solution, because it is implemented
in OpenFlow, so it is flexible and exact.

Conflicts:
	networking_ovn/common/ovn_client.py

Change-Id: I2373a81ca2c5d6616c0097f15dd59327116db93f
Closes-Bug: #1850609
(cherry picked from commit e7df3706043df6d117758547cf6e41f8d097af14)

commit_message:
Replace deprecated UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE variable

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is deprecated and TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is
the new environment variable name that replaces it [1].

This allows to use upper-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

[1] https://zuul-ci.org/docs/zuul-jobs/python-roles.html#rolevar-tox.tox_constraints_file
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/722814/

Change-Id: I56b20e563262e22969ef86df21f5c62fb1355193

commit_message:
Temporarily disable sahara-scenario* (train only)

A weird interaction between python3 and virtualenvs created
with system-site-packages breaks the runs of those jobs.

Temporarily disable them to allow other fixes to be merged.

Change-Id: I2740e649520081e6578bb856894c97ee72146fa8
Story: 2008355
Task: 41259

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-06 21:51:34.000000000', 'message': "Sanity check instance mapping during scheduling

mnaser reported a weird case where an instance was found
in both cell0 (deleted there) and in cell1 (not deleted
there but in error state from a failed build). It's unclear
how this could happen besides some weird clustered rabbitmq
issue where maybe the schedule and build request to conductor
happens twice for the same instance and one picks a host and
tries to build and the other fails during scheduling and is
buried in cell0.

To avoid a split brain situation like this, we add a sanity
check in _bury_in_cell0 to make sure the instance mapping is
not pointing at a cell when we go to update it to cell0.
Similarly a check is added in the schedule_and_build_instances
flow (the code is moved to a private method to make it easier
to test).

Worst case is this is unnecessary but doesn't hurt anything,
best case is this helps avoid split brain clustered rabbit
issues.

Closes-Bug: #1775934

Change-Id: I335113f0ec59516cb337d34b6fc9078ea202130f
(cherry picked from commit 5b552518e1abdc63fb33c633661e30e4b2fe775e)
(cherry picked from commit efc35b1c5293c7c6c85f8cf9fd9d8cd8de71d1d5)
"}]
commit_message:
Sanity check instance mapping during scheduling

mnaser reported a weird case where an instance was found
in both cell0 (deleted there) and in cell1 (not deleted
there but in error state from a failed build). It's unclear
how this could happen besides some weird clustered rabbitmq
issue where maybe the schedule and build request to conductor
happens twice for the same instance and one picks a host and
tries to build and the other fails during scheduling and is
buried in cell0.

To avoid a split brain situation like this, we add a sanity
check in _bury_in_cell0 to make sure the instance mapping is
not pointing at a cell when we go to update it to cell0.
Similarly a check is added in the schedule_and_build_instances
flow (the code is moved to a private method to make it easier
to test).

Worst case is this is unnecessary but doesn't hurt anything,
best case is this helps avoid split brain clustered rabbit
issues.

Closes-Bug: #1775934

Change-Id: I335113f0ec59516cb337d34b6fc9078ea202130f
(cherry picked from commit 5b552518e1abdc63fb33c633661e30e4b2fe775e)
(cherry picked from commit efc35b1c5293c7c6c85f8cf9fd9d8cd8de71d1d5)

commit_message:
Add octavia-tempest-plugin to devstack plugin list

Patch [1] deleted the test server binary file from the
octavia-tempest-plugin Git repository. The test server will now be
compiled at devstack test-config phase via a hook in the
octavia-tempest-plugin devstack plugin.

The dsvm-scenario jobs, defined in the octavia-tempest-plugin Git
repository, were updated to include the octavia-tempest-plugin devstack
plugin in the devstack_plugins list. The same needs to be done in the
octavia-grenade CI job defined in the octavia Git repository.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/758778/

Change-Id: I43b79c4c203ec5c7ecf617c449805fa963dd2db8

[{'created': '2020-11-12 19:17:36.000000000', 'message': "Add better exception logging for builds

When the exception is bubbled up through the multiprocessing bits, it
loses some information so it's hard to troubleshoot. Let's log the
exception in the multiprocessed function call and continue to raise the
exception when things fail.

Related-Bug: #1904025
"}]
commit_message:
Add better exception logging for builds

When the exception is bubbled up through the multiprocessing bits, it
loses some information so it's hard to troubleshoot. Let's log the
exception in the multiprocessed function call and continue to raise the
exception when things fail.

Change-Id: Idbf56d97069e238bc6da61c7b3432fe37ecaf1a0
Related-Bug: #1904025

The check-run-nova-compute script is distributed through THT which

commit_message:
[train-only][ffwd] Update InstanceHA script in hybrid mode

The check-run-nova-compute script is distributed through THT which
means the new container image or rpm will not have it. This leaves
us with Queens version of the script which is python3 incompatible
and fails. We simply switch for the newer THT version of the
script before starting the Train container.

Change-Id: I389a49f724318eded04fffc83c8ecabba0e258f0
Resolves: rhbz#1897691

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/761222/1 : SUCCESS in 2h 30m 46s'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2020-11-16 17:20:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Clean backport, fix needed for anyone running python 3.8 + newer
 > libvirt 6.8.0, LGTM

Correction: I wrote the wrong thing here, this is a problem for python 3.6 + libvirt >= 6.8.0.

Our upper constraint for stable/victoria is 6.6.0 [1], but the previous behavior is anyway incorrect (wrapping internal classes via private global variables that point to classes) and undesirable. And if users were to run with newer libvirt-python >= 6.8.0 and python 3.6, then they would hit the bug.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/requirements/blob/e0317a9c681cf00f6418c35ed6e4f8335e6c44c6/upper-constraints.txt#L195'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-03 20:19:30.000000000', 'message': "libvirt: Only ask tpool.Proxy to autowrap vir* classes

I668643c836d46a25df46d4c99a973af5e50a39db attempted to fix service wide
pauses by providing a more complete list of classes to tpool.Proxy.

While this excluded libvirtError it can include internal libvirt-python
classes pointed to by private globals that have been introduced with the
use of type checking within the module.

Any attempt to wrap these internal classes will result in the failure
seen in bug #1901383. As a result this change simply ignores any class
found during inspection that doesn't start with the `vir` string, used
by libvirt to denote public methods and classes.

Closes-Bug: #1901383
Co-Authored-By: Daniel Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I568b0c4fd6069b9118ff116532f14abb46cc42ab
(cherry picked from commit 0d2ca53bb86b8e4a3c44855cb5ef57f223462543)
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Only ask tpool.Proxy to autowrap vir* classes

I668643c836d46a25df46d4c99a973af5e50a39db attempted to fix service wide
pauses by providing a more complete list of classes to tpool.Proxy.

While this excluded libvirtError it can include internal libvirt-python
classes pointed to by private globals that have been introduced with the
use of type checking within the module.

Any attempt to wrap these internal classes will result in the failure
seen in bug #1901383. As a result this change simply ignores any class
found during inspection that doesn't start with the `vir` string, used
by libvirt to denote public methods and classes.

Closes-Bug: #1901383
Co-Authored-By: Daniel Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I568b0c4fd6069b9118ff116532f14abb46cc42ab
(cherry picked from commit 0d2ca53bb86b8e4a3c44855cb5ef57f223462543)

[{'created': '2020-11-10 12:09:05.000000000', 'message': 'Increase tempest test timeout to 30 mintues

test_network_policy_add_remove_pod is often not finishing in 20 minutes
in the gate, effectively timing out the tempest default timeout. This
commit increases the timeout to 30 minutes to avoid that.

Change-Id: I3bbac8e90553be9424fa0ecdb4c05e096da8f2d7
(cherry picked from commit 0fab73b3e8625f292a6e27710823843314337233)
'}]
commit_message:
Increase tempest test timeout to 30 mintues

test_network_policy_add_remove_pod is often not finishing in 20 minutes
in the gate, effectively timing out the tempest default timeout. This
commit increases the timeout to 30 minutes to avoid that.

Change-Id: I3bbac8e90553be9424fa0ecdb4c05e096da8f2d7
(cherry picked from commit 0fab73b3e8625f292a6e27710823843314337233)

subject: Delete the default value of domain in role creation
messages:
[{'account_id': 25564, 'date': '2018-06-26 09:36:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2018-07-12 11:22:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Since the behavior changed, you need to change the support status as well

This will break those template that depends on this default value.

There is another way to do this, add validate to drop property if `default` doesn't exist, but this will not solve the issue when user like to create a role without providing any domain.

IMO, if we like to solved this for all, we should allow Null as input in properties to block default value"}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2019-03-14 13:07:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> This will break those template that depends on this default value.

Yeah, but I guess we'll go ahead with an upgrade note as this is something that's incorrect to start with."}, {'account_id': 15895, 'date': '2020-10-21 06:28:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2020-11-02 08:07:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2020-11-02 08:08:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 15895, 'date': '2020-11-04 08:41:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Delete the default value of domain in role creation

The default value of domain caused the user to be unable to create
role which no domain.
The patch delete the default value of domain.

Change-Id: Ic67b22c435e29f67bafa8e14ab502ebec5b07ec5
Story: 2002671
Task: 22488

subject: Remove firewall_driver from securitygoup section due to duplication in agents config file
messages:
[{'account_id': 29605, 'date': '2020-11-07 14:45:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2020-11-07 14:48:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

LGTM'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2020-11-07 17:27:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

dpdk is special cased here https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_neutron/src/branch/master/templates/plugins/ml2/openvswitch_agent.ini.j2#L33-L35

Should the same logic be applied here too?'}, {'account_id': 29605, 'date': '2020-11-08 06:34:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> dpdk is special cased here https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_neutron/src/branch/master/templates/plugins/ml2/openvswitch_agent.ini.j2#L33-L35
 > 
 > Should the same logic be applied here too?

to the best of my knowledge about OVS with dpdk support, that uses the regular OVS for ML2 driver. The openvswitch_agent.ini.j2 file, while created a special case for this scenario, which in my opinion could create inconsistency in configuration files, but it will not cause any problem with this commit.
BTW, this is my first contribution on OpenStack, could you please help me understand the reason of Zuul check failure? 
Thanks in advance.'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2020-11-08 10:27:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Regarding zuul it's collection installation error, so just worth rechecking
https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/4536331c2ab544f1b51f7875e289cb0e/log/job-output.txt#2700"}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2020-11-08 10:27:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2020-11-09 10:15:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@jamesdenton can we get you to take a look at this?'}, {'account_id': 16011, 'date': '2020-11-09 14:46:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 16011, 'date': '2020-11-09 14:50:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Just to add to this, I see TripleO has removed the firewall_driver config option from ml2_conf.ini: https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/e65b8309ff79341a7b4f51b5a22ac6dea5408d53. Perhaps we should consider that as well.'}, {'account_id': 29605, 'date': '2020-11-09 15:25:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thank you James for your input.
So with James comment and the fact that other agent config files already have securitygroup section with proper firewall_driver, I think it is safe to remove entire securitygroup section from ml2_conf.ini file.'}, {'account_id': 29605, 'date': '2020-11-09 15:42:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 29605, 'date': '2020-11-10 03:59:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2020-11-10 10:31:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2020-11-10 11:37:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 16011, 'date': '2020-11-10 12:01:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-2

We can't remove the entire [security_group] block, only firewall_driver. Mind fixing that?"}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2020-11-10 12:04:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 29605, 'date': '2020-11-10 13:42:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> We can't remove the entire [security_group] block, only
 > firewall_driver. Mind fixing that?

oh OK, I thought it was duplicate, I guess I misunderstand your comment  though."}, {'account_id': 29605, 'date': '2020-11-10 13:46:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 16011, 'date': '2020-11-10 13:58:12.000000000', 'content': 'Removed Code-Review-2 by James Denton <james.denton@outlook.com>
'}, {'account_id': 16011, 'date': '2020-11-10 13:58:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 16011, 'date': '2020-11-10 13:59:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> oh OK, I thought it was duplicate, I guess I misunderstand your comment  though.

Well, the block itself is duplicated between the ml2_conf and agent config files, but depending on the service referencing them different components may be needed. In the case of ml2_conf.ini, it is read by neutron-server and we need *some* of the components of that [security_group] block'}, {'account_id': 29605, 'date': '2020-11-10 14:11:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> Well, the block itself is duplicated between the ml2_conf and agent
 > config files, but depending on the service referencing them
 > different components may be needed. In the case of ml2_conf.ini, it
 > is read by neutron-server and we need *some* of the components of
 > that [security_group] block

Thanks for explanation.'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2020-11-10 16:45:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2020-11-16 07:34:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 29605, 'date': '2020-11-16 10:22:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck'}]

docs much easier.

[{'created': '2020-10-09 13:53:18.000000000', 'message': 'Drop invalid rootwrap filters

A recent change introduced a couple of rootwrap filters that are
supposed to allow running ping within a network namespace.

Those filters will actually replace the "ip" command with "ping",
which leads to an invalid command.

Since those two filters are now superfluous, we're going to drop
them.

Conflicts:
    etc/neutron/rootwrap.d/debug.filters

Change-Id: I57869c68e858503ed8d6b86506c79c289f2820e1
Closes-Bug: #1864186
'}, {'created': '2020-11-10 07:56:53.000000000', 'message': 'Drop invalid rootwrap filters

A recent change introduced a couple of rootwrap filters that are
supposed to allow running ping within a network namespace.

Those filters will actually replace the "ip" command with "ping",
which leads to an invalid command.

Since those two filters are now superfluous, we're going to drop

commit_message:
Drop invalid rootwrap filters

A recent change introduced a couple of rootwrap filters that are
supposed to allow running ping within a network namespace.

Those filters will actually replace the "ip" command with "ping",
which leads to an invalid command.

Since those two filters are now superfluous, we're going to drop
them.

Conflicts:
    etc/neutron/rootwrap.d/debug.filters

Change-Id: I57869c68e858503ed8d6b86506c79c289f2820e1
Closes-Bug: #1864186

commit_message:
Add update_id for ResourceUpdate

Add a unique id for resource update, then we can calculate
the resource processing time and track it.

Related-Bug: #1825152
Related-Bug: #1824911
Related-Bug: #1821912
Related-Bug: #1813787

Conflicts:
	neutron/agent/l3/agent.py

Change-Id: Ib4d197c6c180c32860964440882393794aabb6ef
(cherry picked from commit 9d60716cf1d61286a684f20ef8e05c77a0df5aa3)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-12 17:57:11.000000000', 'message': 'Replace assertTrue(a in b) with assertIn(a, b)

New day, new release somewhere, new thing not working that was working
before. Our jobs started failing complaining on use of
assertTrue(a in b). Replace it according to the suggestion.

Change-Id: I6a9128cfb17b77bcc9df59ce90e737efc6883d90
'}]
commit_message:
Replace assertTrue(a in b) with assertIn(a, b)

New day, new release somewhere, new thing not working that was working
before. Our jobs started failing complaining on use of
assertTrue(a in b). Replace it according to the suggestion.

Change-Id: I6a9128cfb17b77bcc9df59ce90e737efc6883d90

[{'created': '2020-10-14 19:58:43.000000000', 'message': 'Add package check for heat-all

As we switch the heat native to be deprecated, we want to drop the
openstach-heat-monolith rpm requirements. In order to do that, we should
add a check to ensure that we can fail nicely with a hint at a solution
for a user who wishes to still use heat natively as part of the
standalone or undercloud processes.

Change-Id: I3a415934651de1314c96e10f25c86a52ac519146

commit_message:
Add package check for heat-all

As we switch the heat native to be deprecated, we want to drop the
openstach-heat-monolith rpm requirements. In order to do that, we should
add a check to ensure that we can fail nicely with a hint at a solution
for a user who wishes to still use heat natively as part of the
standalone or undercloud processes.

Change-Id: I3a415934651de1314c96e10f25c86a52ac519146
Blueprint: bp/switch-to-heat-all-container

commit_message:
Switch to containerized heat-all

This patch switches the standalone and undercloud commands to use
heat-all in a container rather than the openstack-heat-monolith code
installed on the host.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/759140/
Change-Id: Idbc0ab20de4f0e3c40fba165ff7f902837b443c6
Blueprint: bp/switch-to-heat-all-container

commit_message:
Add BlueStore Compression support

Drop support for forwarding requests for manually created Erasure
Coded pools. The initial implementation was based on a incomplete
implementation of EC support in the supporting libraries.

Make use of the forwarding of broker requests to support both
BlueStore Compression and Erasure Coded pools created through
the broker request protocol by charms in the source model.

There is currently no support for forwarding or influencing these
properties for manually created pools.

Depends-On: I0d4ed457e1d59eabed3340f5dc7d8353d5d66f04
Depends-On: I16196053bee93bdc4e5c62f5467d9e786b047b30
Change-Id: I19f66f8594b9bdada5365582ce98365039235f9d

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-24 01:01:07.000000000', 'message': 'ovs firewall: fix mac learning on the ingress rule table when ovs offload enabled

In RULES_INGRESS_TABLE table 82 there is a rule for allow established and
related connections. The current rule sends the packet directly to the dest
port without doing a mac learning. This is causing ovs to age out the dest mac
of the remote VM and causing the rule to be changed in flood rule. For the normal
case it fine as they try to avoid high cpu. ovs hardware offload reduce cpu usage
by moving some of the packet processing to nic and flood rule is not offloaded,
therefore it prefre to use the NORMAL action to avoid the flood rule.
We also keep the same logic as today when using explicitly_egress_direct=True
which avoid NORMAL action in the entire pipeline.

Closes-Bug: #1897637

Change-Id: I9b611d62be5d0529e8b35e3d8280baa5be54bc2b
(cherry picked from commit 8fc80b7e132031d18c787b5be582c146d262de74)
'}]
commit_message:
ovs firewall: fix mac learning on the ingress rule table when ovs offload enabled

In RULES_INGRESS_TABLE table 82 there is a rule for allow established and
related connections. The current rule sends the packet directly to the dest
port without doing a mac learning. This is causing ovs to age out the dest mac
of the remote VM and causing the rule to be changed in flood rule. For the normal
case it fine as they try to avoid high cpu. ovs hardware offload reduce cpu usage
by moving some of the packet processing to nic and flood rule is not offloaded,
therefore it prefre to use the NORMAL action to avoid the flood rule.
We also keep the same logic as today when using explicitly_egress_direct=True
which avoid NORMAL action in the entire pipeline.

Closes-Bug: #1897637

Change-Id: I9b611d62be5d0529e8b35e3d8280baa5be54bc2b
(cherry picked from commit 8fc80b7e132031d18c787b5be582c146d262de74)

'}]
commit_message:
replace max_fds with sysctl call

The call to max_fds no longer appears valid.  This approach of calling
sysctl is standard across Linux based systems and would be the more
established way to obtain this value.

Change-Id: I1bdbbde0bd2102847a3ab061969115030ea207a6

[{'created': '2020-11-06 18:10:23.000000000', 'message': 'Fix physical memory calculation with new lshw

It seems that fix Id5a30028b139c51cae6232cac73a50b917fea233 was
dealing with a different issue. According to the description
in the story, and the linked commit there, the problem is the
fact that output is changed from dictionary to a list (with just
one value supposedly?). This commit changes the isinstance call
to check if an output of lshw is a list, and if so, we just use
the first element of the list.

Story: 2007588
Task: 39527
Change-Id: I87d87fd035701303e7d530a47b682db84e72ccb9
'}]
commit_message:
Fix physical memory calculation with new lshw

It seems that fix Id5a30028b139c51cae6232cac73a50b917fea233 was
dealing with a different issue. According to the description
in the story, and the linked commit there, the problem is the
fact that output is changed from dictionary to a list (with just
one value supposedly?). This commit changes the isinstance call
to check if an output of lshw is a list, and if so, we just use
the first element of the list.

Story: 2007588
Task: 39527
Change-Id: I87d87fd035701303e7d530a47b682db84e72ccb9

[{'created': '2020-11-10 13:56:47.000000000', 'message': '[CI] Set 0 swap size

Infra has recently changed the way the swap works and it might
be impacting disk usage more than it used to. [1]

We should try to run our jobs without having to resort to
swap usage as it is always much slower.

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-infra/%23openstack-infra.2020-11-03.log.html#t2020-11-03T15:18:01

Change-Id: Ic3e97ada11b953e28a36b9594b710bf7b09b05b7
(cherry picked from commit ba6e73078c6c67d9023ef628cc4897fcfd66d551)
'}]
commit_message:
[CI] Set 0 swap size

Infra has recently changed the way the swap works and it might
be impacting disk usage more than it used to. [1]

We should try to run our jobs without having to resort to
swap usage as it is always much slower.

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-infra/%23openstack-infra.2020-11-03.log.html#t2020-11-03T15:18:01

Change-Id: Ic3e97ada11b953e28a36b9594b710bf7b09b05b7
(cherry picked from commit ba6e73078c6c67d9023ef628cc4897fcfd66d551)

messages:
[{'account_id': 32656, 'date': '2020-11-09 16:41:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2020-11-09 16:41:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Congratulations, you've proposed your first change in OpenDev.

Your submission will now be tested automatically by Zuul, our gatekeeper,
and reviewed by other friendly developers. They will give you feedback and
may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches often take days (and sometimes weeks) to get reviewed, so be
patient. Don't hesitate to ask for help, and answer questions about your
work promptly if you can. The more you get to know reviewers and get to be
known by them, the smoother the review and approval process will become. The
fastest way to accomplish this is by reviewing other proposed changes
yourself: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

around.

commit_message:
Add override timeout for openstack exporter

Add scrape_timeout option in
prometheus_openstack_exporter job in order
to avoid timeout for large Openstack environment.

Change-Id: If96034e602bee3b3eea34a2656047355e1d17eec
Closes-Bug: #1903547

commit_message:
galera: expose 2-node mode for the galera resource

When deploying a 2-node HA overcloud, the galera resource
agent can be configured to enable a "2-node mode" heuristic,
that allows it to restart a galera node in the event of a
network split.

Make this resource agent's option available in puppet via
the new parameter "two_node_mode".

Closes-Bug: #1903051

Change-Id: I543ee77ec38b6429989435122ae0c257d279e507
(cherry picked from commit 5836bcc15b3e28160b13f25e1022a79002a71dd2)
(cherry picked from commit 24d0ff54f38a1dc1fcc59e8999b0b55989e12070)

commit_message:
Use Fedora 31 for tests

Aso configures swap as before

https://review.opendev.org/750941 changed the default
swap to 1024MB for jobs and this seems to resulting in
high failure rate of the functional and grenade jobs.

Let's configure it back to what used to before i.e 8192MB.

Change-Id: Ia45e957bb24f5596a5ef16271f71ba8b77df9e42
(cherry picked from commit f18a6767927965b930579995eb0b3d13c647bc26
and cherry picked from commit f419923a0d3aa62485296ab7666485e74af57c8e)

commit_message:
Import HTTPStatus instead of http_client

We don't need an HTTP client for this, we only
need status codes.  Just load that instead.

https://docs.python.org/3/library/http.html

Change-Id: Iaccc059aad4d31a413844bfc252d544a591dfc95

commit_message:
Fix filtering of network names set to an empty string

Currently we filter out networks that are set to None. However, we
should also filter out networks set to an empty string. This affects the
overcloud ironic networks that were disabled in
I300d0ef136224126f25d2c70a80a42afeea5f586 when ironic is disabled.

Story: 2008207
Task: 41076

Change-Id: Iba16d6232e1a6ef069cd3ccb870e5bfa89cd913c
(cherry picked from commit d2109e1c35011fcaeec368eb1b8bf6a9ec75e238)

commit_message:
[CI] Set 0 swap size

Infra has recently changed the way the swap works and it might
be impacting disk usage more than it used to. [1]

We should try to run our jobs without having to resort to
swap usage as it is always much slower.

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-infra/%23openstack-infra.2020-11-03.log.html#t2020-11-03T15:18:01

Change-Id: Ic3e97ada11b953e28a36b9594b710bf7b09b05b7
(cherry picked from commit ba6e73078c6c67d9023ef628cc4897fcfd66d551)

commit_message:
Fix the race condition for creating and deleting instance

commit_message:
Add SOURCE_IP_PORT to LB_ALGORITHM allowed values

This change adds SOURCE_IP_PORT to lb_algorithm property of
OS::Octavia::Pool resource which is missing from the available options
and required when using the OVN provider driver.

[0] https://docs.openstack.org/ovn-octavia-provider/latest/admin/driver.html#limitations-of-the-ovn-provider-driver
[1] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/octavia/train.html

Change-Id: Ibed37eea817a5125c5751b2bc9f44acf3c016fe1
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Rehome api tests for propagate_uplink_status

Since [0] was merged propagate_uplink_status value is True,
tempest (and neutron-tempest-plugin) is branchless, so
test_create_port_without_propagate_uplink_status and
test_create_port_with_propagate_uplink_status can be moved to
fullstack tests to keep the coverage.

Issues:
- On ussuri the default value for propagate_uplink_status was False, so
the test_create_port_without_propagate_uplink_status test asserts False.
see [1]

[0]: https://review.opendev.org/744208
[1]: https://review.opendev.org/744210

Change-Id: I8dfe76e75aa932e587d91f475317b7bac1f02ed9
Related-Bug: #1890842
(cherry picked from commit d2f8a2bea8eab491b626a66a847883fe8ac871e6)

commit_message:
Do not fail when endpoint state is absent

In case endpoint state is absent we shouldn't fail in case service does
not exist, since it means that we're ok, and endpoint is not present.

This might be pretty useful, when user tries to create and delete service
and endpoint with the same code ie [1]

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-tests/src/branch/master/sync/tasks/service_setup.yml

Change-Id: If7ecd7b2e28c81ffe18539731edd4efa599c42ec
Closes-Bug: #1904029

[{'created': '2020-11-06 12:26:06.000000000', 'message': 'Fix ovs agent, avoiding import error

A recent change[1] added a "iptables_firewall" import to the
ovs agent, which isn't importable on Windows[2]. This prevents
the neutron ovs agent from starting on Windows.

This patch updates the security group driver check, avoiding the
unsupported import.

[1] Iecf9cffaf02616342f1727ad7db85545d8adbec2
[2] http://paste.openstack.org/raw/799030/

Closes-Bug: #1899775

Change-Id: I8877dbf4b0b9cd185ae0b8715b7e8e6d87e0afcc
(cherry picked from commit 2ece1002d258e3388607e7df7677a0afae98d2cd)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix ovs agent, avoiding import error

A recent change[1] added a "iptables_firewall" import to the
ovs agent, which isn't importable on Windows[2]. This prevents
the neutron ovs agent from starting on Windows.

This patch updates the security group driver check, avoiding the
unsupported import.

[1] Iecf9cffaf02616342f1727ad7db85545d8adbec2
[2] http://paste.openstack.org/raw/799030/

Closes-Bug: #1899775

Change-Id: I8877dbf4b0b9cd185ae0b8715b7e8e6d87e0afcc
(cherry picked from commit 2ece1002d258e3388607e7df7677a0afae98d2cd)

commit_message:
Install test_server.bin in well known location

This patch installs and uses test_server.bin from
/opt/octavia-tempest-plugin as a well known location on the
filesystem. This way tests, like grenade, that run the devstack
plugins once in /old paths, can find the binary when running from
/new paths.

Change-Id: Ia78f16fde026269dec01f4dceb202842ad12a557

commit_message:
Fixing the dependency for sriov_config service

Some of the 3rd party vswitch providers does not follow the regular ovs db and
vswitchd is split and it is implementation specific. But in general the openvswitch.service
will be used as base even for the 3rd party providers. Moving the dependency from
vswitchd to openvswitch make sriov_config.service to work with other providers.

Closes-Bug: #1903550

Change-Id: Id23051e12dad8d4b84df1821e670661a0891e780
(cherry picked from commit 87702f33c0dd6902de016e4bb18d4ffde41d74ae)

[{'created': '2020-08-04 16:17:12.000000000', 'message': 'Clarify image_conversion_*_limit option descriptions

The names of these options are a bit misleading -- they
actually apply to "qemu-img info" operations when
processing images, not convert operations.

This clarifies the descriptions to help prevent

Change-Id: I7836505db1c4d1b4d3366ae1730d86c3c3a384eb
'}]
commit_message:
Clarify image_conversion_*_limit option descriptions

The names of these options are a bit misleading -- they
actually apply to "qemu-img info" operations when
processing images, not convert operations.

This clarifies the descriptions to help prevent
confusion but leaves the names as-is.

Change-Id: I7836505db1c4d1b4d3366ae1730d86c3c3a384eb

commit_message:
Remove handling for client status races

Now that we guarantee that resources are UPDATE_IN_PROGRESS before the
stack update call returns for legacy stacks (this was already true for
convergence stacks), there is no need to have special handling to check the
updated_time either in StackResources or in functional tests.

Change-Id: I5bf7ed6cb9ba6c77a77dd36eb173e1927065c53e
Story: #1669608
Task: 23176

TBH I'm pretty opposed to doing anything other than tackling the root cause."}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2019-12-25 08:22:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2019-12-25 08:35:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

I have test this in my local environment, there are following error I can collect:
* Apache can't handle with the request and cause curl request fail. This is possible when multiple tests are running simultaneously, or huge number of wc signal rush in at same time(200-300 in my local env). This affects by `MaxRequestWorkers` and some other factors.
* Apache, h-api, or network are slow and cause Timed out waiting for a reply to message ID
* Unstable network environment
* Concurrent transaction exceed the max retry for tenacity retry. This happens when huge number of wc signal rush in (and your apache survived). We already provide tenacity to cover here, only thing we can do is to increase the retry count (if we want)

Not sure if we can find others, but try to put a test (https://review.opendev.org/#/c/700545/1) on that if we can catch any."}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2019-12-25 14:08:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

[{'created': '2020-06-02 18:48:18.000000000', 'message': "Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: Ifbca4f0b72663e026a92061c213e728cf755772c
"}]
commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: Ifbca4f0b72663e026a92061c213e728cf755772c

commit_message:
Fix names of the puppet parameters used to set min bw limits in Neutron

In patch [1] I by mistake used wrong namesp of hiera attributes which
should be set and due to that proper values in Neutron config weren't
set as expected.
This patch fixes that issue.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/714464

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/757747
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/757750

Change-Id: I11f1735414b9c56fc51abc7ae902c341ff8fe7c8
(cherry picked from commit 832326de7e2d3200e90482e0d68c13bfb28aa286)

commit_message:
Set correct permissions for rootwrap.d

Recursive task against /etc/cinder/rootwrap.d set directory permissions
to 0640 as well, which is not really valid. Also it was not idempotent
with dir creation from pre-install step.

Change-Id: I064da0fa840b0ac051fc6ee1ad728c3040d9d9f8

[{'created': '2020-10-03 06:25:30.000000000', 'message': "optimize size and time using --no-cache-dir

Using --no-cache-dir flag in pip install ,make sure dowloaded packages
by pip don't cached on system . This is a best practise which make sure
to fetch ftom repo instead of using local cached one . Further , in case
of Docker Containers , by restricing caching , we can reduce image size.
In term of stats , it depends upon the number of python packages
multiplied by their respective size . e.g for heavy packages with a lot
of dependencies it reduce a lot by don't caching pip packages.

Further , more detail information can be found at

https://medium.com/sciforce/strategies-of-docker-images-optimization-2ca9cc5719b6

Change-Id: If50c81f6c7507e95e3d79dfe83b7316e3b6d1e43
Signed-off-by: Pratik Raj <rajpratik71@gmail.com>
"}]
commit_message:
optimize size and time using --no-cache-dir

Using --no-cache-dir flag in pip install ,make sure dowloaded packages
by pip don't cached on system . This is a best practise which make sure
to fetch ftom repo instead of using local cached one . Further , in case
of Docker Containers , by restricing caching , we can reduce image size.
In term of stats , it depends upon the number of python packages
multiplied by their respective size . e.g for heavy packages with a lot
of dependencies it reduce a lot by don't caching pip packages.

Further , more detail information can be found at

https://medium.com/sciforce/strategies-of-docker-images-optimization-2ca9cc5719b6

Change-Id: If50c81f6c7507e95e3d79dfe83b7316e3b6d1e43
Signed-off-by: Pratik Raj <rajpratik71@gmail.com>

commit_message:
enable ussuri cloud archive on ubuntu bionic

This change updates bionic installs to use the
ussuri cloud archive to enable the use of libvirt 6.0.0.
This is required to prevent a libvirt bug that casuse intermient
failures fo the tempest test_live_block_migration_paused testcase.

Change-Id: I9c395c2b5fdfe6ad9a43477280e88e9a9b34f057
Related-Bug: 1901739
(cherry picked from commit 3ae895115c5f7d8f8abe3500f3203780d2269f82)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-02 08:00:27.000000000', 'message': "Change default glance_num_retries to 3

Previously, the default value of glance_num_retries is 0. It means
that the request to glance is issued only one time. However, other
components' client retries the request when it fails.
To reduce an unnecessary exception and failure, we should increase
the default value to 3.

Change-Id: Iff8162c732fb9dc0080e8810b4a5bcaa3ff7e6ca
(cherry picked from commit da5a27f7b38708ea7e4e8877a1f247833224a518)
"}]
commit_message:
Change default glance_num_retries to 3

Previously, the default value of glance_num_retries is 0. It means
that the request to glance is issued only one time. However, other
components' client retries the request when it fails.
To reduce an unnecessary exception and failure, we should increase
the default value to 3.

Change-Id: Iff8162c732fb9dc0080e8810b4a5bcaa3ff7e6ca
(cherry picked from commit da5a27f7b38708ea7e4e8877a1f247833224a518)

Zuul encountered a syntax error while parsing its configuration in the
repo openstack/devstack on branch master.  The error was:

  The nodeset "openstack-two-node-focal" was not found.

The error appears in the following job stanza:

  job:
      name: devstack-multinode
      parent: devstack
      nodeset: openstack-two-node-focal
      description: |
        Simple multinode test to verify multinode functionality on devstack side.
        This is not meant to be used as a parent job.
  
  # NOTE(ianw) Platform tests have traditionally been non-voting because
  # we often have to rush things through devstack to stabilise the gate,
  # and these platforms don't have the round-the-clock support to avoid
  # becoming blockers in that situation.

commit_message:
Add tenant filter from context when using List stacks API

If no tenant filter params is set, set this filter by default to
tenant from user context  if the global param option is not used
This will resolve the issue for listing stack scope for admin
user.

Change-Id: I997356a29320de7813bc205c75d7989ca61f5dd4
Related-Bug: #1757550

commit_message:
Fix software config on rdo

The os-refresh-config scripts directory is currently set to
/opt/stack/os-config-refresh, but the latest os-refresh-config expects it to be
/usr/libexec/os-refresh-config

Change-Id: Ic3f61ea88fd431e7d9893c6930c778f6fbf21147

commit_message:
Move image_field_data method in-tree

this was removed in Horizon as 'not needed' in
26eebd4abbbabc1475bae61c51d1cfcf14dba770
however it is used to form a hint for glance.image constraint
in heat-dashboard.

Just copy-paste the method as it existed in horizon with minimal
adaptations.

Change-Id: I23fd3f45f0ce5b67691991336e727c377ca36281
(cherry picked from commit 953369c870ebc41e79525ffc4898aa6d7b10113a)

commit_message:
Dummy for functional test

This patch is only for executing functional test.

Although FT is non-voting, it is valuable to find regression.
The FT result of this patch is considered as base line.
If the FT result of a certain patch increases number of failures
than this patch, the patch maybe include regression.

Change-Id: I64ad5df128e62fad638226b0e718b5d5ee26d2c7

-https://zuul-ci.org/docs/zuul-jobs/python-roles.html#rolevar-tox.tox_constraints_file

subject: optimize size and time using --no-cache-dir
messages: [{'account_id': 31020, 'date': '2020-10-03 06:19:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2020-11-16 05:32:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-03 06:19:15.000000000', 'message': "optimize size and time using --no-cache-dir

Using --no-cache-dir flag in pip install ,make sure dowloaded packages
by pip don't cached on system . This is a best practise which make sure
to fetch ftom repo instead of using local cached one . Further , in case
of Docker Containers , by restricing caching , we can reduce image size.
In term of stats , it depends upon the number of python packages
multiplied by their respective size . e.g for heavy packages with a lot
of dependencies it reduce a lot by don't caching pip packages.

Further , more detail information can be found at

https://medium.com/sciforce/strategies-of-docker-images-optimization-2ca9cc5719b6

Change-Id: I99570e8da62205498bdba6064160d2592a86ad3e
Signed-off-by: Pratik Raj <rajpratik71@gmail.com>
"}]
commit_message:
optimize size and time using --no-cache-dir

Using --no-cache-dir flag in pip install ,make sure dowloaded packages
by pip don't cached on system . This is a best practise which make sure
to fetch ftom repo instead of using local cached one . Further , in case
of Docker Containers , by restricing caching , we can reduce image size.
In term of stats , it depends upon the number of python packages
multiplied by their respective size . e.g for heavy packages with a lot
of dependencies it reduce a lot by don't caching pip packages.

Further , more detail information can be found at

https://medium.com/sciforce/strategies-of-docker-images-optimization-2ca9cc5719b6

Change-Id: I99570e8da62205498bdba6064160d2592a86ad3e
Signed-off-by: Pratik Raj <rajpratik71@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Mark support for py38

in 'wallaby' cycle, we should test py38 by default.
Also support tox test on py36 and py38 as that's what
our check job verify on.
ref:
  https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html

Change-Id: I349d80cb1b963bdb30e374994f7c18352f918e3b

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-16 02:28:34.000000000', 'message': 'Turn on FT voting

Finally FT failures, many of which were due to bugs in FT codebase
itself, have been eliminated [1].

[1]: one non-deterministic failure remains at
test_vnf_alarm_scale_with_instance_reservation.
It's likely that "blazar host-create" fail for all hypervisors due to
timing issue (i.e., >0 instances runnning on all hosts), in which case
we expect "skipTest" to be triggered. However, sometimes it fails to be
done so correctly just returning "FAILED", even though the subsequent
test code seemed not to run at all. If you run into it, just "recheck".
If you figure out the root cause, please push a commit.

Change-Id: Ibcae265b39200ae4b605b00398e3e3e881ef3886
'}]
commit_message:
Turn on FT voting

Finally FT failures, many of which were due to bugs in FT codebase
itself, have been eliminated [1].

[1]: one non-deterministic failure remains at
test_vnf_alarm_scale_with_instance_reservation.
It's likely that "blazar host-create" fail for all hypervisors due to
timing issue (i.e., >0 instances runnning on all hosts), in which case
we expect "skipTest" to be triggered. However, sometimes it fails to be
done so correctly just returning "FAILED", even though the subsequent
test code seemed not to run at all. If you run into it, just "recheck".
If you figure out the root cause, please push a commit.

Change-Id: Ibcae265b39200ae4b605b00398e3e3e881ef3886

commit_message:
Update master for stable/victoria

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/victoria.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/victoria.

Change-Id: I56c9e4719254774a1d46e2243811a7519c919add
Sem-Ver: feature

Add metadata check for backup

use utils.check_metadata_properties() to check metadata like volume

Change-Id: I3faa9db5b00da437e7872376926eb137663f30f0

commit_message:
Accurately clean up ARQs resources during build_instances in conductor

While we build_instances() we should cleanup arqs if the
_create_and_bind_arqs() failed. And we just need to cleanup arqs when
_create_and_bind_arqs() calls failed to reduce the number of
calls to Cyborg with cyborgclient.

Co-Authored-By: Brin Zhang <zhangbailin@inspur.com>

Closes-Bug: #1872934
Change-Id: I44285cc89d38aa7d776e72efac00074d3ff5b5c2

The last remaining 1 failure looks quite strange.

[test_vnf_alarm_scale_with_instance_reservation]

Look at the two test results:
(a). https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/377782fea175447a803c24a77d95b73f
(b). https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/5b32c260438547a992f545891f0c27c0

(a) is of this change 758954 while (b) is of 760282.
In (b), you can see that "blazar host-create" for each hypervisor failed, then skipTest was triggered as expected. Also in (a), "blazar host-create" failed for both hypervisors as well [1], which you verify from https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/377782fea175447a803c24a77d95b73f/log/controller/logs/screen-blazar-a.txt. And as you expect so, the subsequent "blazar lease-create" requests never occurred. HOWEVER, skipTest seemed not to be triggered, just emitting "FAILED".

[1]: BTW the probability of the "blazar host-creation" being successful (i.e., no instances running on them) seems quite low.'}, {'account_id': 32395, 'date': '2020-11-13 04:36:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

commit_message:
DNM: minor fixes and improvements

NOTE: this DNM patch has been split into tiny patches, which I
      continuously am submitting. Every time I rebase this to the
      master, changes in this patch gradually gets disappeared.
      [x] indicates that it's been merged.

Looking to eliminate FT failures, though this includes
somewhat irrelevant things which I've spotted in the meantime.

* [x] cherry-pick 756703/7
* [x] cherry-pick 762469/1
* [ ] fix missing vnfc resource updating on vnf respawn via SOL003-style Heal API call
* [ ] fix update_placement_constraint call
* [x] fix erroneous heat API call
* [x] fix python3 issue
* [x] fix typo
* [x] fix logging error
* [x] fix VnfDf default instantiation_levels which should be initialized to empty list
* [x] fix incorrect package sizes
* [x] fix redundant __import__
* [x] fix test_vnf_alarm_scale_with_instance_reservation
* [x] fix and refine wait_until_vnf_(status|delete)
* [x] skip two tests until ceilometer is restored
* [x] introduce keystone client initialization retry

Change-Id: I4a83fee14e3293d0c20c3ffc90be755c7cfb71cd

messages:
[{'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2020-09-02 19:56:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2020-09-02 23:31:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2020-09-19 09:38:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2020-09-20 12:04:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2020-09-20 12:04:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-10-08 13:54:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2020-10-13 15:35:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2020-10-14 14:03:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Takashi see the logs, what do you think?

2020-10-13 16:10:57 +0000 Puppet (err): Systemd start for libvirtd-tcp.socket failed!
journalctl log for libvirtd-tcp.socket:
-- Logs begin at Tue 2020-10-13 15:51:40 UTC, end at Tue 2020-10-13 16:10:57 UTC. --
Oct 13 16:10:57 ubuntu-bionic-rax-ord-0020577413 systemd[1]: libvirtd-tcp.socket: Socket service libvirtd.service already active, refusing.
Oct 13 16:10:57 ubuntu-bionic-rax-ord-0020577413 systemd[1]: Failed to listen on Libvirt non-TLS IP socket.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-10-14 16:52:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

hmm... According to the log, it seems that libvirtd-*socket fails to start if libvirtd.service is already started.

In CentOS job libvirtd.service is started after socket service is enabled, but in Ubuntu it seems that libvirtd.service is started just after installing the package, because libvirtd is started even when puppet didn't apply Service[libvirtd] .

Maybe we need to stop libvirtd service intentionally just after libvirtd is installed ?"}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2020-11-15 23:52:09.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-17 17:57:39.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] new diskimage-build command

By moving argument parsing in to python we gain many advantages such as
safety, uniform code, and the ability to support advanced features more
easily (such as config file running). It would be difficult and messy to
force ourselves to rely on our existing argument names, format, and
behavior and it probably time to declare bankruptcy on some of our
legacy behavior here.

Create a new command: diskimage-build which allows us to implement a new
CLI where we can create a more uniform experience and support new
features we don't have to implement in our bash disk-image-create. This
also fixes a major issue - the project is named diskimage-builder but
the command was named disk-image-create (note diskimage vs disk-image).

Change-Id: I487b58f4dfe519b398bb8c2ce43dda346c613d24
"}, {'created': '2018-03-17 21:28:53.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] new diskimage-build command with config

By moving argument parsing in to python we gain many advantages such as
safety, uniform code, and the ability to support advanced features more
easily (such as config file running). It would be difficult and messy to

commit_message:
new diskimage-build command with config

By moving argument parsing in to python we gain many advantages such as
safety, uniform code, and the ability to support advanced features more
easily (such as config file running). It would be difficult and messy to
force ourselves to rely on our existing argument names, format, and
behavior and it probably time to declare bankruptcy on some of our
legacy behavior here.

Create a new command: diskimage-build which allows us to implement a new
CLI where we can create a more uniform experience and support new
features we don't have to implement in our bash disk-image-create. This
also fixes a major issue - the project is named diskimage-builder but
the command was named disk-image-create (note diskimage vs disk-image).

On top of that implement a new config file format similar to nodepool's.
This allows users to specify images they regularly build in file format
rather than having to remember the (often very long) command line
invocation.

Change-Id: I487b58f4dfe519b398bb8c2ce43dda346c613d24

[{'created': '2017-08-09 06:07:26.000000000', 'message': "Add python-virtualenv to the list of required packages

I know it's trivial but python-all-dev doesn't include python-virtualenv
which means reproduce always fails.  I'm  man of small brain and I've
forgotten a couple of times I need that thing.

Update the banner in reproduce.sh to list it.

Change-Id: I492ffec0e500e1748e926328041dc92f73bb80cf
"}]
commit_message:
Add python-virtualenv to the list of required packages

I know it's trivial but python-all-dev doesn't include python-virtualenv
which means reproduce always fails.  I'm  man of small brain and I've
forgotten a couple of times I need that thing.

Update the banner in reproduce.sh to list it.

Change-Id: I492ffec0e500e1748e926328041dc92f73bb80cf

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-07-06 06:18:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-07-06 06:19:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-07-06 15:52:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-07-07 00:51:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-07-07 00:51:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-07-07 04:26:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-07-08 04:58:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-07-08 04:59:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Workflow-1

The bug is there but this naive approach to fix it causes lots of resource dependency failures that I don't understand."}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-07-08 20:21:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-07-08 21:31:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

(1 comment)

The bigger problem is that this introduces:

 Notice: /Stage[main]/Apache/File[/etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf]: Dependency File[/etc/httpd/conf/ports.conf] has failures: true

and a bunch more, you can see them at: http://logs.openstack.org/06/580306/7/check/tripleo-puppet-ci-centos-7-undercloud-containers/02a2737/logs/undercloud/home/zuul/undercloud_install.log.txt.gz#_2018-07-08_05_57_01

I'm happy to fix this but I really don't understand enough of the puppet catalogue to really dig into this.  Pointers very welcom"}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-07-08 23:00:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-07-09 00:29:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-07-09 01:28:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-07-09 05:32:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Workflow-1

Okay I finally got it right WRT the unit/acceptance tests but it's failing with "failures: true".  Like I said I'm happy to work on this but I don't really know where to look

http://logs.openstack.org/06/580306/10/check/tripleo-puppet-ci-centos-7-undercloud-containers/1396c8e/logs/undercloud/home/zuul/undercloud_install.log.txt.gz#_2018-07-09_02_15_57'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2018-07-09 05:57:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

hmm, it appears to be linked to httpd setup:
Error: Cannot create /etc/httpd/conf.d; parent directory /etc/httpd does not exist

Hard to find the root cause of that one, still digging.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-07-09 06:12:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

> hmm, it appears to be linked to httpd setup:
 > Error: Cannot create /etc/httpd/conf.d; parent directory /etc/httpd
 > does not exist
 > 
 > Hard to find the root cause of that one, still digging.

Thanks.  I had no idea how to even work that out let alone work out if it's valid or not."}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2018-07-09 11:08:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

> Thanks.  I had no idea how to even work that out let alone work out
 > if it's valid or not.

It looks like the service httpd isn't installed, as the package should create the /etc/httpd directory.

I'm looking for the dockerfile of the tripleomaster/centos-binary-ironic-inspector container."}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-07-09 12:10:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

> > Thanks.  I had no idea how to even work that out let alone work
 > out
 > > if it's valid or not.
 > 
 > It looks like the service httpd isn't installed, as the package
 > should create the /etc/httpd directory.
 > 
 > I'm looking for the dockerfile of the tripleomaster/centos-binary-ironic-inspector
 > container.

I thought similarly, and I think this may be a side-effect of running the the inspector in separate containers from the main (wsgi) ironic API and my change is crossing the streams and pulling in parts of the catalogue that shouldn't be.

I suspect that the correct fix is to refactor some of the tftp directory setup into it's own class and then utilise that from pxe.pp and inspector.pp.

Before I do that I wanted to check that my reasoning is mostly sound"}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2018-07-09 13:16:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

> I suspect that the correct fix is to refactor some of the tftp
 > directory setup into it's own class and then utilise that from
 > pxe.pp and inspector.pp.

Indeed, this is the right way in the end. Would be good to get some generic name so that other common resources might be added there."}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2020-11-15 22:49:01.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Ensure that the pxelinux.cfg exists

When trying to create the "${tftp_root_real}/pxelinux.cfg/default" file
it's possible that the pxelinux.cfg directory wont have been created
yet.

Add an explict require for the base directory before trying to generate the
file.

Change-Id: I53db6c3a979218eab87148cd683471adf85880c5

subject: Copy neutron-grenade from neutron
messages:
[{'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-12-05 03:29:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2018-12-05 06:18:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I am +1 on moving the neutron-grenade job from neutron repo to grenade which was our main goal. But -1 on renaming it. let's keep the name same 'neutron-grenade' so that we do not end up changing the name in all other repos [1]. 
all other jobs like tempest-full, tempest-slow etc are kept same way there is no py2 suffix on those. 

Once we finish the grenade jobs on zuulv3 native -https://review.openstack.org/#/c/548936/ then, we can rename it all together. 

[1] http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=neutron-grenade&i=nope&files=&repos="}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-12-05 06:59:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2018-12-05 08:08:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-12-05 20:13:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-12-06 01:56:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> Zuul encountered a syntax error while parsing its configuration in
 > the
 > repo openstack/neutron on branch master.  The error was:
 > 
 > Job neutron-grenade in openstack/neutron is not permitted to shadow
 > job neutron-grenade in openstack-dev/grenade

Not sure how to resolve this without renaming the job somewhere :('}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2018-12-06 05:19:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> > Zuul encountered a syntax error while parsing its configuration
 > in
 > > the
 > > repo openstack/neutron on branch master.  The error was:
 > >
 > > Job neutron-grenade in openstack/neutron is not permitted to
 > shadow
 > > job neutron-grenade in openstack-dev/grenade
 > 
 > Not sure how to resolve this without renaming the job somewhere :(

humm. 

Seems like we are back to original plan. 

In initial plan, we thought of removing the neutron-grenade job from neutron repo https://review.openstack.org/#/c/548936

Either we can wait till 548936 (i can check with tosky about progress)
OR we can rename the job in this patch to 'grenade' same as proposed in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/548936/24/.zuul.yaml@155 so that when we will convert it to zuulv3 with same name in 548936."}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2020-04-27 14:01:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/548936/ landed, so we have a unified grenade job (just "grenade"). This is not needed anymore.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2020-11-15 22:48:52.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

Copy neutron-grenade from neutron

The neutron team would like to cease maintaining neutron-grenade so copy
it here.

Change-Id: I3fdef54000e85ae3b59d5f343bff978545174a93

Waiting on CI'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2020-11-03 03:00:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

Sorry, this fails:

2020-11-02 21:57:49.709776 | LOOP [stage-output : Copy files and folders to staging folder]
2020-11-02 21:57:50.208300 | controller | cp: cannot create directory '/home/zuul/logs/etc/ceph': No such file or directory

It looks like something must ensure the directory exists to merge data. We have two options here:

Create a pre-step and add it to the jobs, to create that extra "ceph" directory under /home/zuul/logs/etc

or, just revert to using "logs", and we can live with the ceph config living inside "logs/ceph/etc/"'}, {'account_id': 6413, 'date': '2020-11-03 13:22:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

How are pre-steps created? Couldn't find much in the docs"}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2020-11-03 18:50:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> How are pre-steps created? Couldn't find much in the docs

https://zuul-ci.org/docs/zuul/reference/job_def.html#attr-job.pre-run

You'll need to create a small playbook, for example:

 - name: Create logs/etc/ceph directory
    file:
     path: "/home/zuul/logs/etc/ceph"
     state: directory
     mode: 0755


and add this to the ceph jobs.'}, {'account_id': 6413, 'date': '2020-11-03 20:37:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6413, 'date': '2020-11-03 20:40:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 6413, 'date': '2020-11-03 20:54:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 6413, 'date': '2020-11-04 12:16:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 6413, 'date': '2020-11-04 14:33:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 21884, 'date': '2020-11-04 16:25:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

We should not provide flavor, volume and datastore data during instance
creation for replica.

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-23 02:51:43.000000000', 'message': 'ovs firewall: fix mac learning on the ingress rule table when ovs offload enabled

In RULES_INGRESS_TABLE table 82 there is a rule for allow established and
related connections. The current rule sends the packet directly to the dest
port without doing a mac learning. This is causing ovs to age out the dest mac
of the remote VM and causing the rule to be changed in flood rule. For the normal
case it fine as they try to avoid high cpu. ovs hardware offload reduce cpu usage
by moving some of the packet processing to nic and flood rule is not offloaded,
therefore it prefre to use the NORMAL action to avoid the flood rule.
We also keep the same logic as today when using explicitly_egress_direct=True
which avoid NORMAL action in the entire pipeline.

Closes-Bug: #1897637

Change-Id: I9b611d62be5d0529e8b35e3d8280baa5be54bc2b
(cherry picked from commit 8fc80b7e132031d18c787b5be582c146d262de74)
'}]
commit_message:
ovs firewall: fix mac learning on the ingress rule table when ovs offload enabled

In RULES_INGRESS_TABLE table 82 there is a rule for allow established and
related connections. The current rule sends the packet directly to the dest
port without doing a mac learning. This is causing ovs to age out the dest mac
of the remote VM and causing the rule to be changed in flood rule. For the normal
case it fine as they try to avoid high cpu. ovs hardware offload reduce cpu usage
by moving some of the packet processing to nic and flood rule is not offloaded,
therefore it prefre to use the NORMAL action to avoid the flood rule.
We also keep the same logic as today when using explicitly_egress_direct=True
which avoid NORMAL action in the entire pipeline.

Closes-Bug: #1897637

Change-Id: I9b611d62be5d0529e8b35e3d8280baa5be54bc2b
(cherry picked from commit 8fc80b7e132031d18c787b5be582c146d262de74)

commit_message:
Add support for vlan transparency in the OVN driver

This patch adds support for vlan_transparent in the ovn mechanism
driver. So ovn is now second mech_driver after linuxbridge which can be
used with vlan_transparent networks.
It just adds "vlan-passthru" option to the Logical Switch's "other
config".
This needs also changes in the core OVN which are available only in OVN
master branch for now. See [1] for details.

[1] https://patchwork.ozlabs.org/project/ovn/patch/20201110023449.194642-1-ihrachys@redhat.com/

Change-Id: I76b8ba959398dcffff112d26ae7d81ff428be992

[{'created': '2020-09-08 15:02:41.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure fip ip rules deleted when fip removed

The information needed to delete ip rules associated
with fips is held in memory between add and remove so
a restart of the l3-agent results in any fips that
existed before the restart having their ip rules
persist after the fips are removed. This patch
enures that an agent restart reloads this information
so that ip rules associated with a fip are correctly
removed when the fip is removed.

Change-Id: If656a703c996ccc7719b1b09d793c5bbdfd6f3c1
Closes-Bug: #1891673
(cherry picked from commit 5eca44bfa850e6e75c9974ae7711b87764628253)
(cherry picked from commit 8ba796ea7ff28a815996ffeaf3c4dc39df1edcfb)
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure fip ip rules deleted when fip removed

The information needed to delete ip rules associated
with fips is held in memory between add and remove so
a restart of the l3-agent results in any fips that
existed before the restart having their ip rules
persist after the fips are removed. This patch
enures that an agent restart reloads this information
so that ip rules associated with a fip are correctly
removed when the fip is removed.

Change-Id: If656a703c996ccc7719b1b09d793c5bbdfd6f3c1
Closes-Bug: #1891673
(cherry picked from commit 5eca44bfa850e6e75c9974ae7711b87764628253)
(cherry picked from commit 8ba796ea7ff28a815996ffeaf3c4dc39df1edcfb)

commit_message:
"ping"/"ping6" command support in rootwrap filters

To have correct support in rootwrap, "ping"/"ping6" command should
have the correct filters in rootwrap.

Because "ping" command is harmless, "CommandFilter" is used to allow
any binary call, regardless of the parameters used and the order.

Nevertheless, this patch also proposes to use "ping"/"ping6" with
the same parameters and a specific order, to help in the debug
process:
- ping[6] -W <timeout> <address>
- ping[6] -W <timeout> -c <count> <address>
- ping[6] -W <timeout> -c <count> -i <interval> <address>

Those commands could be called from inside a namespace. The needed
filter is also added in this patch.

Conflicts:
    etc/neutron/rootwrap.d/debug.filters
    neutron/tests/common/net_helpers.py

Change-Id: Ie5cbc0dcc76672b26cd2605f08cfd17a30b4c905
Closes-Bug: #1863006
(cherry picked from commit cc3b9df4268ac339d0b7316595a4148ba4c69836)

We don't tend to remove these aggressively, and when we do remove them, not at the earliest possible point. People *do* try to use N-2+ computes with N control planes at times, and these checks help to keep things from just silently breaking when they do. Do you really want to strip these one release after they "should be" unnecessary? If the goal is the aggressively pursue a "Never more than N-1" approach, then that's fine I guess, it just doesn't seem that important to go excavate them immediately.'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2020-06-15 14:35:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Build succeeded.

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/735570/1 : SUCCESS in 2h 29m 16s'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2020-06-15 15:38:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> We don't tend to remove these aggressively, and when we do remove
 > them, not at the earliest possible point. People *do* try to use
 > N-2+ computes with N control planes at times, and these checks help
 > to keep things from just silently breaking when they do. Do you
 > really want to strip these one release after they "should be"
 > unnecessary? If the goal is the aggressively pursue a "Never more
 > than N-1" approach, then that's fine I guess, it just doesn't seem
 > that important to go excavate them immediately.

I have no problem waiting another release before we delete these checks. The primary purpose of proposing the patch now was to avoid forgetting about the cleanup. 

However I would like to delete code as much as possible as we have limited capacity to maintain it. I think we have the N-1 rule in place (instead of N-x) to limit the necessary effort we have to make around upgrades.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2020-06-15 15:49:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> I have no problem waiting another release before we delete these
 > checks. The primary purpose of proposing the patch now was to avoid
 > forgetting about the cleanup.
 
Just like we try to wait more than one cycle past deprecation to remove something to give some space, it just seems like removing checks (where only the check is saved and not some bit swath of code) is maybe more aggressive than we need to be. But,

 > However I would like to delete code as much as possible as we have
 > limited capacity to maintain it. I think we have the N-1 rule in
 > place (instead of N-x) to limit the necessary effort we have to
 > make around upgrades.

What if we codify the rule a little more strictly by doing an N-2 check on startup of control services and log a visible error? We'd probably have to hand-maintain a "what was the service version of the last release?" alias as part of our release tasks, but that might be minor enough that it's worth it for the other checks we can remove?'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2020-06-18 07:37:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline and failed.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only  zvm: recheck in the comment.. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-None : NOT_REGISTERED'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-11-09 15:44:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

The code looks good and I wasn't able to find any instances of leftover functions or constants. We are technically breaking the RPC barrier here but I think that's okay now that we've got https://review.opendev.org/#/c/738482/. Maybe it would be good to get Dan to give his ack?"}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-11-09 15:48:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

Okay, discussed more on IRC and I'm more comfortable with this now"}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2020-11-09 16:02:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

> The code looks good and I wasn't able to find any instances of
 > leftover functions or constants. We are technically breaking the
 > RPC barrier here but I think that's okay now that we've got
 > https://review.opendev.org/#/c/738482/. Maybe it would be good to
 > get Dan to give his ack?

We're not _really_ breaking RPC here, as evidenced by the fact that we're not changing (the remote part of) rpcapi.py or the compute manager. This was an action that we disallowed at a high level until all the computes had upgraded past a given point, which is the "spooky action at a distance" type of cross-service dependency that keeps up from supporting N-2 upgrades, even when the RPC versions match. Since the RPC version doesn't protect us against things like this (even if we had moved onto 6.0 by now), we had left this service version check in place, in case anyone had a super old compute still limping along in the cluster, as we would have no other way to prevent a mismatch. Now that gibi has merged the global "not older than previous release" check we should be okay to trim these micro checks after they've been in place for one release and rely on the macro one to ensure everything is reasonably new.'}, {'account_id': 29963, 'date': '2020-11-09 16:32:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

'}, {'created': '2020-11-09 15:21:05.000000000', 'message': 'Remove compute service level check for qos ops

To support move operations with qos ports both the source and the
destination compute hosts need to be on Ussuri level. We have service

commit_message:
Remove compute service level check for qos ops

To support move operations with qos ports both the source and the
destination compute hosts need to be on Ussuri level. We have service
level checks implemented in Ussuri. In Victoria we could remove those
checks as nova only supports compatibility between N and N-1 computes.
But we kept them there just for extra safety. In the meanwhile we
codified [1] the rule that nova does not support N-2 computes any
more. So in Wallaby we can assume that the oldest compute is already
on Victoria (Ussuri would be enough too).

So this patch removes the unnecessary service level checks and related
test cases.

[1] Ie15ec8299ae52ae8f5334d591ed3944e9585cf71

Change-Id: I14177e35b9d6d27d49e092604bf0f288cd05f57e
