messages:
[{'account_id': 29605, 'date': '2020-11-10 06:58:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2020-11-10 10:30:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

also we need to define ceilometer_event_pipeline_yaml_overrides in defaults/main.yml'}, {'account_id': 29605, 'date': '2020-11-10 11:34:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> (2 comments)

I'm not sure about this, because there are various number of sinks that can be used for events. For example, my scenario requires to sink events in a RabbitMQ cluster."}, {'account_id': 29605, 'date': '2020-11-10 11:41:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 29605, 'date': '2020-11-10 11:59:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

should we write release note about this change too? considering new variable.'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2020-11-10 12:02:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(3 comments)

Sorry that I've just realized this, but let's make it the same logic as for ceilometer_event_definitions_yaml_overrides?

So we should set in vars/main.yml:
ceilometer_event_pipeline_user_content: "{{ lookup('file', ceilometer_event_pipeline_default_file_path, errors='ignore') }}"
  
And for ceilometer_core_files add:

      - tmp_f: "{{ (ceilometer_event_pipeline_user_content | length > 0) | ternary(false, '/tmp/event_pipeline.yaml') }}"
    source_f: "{{ ceilometer_lib_dir }}/ceilometer/pipeline/data/event_pipeline.yaml"
    config_overrides: "{{ ceilometer_event_pipeline_yaml_overrides }}"
    config_type: "yaml"
    list_extend: false
    content: "{{ ceilometer_event_pipeline_user_content }}"'}, {'account_id': 29605, 'date': '2020-11-10 14:09:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> (3 comments)
 > 
 > Sorry that I've just realized this, but let's make it the same
 > logic as for ceilometer_event_definitions_yaml_overrides?
 > 
 > So we should set in vars/main.yml:
 > ceilometer_event_pipeline_user_content: "{{ lookup('file',
 > ceilometer_event_pipeline_default_file_path, errors='ignore') }}"
 > 
 > And for ceilometer_core_files add:
 > 
 > - tmp_f: "{{ (ceilometer_event_pipeline_user_content | length > 0)
 > | ternary(false, '/tmp/event_pipeline.yaml') }}"
 > source_f: "{{ ceilometer_lib_dir }}/ceilometer/pipeline/data/event_pipeline.yaml"
 > config_overrides: "{{ ceilometer_event_pipeline_yaml_overrides }}"
 > config_type: "yaml"
 > list_extend: false
 > content: "{{ ceilometer_event_pipeline_user_content }}"

Both ways work fine, but I think all definitions (ceilometer_event_definitions_yaml_overrides and ceilometer_data_meters_yaml_overrides) are done the way you mentioned, and pipeline was handled with templates.
I noticed the parts that uses tmp_f modules are your commit. so this is entirely your call.'}, {'account_id': 29605, 'date': '2020-11-10 14:28:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

just a thought: why we don't handle pipeline.yaml with tmp_f module too? so we can have one way of handling all definitions and pipelines?"}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2020-11-10 14:40:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Well, we can do that. The only thing here is that we have non-default pipeline in templates, which respects rates, while default one is not and as simple as event pipeline. And imo having proper rates out of the box is pretty common usecase which makes sense at least to me.

We can change that if you want in a follow-up patch but this needs good upgrade reno, since all current deployments will need to carry this with their own.

But in case where event_pipeline == https://opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer/src/branch/master/ceilometer/pipeline/data/event_pipeline.yaml there's no reason to carry template."}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2020-11-10 14:41:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Eventually tmp_f is cloudnull's thing, I was just applying to more roles:)"}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2020-11-10 14:44:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Well, for pipeline.yml we can probably set some "default_overrides" in vars to make the same result we have now in the template and merging user overrides and our "default overrides".
But anyway, it's topic for separate discussion.

FWIW, you can join us on Freenode IRC in #openstack-ansible for more effective discussions:)'}, {'account_id': 29605, 'date': '2020-11-10 15:33:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Well, we can do that. The only thing here is that we have
 > non-default pipeline in templates, which respects rates, while
 > default one is not and as simple as event pipeline. And imo having
 > proper rates out of the box is pretty common usecase which makes
 > sense at least to me.
 > 
 > We can change that if you want in a follow-up patch but this needs
 > good upgrade reno, since all current deployments will need to carry
 > this with their own.
 > 
 > But in case where event_pipeline == https://opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer/src/branch/master/ceilometer/pipeline/data/event_pipeline.yaml
 > there's no reason to carry template.

 > Well, we can do that. The only thing here is that we have
 > non-default pipeline in templates, which respects rates, while
 > default one is not and as simple as event pipeline. And imo having
 > proper rates out of the box is pretty common usecase which makes
 > sense at least to me.
 > 
 > We can change that if you want in a follow-up patch but this needs
 > good upgrade reno, since all current deployments will need to carry
 > this with their own.
 > 
 > But in case where event_pipeline == https://opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer/src/branch/master/ceilometer/pipeline/data/event_pipeline.yaml
 > there's no reason to carry template.

Just couple of quick questions:
1. I didn't get what you mean by respecting rate?
2. I get what you mean by carrying unnecessary template, but that rule applies to pipeline.yaml too, isn't it?
3. Changing pipeline.yaml tepmlate to tmp_f doesn't affect current deployments, because they used 'ceilometer_pipeline_yaml_overrides' variable, and tem_f module uses the same variable at the highest of override hierarchy. did I get it right?
4. what is your opinion on adding 'target_f: "/etc/ceilometer/event_definitions.yaml"' attribute to ceilometer_core_files tmp_f? while the current version works, but I guess people used to see all config files in /etc'}, {'account_id': 29605, 'date': '2020-11-10 17:14:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2020-11-11 07:06:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2020-11-11 09:41:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 29605, 'date': '2020-11-15 07:29:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/ussuri as commit 396b89817c654ceb18813b624b47bfbf7afcafd8'}]

commit_message:
Remove left over code for admin_state_down_before_update

The extension in neutron-lib was released in 1.29.0 so it is time to
use the extension from neutron-lib.

Change-Id: Id2bd872646feede7179affe8c7d124b4530afc9d
Related-Bug: #1811166

let's merge it and check the results after a while on CI meeting for example to see if we can do some improvements based on those results"}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2020-11-03 15:11:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

neutron-tempest-plugin-scenario-linuxbridge died in devstack with "/opt/stack/devstack/functions-common:237 Failure retrieving default route device".  

Looking at the worlddump.txt for that job [1] I see that there is a default ipv6 route; the vm was not configured with ipv4 networking.

    ip route
    --------
    
    ip -6 route
    -----------
    
    ::1 dev lo proto kernel metric 256 pref medium
    2607:ff68:100:54::/64 dev ens3 proto kernel metric 256 expires 86380sec pref medium
    fe80::/64 dev ens3 proto kernel metric 256 pref medium
    default via fe80::f816:3eff:fe77:b05c dev ens3 proto ra metric 1024 expires 280sec hoplimit 64 pref medium

Looking at the devstack code that throws the error [2] it looks like it only looks for a default route in the output of `ip route`, which does not include ipv6 information.  Created change https://review.opendev.org/#/c/739139/ to see if I can fix this.

[1] https://d4eb7e3efe98cba79a4b-f4d168cdb20f40841821e4b213645c0f.ssl.cf2.rackcdn.com/739139/12/gate/neutron-tempest-plugin-scenario-linuxbridge/9a6b4f7/controller/logs/worlddump-latest.txt
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/src/branch/master/lib/neutron-legacy#L236'}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2020-11-03 15:15:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

Bad copy/paste; the change with a fix in that last comment should be https://review.opendev.org/#/c/761178/'}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2020-11-12 08:55:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

recheck

commit_message:
Add Loki testing for Neutron

This commit adds a non-voting job, based on tempest, which enables the
transient DB failure injection module 'loki' [1].  This will test
neutron resilience to database errors.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/neutron/latest//contributor/testing/db_transient_failure_injection.html

Co-Authored-By: Slawek Kaplonski <skaplons@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ie6293923a4a4744888bf3ee36007267ef0fddfd9

commit_message:
Fixing incorrect parameter names in Dell EMC Storage Templates

The new templates have some incorrect template names
due to typos. Fixing them

Conflicts:
	manifests/profile/base/cinder/volume/dellemc_powerstore.pp
This file has been removed from the backport because it doesn't exist
in ussuri.

Change-Id: I0f398b473d9acdc44c96d5c62f667b11601fb17c
(cherry picked from commit 2677d9e20a220032f5dcef816a8da96d08779437)

commit_message:
Adds layouts for victoria upgrade and update jobs

Definitions are added in the parent patch [1]. This also fixes nit
in the standalone-upgrade jobs layout (forgotten 'old' non consumer
jobs are removed) and re-adds standalone-upgrade-ussuri to the gate
as it is now voting after [2].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/759702
[2] https://review.opendev.org/749487

Change-Id: Iefaf6fdfc3b3febf97fb0f5e2ad2b52f56344777

commit_message:
PowerMax Driver - Fix non-temporary snapshot delete

Fix bug where non-temporary snapshots were being
deleted from volume when do_sync_check is called
for that volume, caused by missing check for
temporary snapshot naming convention. Fixed by
adding this check back into the conditional
that determined if a snapshot should be deleted.

Change-Id: I20194f57437e9ece5d95259bd91c95a4f19d9ab5
Closes-Bug: 1887962
(cherry picked from commit a7f9eda389344b43276fe1e5a54d5b7d8ab6c5a8)
(cherry picked from commit 914548f70c4d278f1148ed13647e29314929b443)

commit_message:
RBD: Run flatten in a different thread when cloning a volume

The current implementation of create_cloned_volume calls flatten
directly, and this makes whole thread of cinder-volume blocked by that
flatten call. This causes heartbeat timeout in RabbitMQ when cloning
a volume with rbd backend.

This patch makes sure that flatten is executed in a different thread,
to allow heatbeat thread to run while flattening a rbd image.

Closes-Bug: #1898918
Change-Id: I9f28260008117abcebfc96dbe69bf892f5cd14fe
(cherry picked from commit bafe440b9418a1e3acd00456872d4d97a9c64c61)
(cherry picked from commit f1521d82d941e711f6ef248a7eb81f096de8135f)
(cherry picked from commit 223b3c7b0f614fc4a5e0e8e9612f10bb0de0ba55)

commit_message:
Add common RBAC personas to cinder/policies/base.py

The more we convert policies to use a set of known and established RBAC
defaults, the more reusable these will become.

Change-Id: Ie20b1a480c9600039632de8e93112cd581a34bbe

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-08 16:32:32.000000000', 'message': 'NetApp SolidFire: Fix retype to SolidFire

Cinder can successfully retype an attached volume from SolidFire
to different backends, but the other way around was failing. This patch
fixes this issue, allowing retype operation for attached volumes from
other backends to SolidFire.

Change-Id: I75b828198a2af707d59120f29704a81ba9f2b553
Closes-bug: #1859652
(cherry picked from commit ca475a3dad993624920d2bcbe65bf98162f32e2f)
'}, {'created': '2020-05-18 21:59:38.000000000', 'message': 'NetApp SolidFire: Fix retype to SolidFire

Cinder can successfully retype an attached volume from SolidFire
to different backends, but the other way around was failing. This patch
fixes this issue, allowing retype operation for attached volumes from
other backends to SolidFire.

Change-Id: I75b828198a2af707d59120f29704a81ba9f2b553
Closes-bug: #1859652
(cherry picked from commit ca475a3dad993624920d2bcbe65bf98162f32e2f)
'}, {'created': '2020-05-20 19:30:25.000000000', 'message': 'NetApp SolidFire: Fix retype to SolidFire

Cinder can successfully retype an attached volume from SolidFire
to different backends, but the other way around was failing. This patch

commit_message:
NetApp SolidFire: Fix retype to SolidFire

Cinder can successfully retype an attached volume from SolidFire
to different backends, but the other way around was failing. This patch
fixes this issue, allowing retype operation for attached volumes from
other backends to SolidFire.

Change-Id: I75b828198a2af707d59120f29704a81ba9f2b553
Closes-bug: #1859652
(cherry picked from commit ca475a3dad993624920d2bcbe65bf98162f32e2f)
(cherry picked from commit 0a223ff59cab6cca7491d2e774957f5b9f06a550)

commit_message:
NetApp SolidFire: Fix pylint issues

This patch fixes pylint issues in both solidfire and test_solidfire
modules. New SolidFire patches shall succeed pylint checks.

Change-Id: I6695dbd0e0ae22cc4a820b3b6c179a13ace8a51a
(cherry picked from commit c91ef97096151846408a5a77ad71638651544d58)
(cherry picked from commit b80df085881e8004f5e07dbf595a085aedf64f7f)

(1 comment)

Hi Fernando,

I tested this patch in a DevStack environment by modifying the code to force the bug scenario:

1. Check already existing volume:

I modified this

            sf_volume_name = params['name']

to

            sf_volume_name = 'UUID-d69b769a-364a-4366-b014-5dfe07b67786'

in `_do_volume_create` method, while already having the volume named 'UUID-d69b769a-364a-4366-b014-5dfe07b67786' at the back end.

The driver successfully raised `DuplicateSfVolumeNames` exception [0].

2. Handle ReadTimeout:

I specified a very small ReadTimeout for CreateVolume API call in `_do_volume_create` method:

    response = self._issue_api_request(
                'CreateVolume', params, endpoint=endpoint, timeout=(30, 0.001))
￼
and modified `_issue_api_request` to specify the provided timeout upon POST.

It reached ReadTimeout as expected, and the driver successfully handled the exception and retrieved the created volume [1].

[0] http://paste.openstack.org/show/798747/
[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/798748/"}, {'account_id': 24921, 'date': '2020-10-06 17:49:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-06 00:52:05.000000000', 'message': "NetApp SolidFire: Fix duplicate volume when response is lost

The SolidFire driver retries API requests in case a connection
error occurrs. When network is unstable, there may be the
possibility that the SolidFire backend successfully receive
and process a create volume operation, but fail to deliver the
response back to the driver.

When this scenario occurrs, the SolidFire driver automatically
resends the request, creating a second volume and leaving a
duplicate unused. Although this doesn't affects
driver functionality at first moment (the volume id from the
cluster is always correctly associated to cinder provider id),
further operations may hit the unused volume, leading to
unexpeted hehavior.

This patch fixes this issue by checking for volume creation
right after a read timeout is detected, preventing
invalid API calls.

Closes-Bug: #1896112
Change-Id: I4383b691a8cc4aacb046332e418aafb88ba8ba56
"}, {'created': '2020-10-15 00:48:35.000000000', 'message': "NetApp SolidFire: Fix duplicate volume when API response is lost

The SolidFire driver retries API requests in case a connection
error occurrs. When network is unstable, there may be the
possibility that the SolidFire backend successfully receive
and process a create volume operation, but fail to deliver the
response back to the driver.

When this scenario occurrs, the SolidFire driver automatically
resends the request, creating a second volume and leaving a
duplicate unused. Although this doesn't affects
driver functionality at first moment (the volume id from the
cluster is always correctly associated to cinder provider id),
further operations may hit the unused volume, leading to
unexpeted hehavior.

This patch fixes this issue by:

1. Checking for volume creation right after a read timeout is 
detected, preventing invalid API calls.

2. Adding option ´sf_volume_create_timeout´ to the SolidFire 
driver, to allow users to set the appropriate timeout value for 
their environment.


Closes-Bug: #1896112
Change-Id: I4383b691a8cc4aacb046332e418aafb88ba8ba56
"}, {'created': '2020-10-15 00:48:46.000000000', 'message': "NetApp SolidFire: Fix duplicate volume when API response is lost

This patch fixes this issue by:

commit_message:
NetApp SolidFire: Fix duplicate volume when API response is lost

The SolidFire driver retries API requests in case a connection
error occurrs. When network is unstable, there may be the
possibility that the SolidFire backend successfully receive
and process a create volume operation, but fail to deliver the
response back to the driver.

When this scenario occurrs, the SolidFire driver automatically
resends the request, creating a second volume and leaving a
duplicate unused. Although this doesn't affect
driver functionality at first moment (the volume id from the
cluster is always correctly associated to cinder provider id),
further operations may hit the unused volume, leading to
unexpected hehavior.

This patch fixes this issue by:

1. Checking if the volume name already exists in the
backend before trying to create it. Volume creation will
raise a exception and abort in case of a volume is found.

2. Checking for volume creation right after a read timeout is
detected, preventing invalid API calls.

3. Adding option ´sf_volume_create_timeout´ to the SolidFire
driver, to allow users to set the appropriate timeout value for
their environment.

Closes-Bug: #1896112
Change-Id: I4383b691a8cc4aacb046332e418aafb88ba8ba56

commit_message:
NetApp SolidFire: Fix clone and request timeout issues

Users are experiencing timeout issues in certain environments, mostly
when volumes are too big (ie. multi-terabyte volumes), due to poor
network performance or upgrade issues that revolve around the SolidFire
cluster. A viable solution is to make driver timeout values
configurable in cinder.conf, so users can set these timeouts
according to their needs.

This patch adds two timeout settings to the SolidFire driver
(for cloning operation and globally to all api requests), to
allow users to set the appropriate timeouts for their environment.

Closes-Bug: #1898587
Change-Id: Ie330c76a5db0ea76d4fed5a6ae7b8736dadc8591
(cherry picked from commit c607a82a992ebe63b4ae005746f2b9e8104bb3a0)

[{'created': '2020-11-09 21:56:55.000000000', 'message': "Focal fails to add repo before key

I'm not sure why this isn't failing in the gate, but locally I get
100% fail if I don't add the release key before the apt-add-
repository. This seems to be a change in focal as it worked fine
for me before upgrade.

This moves the key fetch/add before the repo.

Change-Id: I50d840986d630af033a7a3e47bb1e9c52e889791
"}]
commit_message:
Focal fails to add repo before key

I'm not sure why this isn't failing in the gate, but locally I get
100% fail if I don't add the release key before the apt-add-
repository. This seems to be a change in focal as it worked fine
for me before upgrade.

This moves the key fetch/add before the repo.

Change-Id: I50d840986d630af033a7a3e47bb1e9c52e889791

When we try to show a volume transfer as a non-admin, it doesn't work.
The problem is that the 'all_tenants' key isn't parsable by the DB,
we remove it for admins but not for non-admins.
Since all_tenants is just used to redirect to the correct db method,
it should be removed for non-admins as well.

commit_message:
Fix: show volume transfer by name for non-admins

When we try to show a volume transfer as a non-admin, it doesn't work.
The problem is that the 'all_tenants' key isn't parsable by the DB,
we remove it for admins but not for non-admins.
Since all_tenants is just used to redirect to the correct db method,
it should be removed for non-admins as well.

Change-Id: I79362ee6b819c6472fa5e69ea1a85a1185dda5a3
Closes-Bug: #1884268
(cherry picked from commit 1f733cdf2dcf014b4391ebd733693d3cbcb1f848)

commit_message:
Fix service-get-log to respect server filters

The service-get-log command returns always the same output ignoring
the 'server' filters.

This fix avoid returning all the results when using the 'server' filter.

How to reproduce:
'cinder  --os-volume-api-version 3.52 service-get-log
--server localhost.localdomain@cep'
return the same output than
'cinder  --os-volume-api-version 3.52 service-get-log'

Also includes squash to fix unit test from:
Fix service_get_log tests
Change-Id: I633e67efa4869816786011c3d093dc81e177010c

Change-Id: Iecb3faad9270f969185089cc291127b340483a46
(cherry picked from commit e793c5e24982e2f0d2bc3a681f5a1e3912af08b0)
(cherry picked from commit 0f6b4cdcd4fc0fd4e6fe0e40772ad7d19d46f83c)

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 4146, 'name': 'Clark Boylan', 'email': 'cboylan@sapwetik.org', 'username': 'cboylan'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 24162, 'name': 'Sorin Sbârnea', 'display_name': 'zbr', 'email': 'ssbarnea@redhat.com', 'username': 'ssbarnea', 'status': 'do not feed the troll 🥕'}]

[{'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2020-11-13 19:15:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2020-11-13 19:20:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2020-11-14 09:28:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2020-11-14 18:48:19.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

The point of this change is that a version range should end on an exclusive inequality for its upper bound, because inclusive inequalities have potential side effects. But it sounds like we'll just need to rip all this out when the next version of pip comes out, so I don't feel like arguing the point."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-13 19:15:09.000000000', 'message': 'Correct version range of ansible with ansible-lint

Use an exclusive "strictly less than" inequality when defining the
upper bound for the ansible package in the linters testenv deps
list, so that ansible 2.9 will not be chosen.

Change-Id: I5444c7633f880c050284b0395ec01a3abf0592f6
'}]
commit_message:
Correct version range of ansible with ansible-lint

Use an exclusive "strictly less than" inequality when defining the
upper bound for the ansible package in the linters testenv deps
list, so that ansible 2.9 will not be chosen.

Change-Id: I5444c7633f880c050284b0395ec01a3abf0592f6

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-11 09:56:44.000000000', 'message': 'Remove [database]connection defaulting

The config documentation says that the [database]connection config is
defaulted to None but in reality the nova code defaulted it to a local
sqlite database. This is clearly wrong as:

* Nobody wants to run nova with sqlite outside of a test env

* The nova-compute service should never have DB credentials configured

So this patch makes sure that nova does not change the default of this
config option.

Change-Id: I81560b3ba3dbaccdb90b32ed1a3c4ffd8a6283a6
Closes-Bug: #1903824
'}]
commit_message:
Remove [database]connection defaulting

The config documentation says that the [database]connection config is
defaulted to None but in reality the nova code defaulted it to a local
sqlite database. This is clearly wrong as:

* Nobody wants to run nova with sqlite outside of a test env

* The nova-compute service should never have DB credentials configured

So this patch makes sure that nova does not change the default of this
config option.

Change-Id: I81560b3ba3dbaccdb90b32ed1a3c4ffd8a6283a6
Closes-Bug: #1903824

commit_message:
enable ussuri cloud archive on ubuntu bionic

This change updates bionic installs to use the
ussuri cloud archive to enable the use of libvirt 6.0.0.
This is required to prevent a libvirt bug that causes intermittent
failures for the tempest test_live_block_migration_paused testcase.

Change-Id: I9c395c2b5fdfe6ad9a43477280e88e9a9b34f057
Related-Bug: 1901739

Congratulations, you've proposed your first change in OpenDev.

Your submission will now be tested automatically by Zuul, our gatekeeper,
and reviewed by other friendly developers. They will give you feedback and
may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches often take days (and sometimes weeks) to get reviewed, so be
patient. Don't hesitate to ask for help, and answer questions about your
work promptly if you can. The more you get to know reviewers and get to be
known by them, the smoother the review and approval process will become. The
fastest way to accomplish this is by reviewing other proposed changes
yourself: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for participating in OpenDev, we look forward to seeing you
around.

commit_message:
Remove support for OVS versions <= 2.8.2

After OVS 2.8.2 is released all tables shoud have the external_ids
column. Unit tests now expect external_ids parameters too.

Change-Id: I7f244be2a1991cb39f4df6f1a9f12b19ac7e1c61
Signed-off-by: Elvira García Ruiz <egarciar@redhat.com>

When using RHSM Service (deployment/rhsm/rhsm-baremetal-ansible.yaml) based
registration of the overcloud nodes and enabling the KSM using
NovaComputeEnableKsm=True the overcloud deployment will fail because the
RHSM registration and the ksm task run as host_prep task. The handling
of enable/disable ksm is now handled in deploy step 1.

Closes-Bug: #1904184

Change-Id: I75a59f3d4b640f3146f2a865eff8be3f1383e078
'}]
commit_message:
Move enable ksm on compute node to deploy step 1

When using RHSM Service (deployment/rhsm/rhsm-baremetal-ansible.yaml) based
registration of the overcloud nodes and enabling the KSM using
NovaComputeEnableKsm=True the overcloud deployment will fail because the
RHSM registration and the ksm task run as host_prep task. The handling
of enable/disable ksm is now handled in deploy step 1.

Closes-Bug: #1904184

Change-Id: I75a59f3d4b640f3146f2a865eff8be3f1383e078

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-12 03:35:24.000000000', 'message': 'Fixing the dependency for sriov_config service

Some of the 3rd party vswitch providers does not follow the regular ovs db and
vswitchd is split and it is implementation specific. But in general the openvswitch.service
will be used as base even for the 3rd party providers. Moving the dependency from
vswitchd to openvswitch make sriov_config.service to work with other providers.

Closes-Bug: #1903550

Change-Id: Id23051e12dad8d4b84df1821e670661a0891e780
(cherry picked from commit 87702f33c0dd6902de016e4bb18d4ffde41d74ae)
'}]
commit_message:
Fixing the dependency for sriov_config service

Some of the 3rd party vswitch providers does not follow the regular ovs db and
vswitchd is split and it is implementation specific. But in general the openvswitch.service
will be used as base even for the 3rd party providers. Moving the dependency from
vswitchd to openvswitch make sriov_config.service to work with other providers.

Closes-Bug: #1903550

Change-Id: Id23051e12dad8d4b84df1821e670661a0891e780
(cherry picked from commit 87702f33c0dd6902de016e4bb18d4ffde41d74ae)

There are some cases when the return value of the ${HOSTNAME) variable
is different from {{ ansible_hostname }}, especially when tls-everywhere
framework is involved.
This purpose of this review is to fix the FFU section that needs to know
the hostname to find the running container on the delegated host.

Change-Id: Ib269a25fcf0db66ad3144c3e20031a4da6e2e2fb
Closes-Bug: #1903537
(cherry picked from commit 4e0f61d9e2affd107b0ac9a195e23f2a71083383)
'}]
commit_message:
Properly compute hostname when looking for the ceph-mon container

There are some cases when the return value of the ${HOSTNAME) variable
is different from {{ ansible_hostname }}, especially when tls-everywhere
framework is involved.
This purpose of this review is to fix the FFU section that needs to know
the hostname to find the running container on the delegated host.

Change-Id: Ib269a25fcf0db66ad3144c3e20031a4da6e2e2fb
Closes-Bug: #1903537
(cherry picked from commit 4e0f61d9e2affd107b0ac9a195e23f2a71083383)

commit_message:
objects: Remove Agent, AgentList

These are no longer used given the removal of the XenAPI driver and
os-agents API. Remove the objects themselves.

Change-Id: Iddb6489e11dea1d3079292caf7848217df706ca6
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Reduce number of processes on small systems

Even the most modest 4C/8T system would run with the maximum 16 processes
due to the calculation being VCPU*2.

We devide amount of CPUs to number of threads for hyperthreaded CPUs

Change-Id: Ia0304a9314029b5678a3f730d662be6580b17a77

(1 comment)

Hi! Thanks for proposing a bug fix. Could you please provide at least some unit test coverage for the patch? 

@Sean from vif handling perspective is it OK to store the old vif type in the system_metadata or do we have that information stored somewhere already?'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2020-09-14 11:18:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(5 comments)

we have had a long standing backloag itme to adopt multiple port binding for live migration. as part of that workflow the vif objects are stored in the livemigrate_data object as ovo

if this was adopted for all migration we would just move the vifs filed to the base migrate_data object instead.

with that said we are already using multiple port binding for cross cell resize so i think we could just extend that to all resizes at this point. 


if we must store this info and cant store it in the migrate_data for some reason then migration_context would be the next most approiate location.

the only reason i can see to use system metadata would be for backports and even then i would prefer to see it stored in the port profile instead. we already update the prot profile with the "migrating_to" filed we coudl stash any additional info we needed there too and rely on it being cleared when we clear the migration info.

the current patch does not handel deleting the vifs form the system metadata on errors correctly.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2020-09-14 12:16:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

by the way migrating between backends with different vif types was only ever really supported for live migration.

we have never really supported it for other backend meaning that if you have a mixed deployment you had to use host aggrates to prevent the migration form crossing between the network backends

so im not sure the bug is valid as a bug so much as a feature request.'}, {'account_id': 28910, 'date': '2020-09-15 02:08:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > Hi! Thanks for proposing a bug fix. Could you please provide at
 > least some unit test coverage for the patch?
 > 
 > @Sean from vif handling perspective is it OK to store the old vif
 > type in the system_metadata or do we have that information stored
 > somewhere already?

Thanks for recommendations'}, {'account_id': 28910, 'date': '2020-09-15 02:30:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> by the way migrating between backends with different vif types was
 > only ever really supported for live migration.
 > 
 > we have never really supported it for other backend meaning that if
 > you have a mixed deployment you had to use host aggrates to prevent
 > the migration form crossing between the network backends
 > 
 > so im not sure the bug is valid as a bug so much as a feature
 > request.

Hi,
Migrating action can be triggered by admin. So, why can not admin migrate VM to specified destination host ignore aggregate, network backend,... Besides that, shutoff VM can not use live migrate if want to move VM to specified destination host'}, {'account_id': 28910, 'date': '2020-09-15 03:20:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Hi Sean Mooney,
"The only reason i can see to use system metadata would be for backports and even then i would prefer to see it stored in the port profile instead."
=> You 're right, I use system metadata for backports (can not use migrate_data, migration_context). I 'll consider to store in port profile follow your suggestion'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2020-09-15 18:52:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

so i need to move unplugging of the vif on the source
for https://review.opendev.org/#/c/602432 to here
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/e0f088c95d05e9cf32d4af4c7cfc20566b17f8e1/nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py#L10357 in migrate_disk_and_power_off
which is called form  _resize_instance here
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/e0f088c95d05e9cf32d4af4c7cfc20566b17f8e1/nova/compute/manager.py#L5584

if i do that we can make remove calling unplug_vifs from 
confirm_migration here https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/e0f088c95d05e9cf32d4af4c7cfc20566b17f8e1/nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py#L1665

the current nova behavior is relying on libvirt to unplug the interface from ovs when hybrid_plug=false in teh vif:binding_details.

when i delegate port pluggin to os-vif in https://review.opendev.org/#/c/602432/16 i need to expclitly call unplug_vifs to maintain the same behavior for reverts.

so perhaps that is a better fix for you bug as well.'}, {'account_id': 28910, 'date': '2020-09-16 02:19:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> so i need to move unplugging of the vif on the source
 > for https://review.opendev.org/#/c/602432 to here
 > https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/e0f088c95d05e9cf32d4af4c7cfc20566b17f8e1/nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py#L10357
 > in migrate_disk_and_power_off
 > which is called form  _resize_instance here
 > https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/e0f088c95d05e9cf32d4af4c7cfc20566b17f8e1/nova/compute/manager.py#L5584
 > 
 > if i do that we can make remove calling unplug_vifs from
 > confirm_migration here https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/e0f088c95d05e9cf32d4af4c7cfc20566b17f8e1/nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py#L1665
 > 
 > the current nova behavior is relying on libvirt to unplug the
 > interface from ovs when hybrid_plug=false in teh vif:binding_details.
 > 
 > when i delegate port pluggin to os-vif in https://review.opendev.org/#/c/602432/16
 > i need to expclitly call unplug_vifs to maintain the same behavior
 > for reverts.
 > 
 > so perhaps that is a better fix for you bug as well.

If call unplug vif before confirming to resize, you 're going to calling recreate vif at where ? when user revert resizing."}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2020-09-16 10:30:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

yes when we revert resize we would need to call plug_vifs

but finish_revert_resize already does this
it calls _create_guest_with_network

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/e0f088c95d05e9cf32d4af4c7cfc20566b17f8e1/nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py#L10681-L10683

and that call plug_vifs
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/e0f088c95d05e9cf32d4af4c7cfc20566b17f8e1/nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py#L6704'}, {'account_id': 28910, 'date': '2020-09-16 10:36:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Nice, I consider we can use this solution for backports ?'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2020-09-16 17:15:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

i have asked on the nova irc channel and let you know what they say.

i think this should be backportable.
with that said assuming the core team agrees woudl you be ok if i reqorked this patch and they rebased my other patch on top.

so this patch would cover the moving of unplug_vifs to resize_instance/migrate_disk_and_power_off to close bug  #1895220
and then my other patch would be rebased on top to resove the current race it is hitting in the gate since we are not unplugin the vifs when we need to.

if you ok wiht that ill update this patch so that i maintians you as the author and add a co authored by since you filed https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1895220 and this intial attempt to fix the issue'}, {'account_id': 28910, 'date': '2020-09-17 01:46:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> i have asked on the nova irc channel and let you know what they
 > say.
 > 
 > i think this should be backportable.
 > with that said assuming the core team agrees woudl you be ok if i
 > reqorked this patch and they rebased my other patch on top.
 > 
 > so this patch would cover the moving of unplug_vifs to

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-14 03:44:29.000000000', 'message': 'Fix unplugging VIF when migrate/resize/rebuild VM
between hosts have difference VIF type

"Closes-Bug: #1895220"

Change-Id: I2c195df5fcf844c0587933b5b5995bdca1a3ebed
'}, {'created': '2020-09-14 04:12:44.000000000', 'message': 'Fix unplugging VIF when migrate/resize/rebuild VM

When migrating/resizing/rebuilding VM to destination
host that has VIF type difference from source VIF
type, it goes fail due to exception in unplugging
VIF on source host after user perform a confirmation
action.

Change-Id: I2c195df5fcf844c0587933b5b5995bdca1a3ebed
Closes-Bug: #1895220
'}, {'created': '2020-09-14 04:54:27.000000000', 'message': 'Fix unplugging VIF when migrate/resize/rebuild VM

When migrating/resizing/rebuilding VM to destination
host that has VIF type difference from source VIF
type, it goes fail due to exception in unplugging
VIF on source host after user perform a confirmation
action.

Change-Id: I2c195df5fcf844c0587933b5b5995bdca1a3ebed
Closes-Bug: #1895220
'}, {'created': '2020-09-17 17:00:39.000000000', 'message': 'Fix unplugging VIF when migrate/resize VM

When migrating/resizing VM to destination
host that has VIF type difference from source VIF
type, it fails due to exception in unplugging
VIF on source host after user perform a confirmation
action.

This change unplugs the vifs in resize_instance and
waps the call to unplug in confirm with an try except
block. the call to unplug_vifs in confirm is not removed
to support rolling upgrades but a todo is added to remove
it after the Wallaby release.

Change-Id: I2c195df5fcf844c0587933b5b5995bdca1a3ebed
Closes-Bug: #1895220
'}, {'created': '2020-09-24 18:52:03.000000000', 'message': 'Fix unplugging VIF when migrate/resize VM

When migrating/resizing VM to destination
host that has VIF type difference from source VIF
type, it fails due to exception in unplugging
VIF on source host after user perform a confirmation
action.

This change unplugs the vifs in resize_instance and
wraps the call to unplug in confirm with an try except
block. the call to unplug_vifs in confirm is not removed
to support rolling upgrades but a todo is added to remove
it after the Wallaby release.

Change-Id: I2c195df5fcf844c0587933b5b5995bdca1a3ebed
Closes-Bug: #1895220
'}, {'created': '2020-10-01 14:49:27.000000000', 'message': 'Fix unplugging VIF when migrate/resize VM

When migrating/resizing VM to destination
host that has VIF type difference from source VIF
type, it fails due to exception in unplugging
VIF on source host after user perform a confirmation
action.

This change unplugs the vifs in resize_instance and
wraps the call to unplug in confirm with an try except

commit_message:
Fix unplugging VIF when migrate/resize VM

When migrating/resizing VM to destination
host that has VIF type difference from source VIF
type, it fails due to exception in unplugging
VIF on source host after user perform a confirmation
action.

This change unplugs the vifs in resize_instance and
wraps the call to unplug in confirm with an try except
block. the call to unplug_vifs in confirm is not removed
to support rolling upgrades but a todo is added to remove
it after the Wallaby release.

Change-Id: I2c195df5fcf844c0587933b5b5995bdca1a3ebed
Closes-Bug: #1895220

[{'created': '2020-11-05 16:48:04.000000000', 'message': 'Fix the compute RPC 5.12 issue

In I147bf4d95e6d86ff1f967a8ce37260730f21d236 we added a new argument for
the rebuild_instance() RPC method. Unfortunately, we missed to that it
needs to be optional for older versions.

Adding a default none value for it so rolling upgrades would work.

Change-Id: I59c5e56b00114fea5ec19fa63ec73f032dc3bd5c
Closes-Bug: #1902925
(cherry picked from commit 8d9f298f4c48e32bc625c7e2f47d47e4277ec064)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the compute RPC 5.12 issue

In I147bf4d95e6d86ff1f967a8ce37260730f21d236 we added a new argument for
the rebuild_instance() RPC method. Unfortunately, we missed to that it
needs to be optional for older versions.

Adding a default none value for it so rolling upgrades would work.

Change-Id: I59c5e56b00114fea5ec19fa63ec73f032dc3bd5c
Closes-Bug: #1902925
(cherry picked from commit 8d9f298f4c48e32bc625c7e2f47d47e4277ec064)

commit_message:
api: Remove 'os-agents' API

This was only useful with XenAPI and can therefore be removed.

Change-Id: I9512f605dd2b3b0e88c951ed086250d57056303d
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Dep's should be restricted by upper-constraints

Tox trying to install latest versions for building docs which may
not be supported by stable and lower branches, so should be
restricted by respective version's upper-constraints.txt

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-12 05:21:01.000000000', 'message': "NFS: Fix extend fails after blockRebase

When we create a snapshot of attached volume and delete it, nova
performs a blockRebase operation which merges the base volume file
into the snapshot file.
This changes the volume's file name hence making it inaccessible
since the current code points to the original volume file.
This is fixed by storing the snapshot file name during blockRebase
and using that name while performing the extend operation to point
to the correct filename.

Change-Id: I3cdc900541edf5fe3264a36b731b6073614ac080
Closes-Bug: #1903319
"}]
commit_message:
NFS: Fix extend fails after blockRebase

When we create a snapshot of attached volume and delete it, nova
performs a blockRebase operation which merges the base volume file
into the snapshot file.
This changes the volume's file name hence making it inaccessible
since the current code points to the original volume file.
This is fixed by storing the snapshot file name during blockRebase
and using that name while performing the extend operation to point
to the correct filename.

Change-Id: I3cdc900541edf5fe3264a36b731b6073614ac080
Closes-Bug: #1903319

commit_message:
Fix missing vnfc resource updating on vnf respawn via SOL003-style Heal API call

Note: "SOL003-style" means a Heal API call without passing vnfcInstanceId
as the comment in FT source code states.

Related-Bug: #1886213
Change-Id: Ia6fe6b3179703f23266b71dd6595b75d1b801191

commit_message:
[Unity]: Supports QoS keys 'total_iops_sec' and 'total_bytes_sec'

Supports QoS keys 'total_iops_sec' and 'total_bytes_sec'.

Change-Id: Ieb9438ccb42465d67a0d41588877403323a23b16
Closes-bug: #1875324

commit_message:
Include ovs_driver and sriov_driver classes in base neutron profile

This classes are needed to configure things related to the
sriov or ovs mechanism drivers on neutron server like e.g.
vnic_type_blacklist.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/757747/

Change-Id: Ia014cb098591a28ddfcd8b3dff536fa2337d23a8
(cherry picked from commit 3f2171acbd1ad842026f96f89c910a7da5e77f52)

commit_message:
chore(job): adds publish job to OpenStack-Helm

This patch set adds a job to post publish the chart package to
tarballs.opendev.org so it can be used as a helm repo.

Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>

commit_message:
Fix ceilometer_agent_compute healthcheck

Health check of Ceilometer compute agent does not check connection to RabbitMQ,
but connection to Redis, hence it should not use the RpcPort parameter.

Change-Id: Ic573d5a1fa1d695d19934246fe4d48c0d3065eb1
(cherry picked from commit d63d2c63abf9d9b84057acc4e0efef687ae1a595)

messages: [{'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2020-11-12 13:08:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch stable/ussuri.'}, {'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2020-11-12 13:09:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-11-13 15:23:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-11-13 19:37:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-12 13:08:33.000000000', 'message': 'Generic cluster properties support

Sometimes in certain environments we need to set specific cluster
properties to tune the control plane to that specific situation.
Tested with:
    tripleo::profile::base::pacemaker::cluster_properties:
      test:
        property: shutdown-escalation
        value: 6m
        tries: 5
      test2:
        property: priority-fencing-delay
        value: 10
        tries: 5
      test3:
        property: startup-fencing
        value: false
        tries: 5

And obtained the correctly set properties:
[root@controller-0 hieradata]# pcs property
Cluster Properties:
...
 priority-fencing-delay: 10
 shutdown-escalation: 6m
 startup-fencing: false

Change-Id: Iebd1ae24a69fb0bdc5f7f7c75a1a79e9c608ba96
(cherry picked from commit 056ace0c8cac6089948d2752825a5c3ebdd1424c)
(cherry picked from commit ccb419ceb5dca6fbd4e03fbf67eb9c01fc6158c3)
'}]
commit_message:
Generic cluster properties support

Sometimes in certain environments we need to set specific cluster
properties to tune the control plane to that specific situation.
Tested with:
    tripleo::profile::base::pacemaker::cluster_properties:
      test:
        property: shutdown-escalation
        value: 6m
        tries: 5
      test2:
        property: priority-fencing-delay
        value: 10
        tries: 5
      test3:
        property: startup-fencing
        value: false
        tries: 5

And obtained the correctly set properties:
[root@controller-0 hieradata]# pcs property
Cluster Properties:
...
 priority-fencing-delay: 10
 shutdown-escalation: 6m
 startup-fencing: false

Change-Id: Iebd1ae24a69fb0bdc5f7f7c75a1a79e9c608ba96
(cherry picked from commit 056ace0c8cac6089948d2752825a5c3ebdd1424c)
(cherry picked from commit ccb419ceb5dca6fbd4e03fbf67eb9c01fc6158c3)

commit_message:
Add CinderBackupOptVolumes parameter

This adds a new parameter 'CinderBackupOptVolumes' to allow
cinder-backup to mount extra volumes.

Change-Id: Ide6d464be4a13457debfeceb61e5255c06b67808

commit_message:
Fix ansible network corruption while fetching repo.

On private cloud with 3ctl and 1comp I had a lot of false positive
while trying to push the gating repo targz to the overcloud.

The retry prevents this from happening.

Change-Id: Ie0d2dcbe660ad00a10a5400db7898a016ef22a1d

commit_message:
Replace deprecated UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE variable

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is deprecated and TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is
the new environment variable name that replaces it [1].

This allows to use upper-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

[1] https://zuul-ci.org/docs/zuul-jobs/python-roles.html#rolevar-tox.tox_constraints_file
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/722814/

Change-Id: I66730e9d6b515318cd2d4f69473ff1253b8b5d31

subject: Allow to specify a nic for the VIPs
messages: [{'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2020-11-09 16:14:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2020-11-12 12:47:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-11-13 15:25:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-09 16:14:55.000000000', 'message': "Allow to specify a nic for the VIPs

This review allows the operator to specify a nic to bind to a VIP to.
It does so in two different ways:
1) Via a global 'tripleo::pacemaker::force_nic' hiera key.
For example setting 'tripleo::pacemaker::force_nic: lo'
will make sure all VIPs are added to the 'lo' network interface.

2) The global setting can be overriden via a custom hiera
hash called 'force_vip_nic_overrides' so that we can
override the binding nic for specific VIPs. For example:

  force_vip_nic_overrides:
    redis_vip: vip-test-nic
    ovn_dbs_vip: vip-test-nic

Will make sure that the redis_vip and the ovn_dbs_vip will
be bound to the 'vip-test-nic'.

Tested with:
  tripleo::pacemaker::force_nic: lo
  force_vip_nic_overrides:
    redis_vip: vip-test-nic
    ovn_dbs_vip: vip-test-nic

And correctly got all VIPs running on lo:
1: lo    inet 192.168.24.9/32 scope global lo\       valid_lft forever preferred_lft forever
1: lo    inet 172.23.1.9/32 scope global lo\       valid_lft forever preferred_lft forever

except for redis and ovn_dbs which are on the vip-test-nic:
5: vip-test-nic    inet 172.25.1.7/32 scope global vip-test-nic\       valid_lft forever preferred_lft forever

Note: The interface is intentionally kept in hiera as this change
will only be needed whenever BGP runs on all nodes and advertises the
VIPs across the ASN (i.e. we do not want to make it very exposed just
yet)

Change-Id: Iaa2676655d97a66237a3bd6066985f87d3565a4d
(cherry picked from commit 881084d6c8c7065f5685c2293458abf8a95fd735)
"}, {'created': '2020-11-12 12:47:17.000000000', 'message': "Allow to specify a nic for the VIPs

2) The global setting can be overriden via a custom hiera

override the binding nic for specific VIPs. For example:

  force_vip_nic_overrides:

    ovn_dbs_vip: vip-test-nic

Will make sure that the redis_vip and the ovn_dbs_vip will

Tested with:

And correctly got all VIPs running on lo:
1: lo    inet 192.168.24.9/32 scope global lo\       valid_lft forever preferred_lft forever
1: lo    inet 172.23.1.9/32 scope global lo\       valid_lft forever preferred_lft forever

except for redis and ovn_dbs which are on the vip-test-nic:
5: vip-test-nic    inet 172.25.1.7/32 scope global vip-test-nic\       valid_lft forever preferred_lft forever

Note: The interface is intentionally kept in hiera as this change
will only be needed whenever BGP runs on all nodes and advertises the

commit_message:
Allow to specify a nic for the VIPs

This review allows the operator to specify a nic to bind to a VIP to.
It does so in two different ways:
1) Via a global 'tripleo::pacemaker::force_nic' hiera key.
For example setting 'tripleo::pacemaker::force_nic: lo'
will make sure all VIPs are added to the 'lo' network interface.

2) The global setting can be overriden via a custom hiera
hash called 'force_vip_nic_overrides' so that we can
override the binding nic for specific VIPs. For example:

  force_vip_nic_overrides:
    redis_vip: vip-test-nic
    ovn_dbs_vip: vip-test-nic

Will make sure that the redis_vip and the ovn_dbs_vip will
be bound to the 'vip-test-nic'.

Tested with:
  tripleo::pacemaker::force_nic: lo
  force_vip_nic_overrides:
    redis_vip: vip-test-nic
    ovn_dbs_vip: vip-test-nic

And correctly got all VIPs running on lo:
1: lo    inet 192.168.24.9/32 scope global lo\       valid_lft forever preferred_lft forever
1: lo    inet 172.23.1.9/32 scope global lo\       valid_lft forever preferred_lft forever

except for redis and ovn_dbs which are on the vip-test-nic:
5: vip-test-nic    inet 172.25.1.7/32 scope global vip-test-nic\       valid_lft forever preferred_lft forever

Note: The interface is intentionally kept in hiera as this change
will only be needed whenever BGP runs on all nodes and advertises the
VIPs across the ASN (i.e. we do not want to make it very exposed just
yet)

Change-Id: Iaa2676655d97a66237a3bd6066985f87d3565a4d
(cherry picked from commit 881084d6c8c7065f5685c2293458abf8a95fd735)

commit_message:
Build containers for single consumer job

Make standalone job build containers when there is one single
consumer job in layout. Do not run content provider jobs in
this case.

Change-Id: I994d16125d8cc03f522f3e4be536b76a35a102a5
(cherry picked from commit ddae15404ec67974cc1068db226b5758783dc64d)

commit_message:
replace the "hide_hypervisor_id" to "hw:hide_hypervisor_id"

When we use the flavor extra_specs "hide_hypervisor_id" in
AggregateInstanceExtraSpecsFilter, then will retrun False.
So we need correct the extra_specs.

Change-Id: I9d8d8c3a30cf6da7e8fb48374347e069ab075df2
Closes-Bug: 1841932
(cherry picked from commit bf488a8630702160021b5848bf6e86fbb8015205)

commit_message:
docs: Resolve issue with deprecated extra specs

The warning directive should look like so:

  .. warning::

      Some text here.

However, we weren't indenting the body correctly, meaning the directive
appeared to have no content. Resolve this.

Change-Id: Ib93cbd7c5ba64e678393554ba77f568efdb2608a
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 8a2ed8a78ef71e36333d3a1ec4fa30a2c2d21651)

commit_message:
Disable cinder services on neutron grenade jobs

We don't need it to test cinder in our jobs.
This patch disables Cinder in grenade jobs. If that will be ok
we can do the same for scenario jobs also.

This patch also enables br-ex-tcpdump and br-int-flows
services in the grenade jobs as it was missing there and
may be useful during debugging some failures of those jobs
in the future.

Change-Id: If490da1f7e695564a65cabf95f25c72f7639ae19

'}]
commit_message:
Kill sudo once we don't need it anymore

Calling "sudo -k" ensures we don't let dangling sudo session in the
current shell.

Change-Id: Ibe324afe2d251f5b71dedc02230bbcfa13888996

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-19 09:24:50.000000000', 'message': "Handle disabled CPU features to fix live migration failures

When performing a live migration between hypervisors running
libvirt, where one or more CPU features are disabled, nova does
not take account of these. This results in migration failures
as none of the available hypervisor targets appear compatible.

This patch ensures that the libvirt 'disable' poicy is taken
account of, at least in a basic sense, by explicitly ignoring
items flagged in this way when enumerating CPU features.

Closes-Bug: #1898715
Change-Id: Iaf14ca97cfac99dd280d1114123f2d4bb6292b63
(cherry picked from commit eeeca4ceff576beaa8558360c8a6a165d716f996)
"}]
commit_message:
Handle disabled CPU features to fix live migration failures

When performing a live migration between hypervisors running
libvirt, where one or more CPU features are disabled, nova does
not take account of these. This results in migration failures
as none of the available hypervisor targets appear compatible.

This patch ensures that the libvirt 'disable' poicy is taken
account of, at least in a basic sense, by explicitly ignoring
items flagged in this way when enumerating CPU features.

Closes-Bug: #1898715
Change-Id: Iaf14ca97cfac99dd280d1114123f2d4bb6292b63
(cherry picked from commit eeeca4ceff576beaa8558360c8a6a165d716f996)

commit_message:
Add stable/victoria job

Add job testing stable tempest plugin with latest stable branch as we're
supposed to work fine with all previous versions. Also clean up older
job definitions as some fixes got backported to those branches.

Change-Id: I37a74cd11187c48931cf8e306ae2c58e8c3bfb18

commit_message:
Add htaccess file

This is to allow for the redirects necessary in
the upcoming reorg of the CDG. In particular, the
'app-' prefixes to many filenames will need to go
as many appendices will be merged into the main
body.

Redirects have been tested successfully locally.

Change-Id: Iec83b2beefdbaca8a325d3a6c4b8e61e0fd076be

commit_message:
Replace deprecated UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE variable

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is deprecated and TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is
the new environment variable name that replaces it [1].

This allows to use upper-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

[1] https://zuul-ci.org/docs/zuul-jobs/python-roles.html#rolevar-tox.tox_constraints_file
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/722814/

Change-Id: Ifbc34a7ed715a058489afa54aa78572e5f56028f

yes the limits came form the kernel vhost module but some disto kernels have backports that raised that

commit_message:
add [libvirt]/max_queues config option

This change adds a max_queues config option to allow
operators to set the maximium number of virtio queue
pairs that can be allocated to a virtio network
interface.

Change-Id: I9abe783a9a9443c799e7c74a57cc30835f679a01
Closes-Bug: #1847367
(cherry picked from commit 0e6aac3c2d97c999451da50537df6a0cbddeb4a6)

commit_message:
(WIP) - Avoid executing the ceph-ansible client role

This change introduces the 'ceph_ansible_exclude_list' variable
that avoid executing the ceph-ansible client role excluding the
'clients' group provided in the overcloud inventory.
This variable is set by default in tripleo-heat-templates, where
the operator can exclude this role using the exposed boolean.

Change-Id: Ia1d629b13d87debb4d3d297d5dbfcd31a6ef4c3d

commit_message:
Add tripleo_multipathd role

A new tripleo_multipathd role is responsible for preparing and
configuring an overcloud node to run multipathd in a container.
- Host prep tasks ensure any existing multipathd service is disabled
  on the host.
- /etc/multipath.conf configuration is controlled via ansible variables
  supplied by tripleo's OS::TripleO::Services::Multipathd service.
- The multipathd container is restarted whenever the configuration
  changes.

Change-Id: Icf9faff31d83f0ea77d00a59a53d6ad36b06da4f
(cherry picked from commit 1af2cde366e42ab8509b4cd2a77a3e8058e175df)

commit_message:
Build containers for single consumer job

Make standalone job build containers when there is one single
consumer job in layout. Do not run content provider jobs in
this case.

Change-Id: I6d47714e2de5f24ef3f47a26bbf5510b87928cc2

commit_message:
Set dhcp_domain for all nova services

This is required for nova-compute so move to init.pp from metadata.pp and set
DEFAULT/dhcp_domain (which nova should undeprecate) vs api/dhcp_domain.

Change-Id: If6a26527a737a7184ebddd5b4bc346d64827e9e3
Related-bug: #1903908
Related-bug: #1832537

commit_message:
Don't include nova::db in the base class

Currently we include nova::db in two different layers, the base class
(nova) and the classes for each service(ex. nova::api), but this is
redundant and causes unnecesarry db credentials stored in nova.conf in
compute nodes.

Change-Id: I8d0282d665db98a785706ced17e29a3788050b03

Remove six

Replace the following items with Python 3 style code.

- six.PY2
- six.add_metaclass
- six.string_types
- six.text_type
- six.moves

commit_message:
Fix preflight validation

When using net-config-override, objects can exist without a 'name' key.
The validation fails with KeyError: 'name'. This change only considers
objects with 'name' key present.

Change-Id: I77a30b13e4459ed3dae64a23b128433639eec5b4

commit_message:
Add heat container image support

Before we enable it by default, we should properly handle providing a
specific version in as part of the CI jobs.

NOTE: Upgrades will need to be handled seperately because they don't
currently use tripleo-operator-ansible

Change-Id: I892565d7731a61e25e69ccfb776efa6c35150908

commit_message:
Replace deprecated UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE variable

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is deprecated and TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is
the new environment variable name that replaces it [1].

This allows to use upper-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

[1] https://zuul-ci.org/docs/zuul-jobs/python-roles.html#rolevar-tox.tox_constraints_file
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/722814/

Change-Id: I4db793853e685015ee21d3ee0a7d9ce305faa03c

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-19 16:53:07.000000000', 'message': 'Shibboleth and OIDC apache modules are co-installable on Focal

For ubuntu bionic there was a difference in dependancies between
these two libraries on libcurl3 and libcurl4 which mean they were
not co-installable.

For Focal we should be able to install both as the version of
the shibboleth library is now > 3.0

Closes-Bug: 1900410
Change-Id: Ia135870e45cc32ddfdad61476fe9ce12f61a6df7
'}]
commit_message:
Shibboleth and OIDC apache modules are co-installable on Focal

For ubuntu bionic there was a difference in dependancies between
these two libraries on libcurl3 and libcurl4 which mean they were
not co-installable.

For Focal we should be able to install both as the version of
the shibboleth library is now > 3.0

Closes-Bug: 1900410
Change-Id: Ia135870e45cc32ddfdad61476fe9ce12f61a6df7

commit_message:
[horizon] Transition Stein to EM

This transition the stein branch to extended maintenance.
Changes for bugfixes and things the team deems important are
still encouraged, but there will no longer be official releases
off of the branch.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this
transition, or -1 if there are any final backports currently in
flight that we should wait for. For the latter case, please
update the patch with the new commit hash after doing a final
release to get those changes out so we know to proceed with the
transition.

Change-Id: Ib677b840a83e7770a92d606cd77583d4d80e1b2a

commit_message:
Add glance multistore job (nv) in tempest gate

There are Tempest tests (also new tests proposal) for glance
multistores setup. It will be good to see the result of those
tests via glance multistore job. Adding that as non voting because
that is nv in glance side too.

commit_message:
galera: expose 2-node mode for the galera resource

When deploying a 2-node HA overcloud, the galera resource
agent can be configured to enable a "2-node mode" heuristic,
that allows it to restart a galera node in the event of a
network split.

Make this resource agent's option available in puppet via
the new parameter "two_node_mode".

Closes-Bug: #1903051

Change-Id: I543ee77ec38b6429989435122ae0c257d279e507
(cherry picked from commit 5836bcc15b3e28160b13f25e1022a79002a71dd2)

commit_message:
Replace deprecated UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE variable

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is deprecated and TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is
the new environment variable name that replaces it [1].

commit_message:
Sync boot mode when changing the boot device via Redfish

After changing the boot device via Redfish, check that the boot mode being
reported matches what is configured and, if not, set it to the configured
value.  Some BMCs change the boot mode when the device is set via Redfish,
this will ensure the mode is set properly.

Change-Id: Ib077f7f32de029833e6bd936853c382305bce36e
Story: 2008252
Task: 41103
(cherry picked from commit 685131fd3658b2ff0b131d19d32fd82d74f3bb17)
(cherry picked from commit 861e91c8616db39e589589629bd5305909067331)

commit_message:
Add CinderBackupOptVolumes parameter

This adds a new parameter 'CinderBackupOptVolumes' to allow
cinder-backup to mount extra volumes.

Change-Id: Ide6d464be4a13457debfeceb61e5255c06b67808

table is not already there, it's added. If the table in current

commit_message:
Add update_tables method to Idl

The method adds given tables to the current connection schema. If the
table is not already there, it's added. If the table in current
connection doesn't exist in the provided schema, it's not added, which
seems like it's been removed.

This behavior is handy for cases where ovsdb-server is changed to new
schema.

Related-bug: #1901527

Change-Id: Ib071dd0f4d9c6e08fafc282c7551086de4b59500
Co-Authored-By: Terry Wilson <twilson@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Jakub Libosvar <libosvar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix test_vnf_alarm_scale_with_instance_reservation

* Fix empty mgmt_ip_address handling.
  ast.literal_eval('{}') does not raise an exception.
* Fix not-to-be-cleaned-up blazar hosts. No need to test
  affinity=True case so we just do with one host.
* Fix req_amount

Related-Bug: #1886213
Change-Id: Ief0c4388f80b179c098231081644d97a56bd1379

trigger uwsgi restart on service config change.

_get_barbican_endpoint now uses barbican_endpoint_type config option to
retrieve a correct endpoint from catalog.

This config option is set to 'public' by default and it's a default

commit_message:
Use 'barbican_endpoint_type'config option to get endpoint from catalog

_get_barbican_endpoint now uses barbican_endpoint_type config option to
retrieve a correct endpoint from catalog.

This config option is set to 'public' by default and it's a default
value for ServiceCatalog.endpoint_data_for method. It means that the
default behaviour will be the same as before this patch.

Change-Id: Idf4061fe3e35e3c47a993a56b23c0257c92e5cc3
(cherry picked from commit e63d813a70eb4b841937a4e8a06a55e85d3ea97d)

commit_message:
Fix wait condition for retry

Tenancity expects you use one it's waiting methods and not a fixed
number. This currently doesn't retry and stops all builds from
continuing to run.

Change-Id: Ia2b61cb698677968ef990d5577918be3aa4e2450
Closes-Bug: #1904025

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-12 16:05:36.000000000', 'message': 'functional: Wait for revert resize to complete

When reverting a resize, we need to wait for the migration status to
change to 'reverted', but we also need to wait for the relevant
versioned notification to be emitted. The reason for this is noted in a
couple of places, including the '_revert_resize' helper in the
'nova.tests.functional.integrated_helpers.InstanceHelperMixin' module:

  [T]he migration status is changed to "reverted" in the dest host
  revert_resize method but the allocations are cleaned up in the source
  host finish_revert_resize method so we need to wait for the
  finish_revert_resize method to complete.

Two tests in the 'test_cross_cell_migrate' test module were not doing
this wait, resulting in intermittent failures in CI due to the races.
Resolve this now.

Change-Id: I3ec6cae19b362ac9cc311a979f680cf64db4f458
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
'}, {'created': '2020-11-12 19:41:29.000000000', 'message': 'functional: Wait for revert resize to complete

When reverting a resize, we need to wait for the migration status to
change to 'reverted', but we also need to wait for the relevant
versioned notification to be emitted. The reason for this is noted in a
couple of places, including the '_revert_resize' helper in the
'nova.tests.functional.integrated_helpers.InstanceHelperMixin' module:

  [T]he migration status is changed to "reverted" in the dest host
  revert_resize method but the allocations are cleaned up in the source
  host finish_revert_resize method so we need to wait for the
  finish_revert_resize method to complete.

Two tests in the 'test_cross_cell_migrate' test module were not doing
this wait, resulting in intermittent failures in CI due to the races.
Resolve this now.

Change-Id: I3ec6cae19b362ac9cc311a979f680cf64db4f458
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1904051
'}]
commit_message:
functional: Wait for revert resize to complete

When reverting a resize, we need to wait for the migration status to
change to 'reverted', but we also need to wait for the relevant
versioned notification to be emitted. The reason for this is noted in a
couple of places, including the '_revert_resize' helper in the
'nova.tests.functional.integrated_helpers.InstanceHelperMixin' module:

  [T]he migration status is changed to "reverted" in the dest host
  revert_resize method but the allocations are cleaned up in the source
  host finish_revert_resize method so we need to wait for the
  finish_revert_resize method to complete.

Two tests in the 'test_cross_cell_migrate' test module were not doing
this wait, resulting in intermittent failures in CI due to the races.
Resolve this now.

Change-Id: I3ec6cae19b362ac9cc311a979f680cf64db4f458
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1904051

They should be largely the same, and the testing params should only
differ in the console setting.

commit_message:
Enforce the way we encapsulate a Validation

This patch ensures that the playbook is respecting the minimal structure
of a validation. This patch also adds DocStrings to the Validation class
and new unittests according to the enforcement changes.

Change-Id: I0809163cbd661cbd24705ed348281c7818a944b4
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix typos, extreamio and xtreamio to xtremio

dellemc_extremio_iscsi is a wrong name.
It has to be dellemc_xtremio_iscsi.
And xtreamio should be xtremio.

Conflicts:
 manifests/profile/base/cinder/volume.pp

Change-Id: I7ba7b3ca151bf101742dc84ad80204cda42e2dbb
(cherry picked from commit ef40cb9fce7ff3f74be55bdc93b0f10648a417c1)
(cherry picked from commit 8c8fa833392da90787852bd3382c8ffea0319094)
(cherry picked from commit d717538f272361bfacdf158168388a7fe60beee4)

commit_message:
Power off before inspection

Power off nodes before inspection as failed previous
inspection attempts may cause re-inspection attempts
to fail.

Change-Id: I7405420ad441428dc82360d84b75e03921031482
Story: 2008107
Task: 40820

commit_message:
[OvS] Handle re_added multi ports

Multiple ports are located in ports_re_added. Assume we have port_one
and port_two. It will loop through the ports. Port_one is iterated
first, events ['re_added'] is assigned port_one, events ['removed']
is assigned port_two. In the second loop, events ['re_added'] is set
to port_two instead of adding port_two to list. So after the loop,
only port_two is left in events ['re_added'].

Conflicts:
    neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/test_ovs_neutron_agent.py

Change-Id: If8edd29dd741f1688ffcac341fd58173539ba000
Closes-Bug: #1864630
(cherry picked from commit 5600163e9b4fb89b1525e9e415b1fedbe9526501)
(cherry picked from commit 22df4695049b8ee7b19859e5b0633bec29afc9a7)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-09 09:56:05.000000000', 'message': 'Import "oslo_config.cfg" before "eventlet"

Eventlet will patch the "os" library and how it works.

If "oslo_config.cfg" is called after "eventlet":
- "oslo_config.cfg" imports "stevedore"
- "stevedore" imports "importlib_metadata"
- this library will try to use "os.open" library, but patched
- "eventlet" imports "oslo_service"
- "oslo_service" imports "oslo_logging"
- "oslo_logging" imports "oslo_config.cfg", but at this point,
  the instance cfg.CONF does not exist yet

If "oslo_config.cfg" is imported before calling eventlet,
"oslo_logging" is not called and there is no circular import.

Closes-Bug: #1888213

[1]I8b08f289d446f4775eac1e1a91997fa96f25f641

Change-Id: Idcc04f46b2a01e24dfd56cef8121694439e0339e
(cherry picked from commit bc99e56515537210a35988d3fbdec0669469d0b3)
'}, {'created': '2020-11-10 07:57:19.000000000', 'message': 'Import "oslo_config.cfg" before "eventlet"

- "oslo_service" imports "oslo_logging"

'}]
commit_message:
Import "oslo_config.cfg" before "eventlet"

Eventlet will patch the "os" library and how it works.

If "oslo_config.cfg" is called after "eventlet":
- "oslo_config.cfg" imports "stevedore"
- "stevedore" imports "importlib_metadata"
- this library will try to use "os.open" library, but patched
- "eventlet" imports "oslo_service"
- "oslo_service" imports "oslo_logging"
- "oslo_logging" imports "oslo_config.cfg", but at this point,
  the instance cfg.CONF does not exist yet

If "oslo_config.cfg" is imported before calling eventlet,
"oslo_logging" is not called and there is no circular import.

Closes-Bug: #1888213

[1]I8b08f289d446f4775eac1e1a91997fa96f25f641

Change-Id: Idcc04f46b2a01e24dfd56cef8121694439e0339e
(cherry picked from commit bc99e56515537210a35988d3fbdec0669469d0b3)

commit_message:
Fix the release jobs

Per [1].
The release jobs use Focal now and they run bindep so it must be
compatible.
This particular dependency (python-libvirt deb) should not really
be required, hence removing (it should get installed from PyPI).

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-November/018733.html

Change-Id: I5c1394b406b09608d453cbac190a6186c53e532a

commit_message:
Fix the release jobs

Per [1].
The release jobs use Focal now and they run bindep so it must be
compatible.
This particular dependency (python-libvirt deb) should not really
be required, hence removing (it should get installed from PyPI).

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-November/018733.html

Change-Id: I5c1394b406b09608d453cbac190a6186c53e532a
(cherry picked from commit 45b67c4193b6444d30886cc3e269a1120d5439b2)

subject: Support benchmark by script
messages:
[{'account_id': 28910, 'date': '2020-11-03 03:55:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28910, 'date': '2020-11-03 04:10:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 28910, 'date': '2020-11-03 04:19:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

@Andrey Kurilin, I think Rally should support run script/command line for using third-party benchmark tools. Output of tools/scripts is generated to html.'}, {'account_id': 9545, 'date': '2020-11-09 12:54:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Sorry for the delay. Will try to review your change soon.

The idea itself looks good to me'}, {'account_id': 28910, 'date': '2020-11-12 01:50:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Sorry for the delay. Will try to review your change soon.
 > 
 > The idea itself looks good to me

Thanks. Hope you review soon.'}, {'account_id': 9545, 'date': '2020-11-12 15:17:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(6 comments)

Rally plugins for OpenStack platform include 2 interesting plugins:

- Scenario VMTasks.boot_runcommand_delete@openstack - https://github.com/openstack/rally-openstack/blob/2.1.0/rally_openstack/task/scenarios/vm/vmtasks.py#L140
- Context image_command_customizer@openstack - https://github.com/openstack/rally-openstack/blob/2.1.0/rally_openstack/task/contexts/vm/image_command_customizer.py#L27

Both of these plugins are designed to execute scripts on the remote host (via ssh). What I like in that plugins is the way of customization for execution.

Relatively to your changes, instead of specifying a list of commands to execute, it would be nice to support the following format:

 interpreter - str / defaults to '/bin/bash'
 script_file - str
 script_inline - a list of strings or a string
 command_args - a list of scrings
 env - a dict of env variables


It would be nice to extend tox-self job to run new plugins. see https://github.com/openstack/rally/blob/3.2.0/rally-jobs/self-rally.yaml"}, {'account_id': 9545, 'date': '2020-11-12 15:27:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Also, https://github.com/openstack/rally-openstack/blob/2.1.0/rally_openstack/task/scenarios/vm/utils.py#L106-L136 this can be helpful as an example of processing input args.

As for validation the input argument for the scenario, it would be nice to write custom validator like https://github.com/openstack/rally-openstack/blob/2.1.0/rally_openstack/task/scenarios/vm/vmtasks.py#L45'}, {'account_id': 28910, 'date': '2020-11-13 02:48:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

1. Why isn't context with command and scenario with command proposed to rally for other plugins using ? I used to contribute this changes to rally-openstack project but you asked me to move to rally project (https://review.opendev.org/#/c/601491/)
2. Scenario VMTasks.boot_runcommand_delete@openstack (https://github.com/openstack/rally-openstack/blob/2.1.0/rally_openstack/task/scenarios/vm/vmtasks.py#L140) only run command on server and after that, delete server. If want to run command on a  server many times in one context, seem have not any scenario support it."}, {'account_id': 9545, 'date': '2020-11-13 11:44:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Yes, your plugins are platform independent (as I said in https://review.opendev.org/#/c/601491/ change). I referred plugins from rally-openstack repo just to show a good example of input arguments it would be nice to use in your plugins.'}]

commit_message:
Support benchmark by script

Script context: script setup environment before running benchmark
and cleanup environment after that

Script scenario: run tools by command line or run script for
benchmark and collect results

Change-Id: Id114dc5d17608cf9461ee63234e7ff5b175dbe9c

commit_message:
Convert last bionic jobs to focal

And disable dstat in ironic-base for the time being.

Change-Id: Ib05a952260d027f9f1307a9948ac5691b57e96d3

commit_message:
Fix idrac-wsman RAID step async error handling

Instead of using process_event('fail') use error_handlers,
otherwise in case of failure node gets stuck and fails
because of timeout, instead of failing earlier due to
step failure.

Story: 2008307
Task: 41194
Change-Id: Ieec0173f57367587985d2baad77205bb83e8b69a

commit_message:
Add Victoria to the test gate

Also sync libraries.
Also take trusty-mitaka out of the gate because of linked bug.
Also fixed Victoria bundles as they were trying to deploy
percona-cluster.

Func-Test-Pr: https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza-openstack-tests/pull/434
Change-Id: I575d00b993fbff33d80956278b01e87e434713e0
Related-Bug: #1877076
