commit_message:
Simplify injecting network data into an ISO image

Currently we're building a VFAT image with the network data just
to unpack it back on the next step. Just pass the file directly.
This fixes a permission denied problem on Bifrost on Fedora
(at least).

As a nice side effect, the change reduces the amount of IO done
for virtual media quite substantially.

Change-Id: I5499fa42c1d82a1a29099fbbba6f45d440448b72

subject: Fix byte check in tempest plugin
messages: [{'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2020-11-12 17:31:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15519, 'date': '2020-11-12 18:29:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\nI liked!'}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2020-11-13 07:32:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-12 17:31:49.000000000', 'message': "Fix byte check in tempest plugin

Different implementations of ping behave slightly differently
in order to ensure the packet payload is transmitted across
the wire because some mediums have a minimum packet size.

Typically this results in a frame size of 64 bytes, but
the client may report 56 when the header is removed and only
the packet payload is examined.

But the point of the check is that we got something back.

The below edited for example purposes:

$ ping -c1 -w4 192.168.133.92
PING 192.168.65.92 (192.168.133.92) 56(84) bytes of data.
From 192.168.65.249 icmp_seq=1 Destination Host Unreachable

--- 192.168.65.92 ping statistics ---
1 packets transmitted, 0 received, 0 errors, 100% packet loss, time 3075ms
$ ping -c1 -w4 192.168.65.1
PING 192.168.65.1 (192.168.65.1) 56(84) bytes of data.
64 bytes from 192.168.65.1: icmp_seq=1 ttl=64 time=12.4 ms

And then in CI, we're able to see this be 56 bytes returned
becasue the underlying medium may not have been ethernet or
the client has stripped the header. Which, doesn't matter,
we get A reply from the expected address and we can validate
the test on that alone.

Change-Id: If0d51b52e96f280336d0d92135681db75a6fbd65
"}]
commit_message:
Fix byte check in tempest plugin

Different implementations of ping behave slightly differently
in order to ensure the packet payload is transmitted across
the wire because some mediums have a minimum packet size.

Typically this results in a frame size of 64 bytes, but
the client may report 56 when the header is removed and only
the packet payload is examined.

But the point of the check is that we got something back.

The below edited for example purposes:

$ ping -c1 -w4 192.168.133.92
PING 192.168.65.92 (192.168.133.92) 56(84) bytes of data.
From 192.168.65.249 icmp_seq=1 Destination Host Unreachable

--- 192.168.65.92 ping statistics ---
1 packets transmitted, 0 received, 0 errors, 100% packet loss, time 3075ms
$ ping -c1 -w4 192.168.65.1
PING 192.168.65.1 (192.168.65.1) 56(84) bytes of data.
64 bytes from 192.168.65.1: icmp_seq=1 ttl=64 time=12.4 ms

And then in CI, we're able to see this be 56 bytes returned
becasue the underlying medium may not have been ethernet or
the client has stripped the header. Which, doesn't matter,
we get A reply from the expected address and we can validate
the test on that alone.

Change-Id: If0d51b52e96f280336d0d92135681db75a6fbd65

commit_message:
Switch to new engine facade in l3_gwmode_db module

It also needs to add also usage of reader context in
servicetype_db module becuase ProviderResourceAssociation
OVO is not using new facade yet and some tests were failing
without that.

Partially-Implements blueprint: enginefacade-switch

Change-Id: I780449a8028594eb4e13f62b452535d8fc55fab1

commit_message:
Fix handling rootwrap.d filters

First, ironic-lib filters are never copied from the venv.

Second, using `cp` for copying results in rootwrap.d copied inside
of rootwrap.d on upgrade/update.

Change-Id: I1c70c908a2576fd9da82ef89ad7e8e4b1caf4e8f
(cherry picked from commit 17d433247468e302602b6c5495efcba59a9937d0)

commit_message:
Revert "Remove flavor API"

Fully revert the flavor API removal and add back docs and tests

This reverts commit 910519127d8fb9880863eb219df68a574d00df6a.

Change-Id: Ic8f7d026c3bc2327f6654b83e9e01e97b6087ef6

[{'created': '2020-11-10 04:31:43.000000000', 'message': 'DNM: add a dedicated compute node, disburden the controller node

Main motivation is to reduce memory usage per node, so as to
1). preclude some processes from being OOM-killed during FT
2). preclude POST_FAILURE on export-devstack-journal
    - journal size per node (esp. of controller node) would be
      reduced. hopefully the probability of xz process being
      OOM-killed would be close to zero.

commit_message:
Add a dedicated compute node, disburden the controller node

Our motivation here is to reduce memory usage per node, so as to
1). preclude POST_FAILURE on export-devstack-journal
    - journal size per node (esp. of controller node) would be
      reduced. hopefully the probability of xz process being
      OOM-killed would be close to zero.
2). preclude some processes from being OOM-killed during FT
    - we've already observed mysqld being OOM-killed.

Change-Id: I84bdcb17509dc6163fc45797f78a1e504119607f

operators, and during provisioning we unbind/bind tenant port with None which
causes the mac address to be regenerated twice and differs from the originally

commit_message:
Fixes the issue that instance bond port can't get IP address

The issue is that when a port group doesn't have a mac address assigned by
operators, and during provisioning we unbind/bind tenant port with None which
causes the mac address to be regenerated twice and differs from the originally
one allocated by nova or users which was packed into config drive. The end result
is that, bond port has different mac address configured and can't the IP address
from neutron.

Change-Id: I92ed5d17239216324d6a69e0ed8771fd6948d6ec
Story: 2008300
Task: 41185

[{'created': '2020-10-08 01:05:55.000000000', 'message': 'NEC driver: fix a snapshot detach error

In NEC driver, _fc_terminate_connection() refers to
Volume.volume_attachment of an argument.
However, the argument is a snapshot object when a snapshot is being
detached.
The snapshot object does not have the "volume_attachment" attribute.

This patch avoids referring to the "volume_attachment" attribute when
the argument is a snapshot.

Change-Id: Ibc5fa0901ae9c0766f98d623357bade266598bff
Closes-Bug: #1887885
(cherry picked from commit 6e8dd2f0c01060dbde1a0263da053ffd1a7322f3)
(cherry picked from commit 7e98b66a177d3d8d945d8146cf36c81cbe58a5b0)
'}]
commit_message:
NEC driver: fix a snapshot detach error

In NEC driver, _fc_terminate_connection() refers to
Volume.volume_attachment of an argument.
However, the argument is a snapshot object when a snapshot is being
detached.
The snapshot object does not have the "volume_attachment" attribute.

This patch avoids referring to the "volume_attachment" attribute when
the argument is a snapshot.

Change-Id: Ibc5fa0901ae9c0766f98d623357bade266598bff
Closes-Bug: #1887885
(cherry picked from commit 6e8dd2f0c01060dbde1a0263da053ffd1a7322f3)
(cherry picked from commit 7e98b66a177d3d8d945d8146cf36c81cbe58a5b0)

commit_message:
Also wipe agent token on manual power off or reboot

We have a check in the code that is never true for manual power
actions because of what happens in the conductor manager. Remove it.

Conflicts:
	ironic/conductor/utils.py

Change-Id: I50b7b78a41188c41e4944894851f1d12684f824a
(cherry picked from commit bc04a42a96672f70e9327e805586b48c825bb5a0)

Module: tripleo_network_populate_environment

Add the ansible module `tripleo_network_populate_environment`.

The module populates the heat environment for deployed
networks.

commit_message:
Module: tripleo_composable_network

Add the ansible module `tripleo_composable_network`.
The module will be used to create and manage composable
networks.

Change-Id: I977ded44bf415a486a07e04f88f552d34da5da50

commit_message:
Removed ubi-8 based jobs

ubi-8 based jobs uses tcib method of building containers
and same method also used by content-provider jobs.

We nearly migrated to content-provider, this jobs
are no longer in use.

Change-Id: I499a1d8f985843cf11dfb3b620e119a895380fe1
Signed-off-by: Amol Kahat <amolkahat@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 63e6bde6f4708a77cd30900374039e18a51821ac)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-12 18:23:07.000000000', 'message': 'Fix inspect images calls to not use the index format keyword

Via https://review.opendev.org/#/c/752937/ we added the following code:
       if container_image:
            image_id_str = self.runner.inspect(
                container_image, "{{index .Id}}", o_type='image')
            if str(image_id_str).strip() != inspect_info.get('Image'):
                self.log.debug("Deleting container (image updated): "
                               "%s" % container)
                self.runner.remove_container(container)
                return True

This code works fine in docker:
[root@controller-0 ~]# docker inspect --type image --format '{{index
.Id}}' f6ec0f326154
sha256:f6ec0f326154a80b6844a03c2de2904bbbefea6cdf87acb606ff869ace1a8dd4

But is problematic in podman (both on 1.6.4 and 2.1.1 versions):
[root@controller-0 ~]# podman inspect --type image --format '{{index
.Id}}'
undercloud-0.ctlplane.redhat.local:8787/rh-osbs/rhosp16-openstack-cinder-volume:16.2_20201110.2-hotfixupdate2
ERRO[0000] Error printing inspect output: Template parsing error:
template: image:1:8: executing "image" at <.Id>: can't evaluate field Id
in type *entities.ImageInspectReport

This has the side-effect of restarting all containers at each identical
redeploy.

We can just drop the 'index' in the query since it works in both docker
and podman:
[root@controller-0 ~]# docker inspect --type image --format '{{.Id}}'
f6ec0f326154
sha256:f6ec0f326154a80b6844a03c2de2904bbbefea6cdf87acb606ff869ace1a8dd4

[root@controller-0 ~]# podman inspect --type image --format '{{.Id}}'
5093412f3a08

Change-Id: I8b1fbbb7499a69e7a131fd8650c6f50fb4ab978e
Closes-Bug: #1904043
'}]
commit_message:
Fix inspect images calls to not use the index format keyword

Via https://review.opendev.org/#/c/752937/ we added the following code:
       if container_image:
            image_id_str = self.runner.inspect(
                container_image, "{{index .Id}}", o_type='image')
            if str(image_id_str).strip() != inspect_info.get('Image'):
                self.log.debug("Deleting container (image updated): "
                               "%s" % container)
                self.runner.remove_container(container)
                return True

This code works fine in docker:
[root@controller-0 ~]# docker inspect --type image --format '{{index
.Id}}' f6ec0f326154
sha256:f6ec0f326154a80b6844a03c2de2904bbbefea6cdf87acb606ff869ace1a8dd4

But is problematic in podman (both on 1.6.4 and 2.1.1 versions):
[root@controller-0 ~]# podman inspect --type image --format '{{index
.Id}}'
undercloud-0.ctlplane.redhat.local:8787/rh-osbs/rhosp16-openstack-cinder-volume:16.2_20201110.2-hotfixupdate2
ERRO[0000] Error printing inspect output: Template parsing error:
template: image:1:8: executing "image" at <.Id>: can't evaluate field Id
in type *entities.ImageInspectReport

This has the side-effect of restarting all containers at each identical
redeploy.

We can just drop the 'index' in the query since it works in both docker
and podman:
[root@controller-0 ~]# docker inspect --type image --format '{{.Id}}'
f6ec0f326154
sha256:f6ec0f326154a80b6844a03c2de2904bbbefea6cdf87acb606ff869ace1a8dd4

[root@controller-0 ~]# podman inspect --type image --format '{{.Id}}'
5093412f3a08

Change-Id: I8b1fbbb7499a69e7a131fd8650c6f50fb4ab978e
Closes-Bug: #1904043

[{'created': '2020-08-31 01:18:34.000000000', 'message': 'Change default num_retries for glance to 3

Previously, the default value of num_retries for glance is 0.
It means that the request to glance is sent only one time.
On the other hand, neutron and cinder clients set the default
value to 3.
To align the default value for retry to other components, we
should change the default value to 3.

Closes-Bug: #1888168
Change-Id: Ibbd4bd26408328b9e1a1128b3794721405631193
(cherry picked from commit 662af9fab6eacb46bcaee38d076d33c2c0f82b9b)
'}]
commit_message:
Change default num_retries for glance to 3

Previously, the default value of num_retries for glance is 0.
It means that the request to glance is sent only one time.
On the other hand, neutron and cinder clients set the default
value to 3.
To align the default value for retry to other components, we
should change the default value to 3.

Closes-Bug: #1888168
Change-Id: Ibbd4bd26408328b9e1a1128b3794721405631193
(cherry picked from commit 662af9fab6eacb46bcaee38d076d33c2c0f82b9b)

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-02-18 08:58:06.000000000', 'message': 'Fix object/path-names for pseudo-folders on winnt

This fix provides a `SwiftUploadObject.object_name` property setter that sanitizes
input object names by:-
- swapping nt path separators for posix path separators
- stripping winnt drive prefix
- swapping out drive letter colon for unicode modifier letter colon (when present mid path)

This allows (among other benefits) correct pseudo-folder naming during uploads when objects
have ntpath elements in their names (such as is on windows).

Change-Id: I7b969b7d25e48042f973d870fd28e7b3c10e35c5
Closes-Bug: #1511813
'}, {'created': '2016-02-18 12:45:09.000000000', 'message': 'Fix object/path-names for pseudo-folders on winnt

This fix provides a `SwiftUploadObject.object_name` property setter that sanitizes
input object names by:-
- swapping nt path separators for posix path separators
- stripping winnt drive prefix
- swapping out drive letter colon for unicode modifier letter colon (when present mid path)

This allows (among other benefits) correct pseudo-folder naming during uploads when objects
have ntpath elements in their names (such as is on windows).

Change-Id: I7b969b7d25e48042f973d870fd28e7b3c10e35c5
Closes-Bug: #1511813
'}]
commit_message:
Fix object/path-names for pseudo-folders on winnt

This fix provides a `SwiftUploadObject.object_name` property setter that sanitizes
input object names by:-
- swapping nt path separators for posix path separators
- stripping winnt drive prefix
- swapping out drive letter colon for unicode modifier letter colon (when present mid path)

This allows (among other benefits) correct pseudo-folder naming during uploads when objects
have ntpath elements in their names (such as is on windows).

Change-Id: I7b969b7d25e48042f973d870fd28e7b3c10e35c5
Closes-Bug: #1511813

[{'created': '2020-10-08 14:50:11.000000000', 'message': 'Match created_at and updated_at timestamp in TestHashRing

When a "ovn_hash_ring" record is created in the database,
there is a small difference between "created_at" and
"updated_at", assigned during the Python OVO creation.

This patch equates both values during testing if the
difference between both is less than 10ms.

Related-Bug: #1894117

Change-Id: Ib3b405104d746255f869a94898d4ba14ac600909
'}]
commit_message:
Match created_at and updated_at timestamp in TestHashRing

When a "ovn_hash_ring" record is created in the database,
there is a small difference between "created_at" and
"updated_at", assigned during the Python OVO creation.

This patch equates both values during testing if the
difference between both is less than 10ms.

Related-Bug: #1894117

Change-Id: Ib3b405104d746255f869a94898d4ba14ac600909

commit_message:
Add devstack-tobiko-faults-centos job to the periodic queue

Tobiko is the testing framework which allows to do kind of "white box"
scenario testing. More info about it can be found at [1].
By adding devstack-tobiko-faults-centos job to out periodic queue we
will improve test coverage of our code as tobiko is testing e.g. L3ha in
that job. It also runs some scenarios, like e.g. restarting agents on
nodes, which can't be tested with tempest jobs.

[1] https://tobiko.readthedocs.io/en/latest/

Change-Id: I157645ed6d048de676dad5b2a93ab83a82880610

commit_message:
Update networking-midonet maintainers list

Ryu Ishimoto was removed from the list of networking-midonet maintainers
as he is not active in the community anymore - thank You Ryu for all
Your work in the Neutron community.

Sam Morrison was added to the list as he recently stepped in to maintain
networking-midonet in the Neutron stadium. Welcome Sam and thanks for
Your help with this project.

Change-Id: I639fa5f69f56c96bc69873e6bcac555fff441ce2

commit_message:
Local mac direct flow for non-openflow firewall

When there is no openflow firewall, aka the ovs agent security group
is disabled or Noop/HybridIptable, this patch will introduce a different
ingress pipeline for bridge ports which will avoid ingress flood:
(1) table=0,  in_port=patch_bridge,dl_vlan=physical_vlan action=mod_vlan:local_vlan,goto:60 (original)
(2) table=60, in_port=patch_bridge                       action=goto:61                     (new)
(3) table=61, dl_dst=local_port_mac,dl_vlan=local_vlan,  action=strip_vlan,output:<ofport>  (changes)

And changes the local ports pipeline:
(1) table=0,  in_port=local_ofport                       action=goto:25                  (original)
(2) table=25, in_port=local_ofport,dl_src=local_port_mac action=goto:60                  (original)
(3) table=60, in_port=local_ofport,dl_src=local_port_mac action=local_vlan->reg6,goto:61 (changes)
(4) table=61, dl_dst=local_port_mac,reg6=local_vlan,     action=output:<ofport>          (changes)

Closes-Bug: #1884708
Closes-Bug: #1881070
Related-Bug: #1732067
Related-Bug: #1866445
Related-Bug: #1883321

Conflicts:
    neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py
    neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/openflow/native/test_br_int.py

Change-Id: Iecf9cffaf02616342f1727ad7db85545d8adbec2
(cherry picked from commit 959d8b6d73e2a6ab1a45c9a7b0b05ae163e650fc)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-25 15:49:22.000000000', 'message': 'Instance snapshot: fallback to usual upload on ImageNotAuthorized

Glance policies may restrict set_locations to usual user
due to security restrictions and nova will get Forbidden,
which will be converted to ImageNotAuthorized.
In this case we should try to fallback from direct snapshot
to standard one.

Change-Id: I12b9c35f74c5efafb07eb636ca04ef2ce61b8302
Signed-off-by: George Melikov <mail@gmelikov.ru>
'}, {'created': '2020-09-27 14:31:56.000000000', 'message': "Instance snapshot: fallback to usual upload on ImageNotAuthorized

On ephemeral volume snapshot nova tries to create a `direct`
snapshot first, in which case it will try to set an image's
location.

Glance policies may restrict set_image_location to usual user
due to security restrictions and nova will get Forbidden,
which will be converted to ImageNotAuthorized.

In this case we should try to fallback from direct snapshot
to standard one, it won't change location and will be uploaded
successfully.

Change-Id: I12b9c35f74c5efafb07eb636ca04ef2ce61b8302
Signed-off-by: George Melikov <mail@gmelikov.ru>
"}, {'created': '2020-09-27 18:23:24.000000000', 'message': "Instance snapshot: fallback to usual upload on ImageNotAuthorized

On ephemeral volume snapshot nova tries to create a `direct`
snapshot first, in which case it will try to set an image's
location.

Glance policies may restrict set_image_location to usual user
due to security restrictions and nova will get Forbidden,
which will be converted to ImageNotAuthorized.

In this case we should try to fallback from direct snapshot
to standard one, it won't change location and will be uploaded
successfully.

Change-Id: I12b9c35f74c5efafb07eb636ca04ef2ce61b8302
Signed-off-by: George Melikov <mail@gmelikov.ru>
"}]
commit_message:
Instance snapshot: fallback to usual upload on ImageNotAuthorized

On ephemeral volume snapshot nova tries to create a `direct`
snapshot first, in which case it will try to set an image's
location.

Glance policies may restrict set_image_location to usual user
due to security restrictions and nova will get Forbidden,
which will be converted to ImageNotAuthorized.

In this case we should try to fallback from direct snapshot
to standard one, it won't change location and will be uploaded
successfully.

Change-Id: I12b9c35f74c5efafb07eb636ca04ef2ce61b8302
Signed-off-by: George Melikov <mail@gmelikov.ru>

commit_message:
Remove the unused coding style modules

Python modules related to coding style checks (listed in blacklist.txt in
openstack/requirements repo) are dropped from lower-constraints.txt
as they are not actually used in tests (other than pep8).

more info: https://github.com/openstack/requirements/blob/master/blacklist.txt

Change-Id: If178fe55fc03538fe8daeac81db1ed822e3c1518

commit_message:
Update requirements URLs in tox config

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so will switch to the correct
upper-constraints list automatically when the requirements repository branches.

Change-Id: I496dfbc709ecd864f619618252ef5dc992216ca7

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-11 14:07:50.000000000', 'message': 'Remove root device hint after delete_configuration

The root device hint is not guaranteed to be valid after raid
configuration in most cases, this could cause no matching device
found and fail the deployment. AgentRAID implementations can return
the correct root device hint from the create_configuration.

Change-Id: Iab97a16ef8ccea8186f0cc7a14b77d508804fc8d
'}]
commit_message:
Remove root device hint after delete_configuration

The root device hint is not guaranteed to be valid after raid
configuration in most cases, this could cause no matching device
found and fail the deployment. AgentRAID implementations can return
the correct root device hint from the create_configuration.

Change-Id: Iab97a16ef8ccea8186f0cc7a14b77d508804fc8d

The base implementation of get_node_network_data returns {} and is
not overridden in the noop network. Update the base implementation
to use task.node.network_data and remove the excessive logging.

Change-Id: Ie50dcd1c2a151f5dd09794467792527032249809
(cherry picked from commit 2e5d01d48dc3a231140a1680a7082be436f5dd55)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix DHCP-less operations with the noop network interface

The base implementation of get_node_network_data returns {} and is
not overridden in the noop network. Update the base implementation
to use task.node.network_data and remove the excessive logging.

Change-Id: Ie50dcd1c2a151f5dd09794467792527032249809
(cherry picked from commit 2e5d01d48dc3a231140a1680a7082be436f5dd55)

commit_message:
Add possibility to configure application root

SCRIPT_NAME should be used to correctly construct the returned links.
This patch also adds ProxyFix from werkzeug to allow using inspector
behind SSL terminating proxy while still keeping the links correct.

Change-Id: I4f40e9266a55d237f7aa68324b11f59b667cc940

subject: Removes systemd condition for dhcp-interface
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 360, 'name': 'Dan Prince', 'email': 'dprince@redhat.com', 'username': 'dan-prince'}, {'_account_id': 6133, 'name': 'yolanda.robla', 'email': 'yroblamo@redhat.com', 'username': 'yolanda.robla'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 12398, 'name': 'Dan Sneddon', 'email': 'dsneddon@redhat.com', 'username': 'dsneddon'}, {'_account_id': 17280, 'name': 'Tim Rozet', 'email': 'trozet@redhat.com', 'username': 'trozet'}, {'_account_id': 20971, 'name': 'Feng Pan', 'email': 'fpan@redhat.com', 'username': 'fpan'}, {'_account_id': 21626, 'name': 'Ricardo', 'email': 'rnoriega@redhat.com', 'username': 'rnoriega'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 17280, 'date': '2018-04-12 18:27:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 21626, 'date': '2018-04-12 18:49:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6133, 'date': '2018-04-13 09:00:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6133, 'date': '2018-04-13 09:02:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I see that ok for CentOS/RHEL, but i'd like to get more feedback about other distros... so more reviews needed"}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2018-04-13 12:07:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

+2 from me :)'}, {'account_id': 12398, 'date': '2018-04-13 18:03:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-04-18 22:48:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

agree this checks in the script [1]

"The node boots up, linux networking attempts to dhcp interfaces in order. eno1 is successful, eno3 fails and dhcp stops (expected behavior). Therefore we rely on dhcp-interface.service@enp4s0f3.service to bring up enp4s0f3."

The idea behind this, and indeed glean that does the same thing, is that if the interface definition is there then regular networking path brings it up.  I'm surprised to find that if one interface fails it prevents others  that are configured getting an address.  I read both bugs linked (launchpad and jira) but it didn't go into details about this.  Can you confirm that this is expected behaviour, and not an artefact of some other issue, such as incorrect ordering of the services, etc?  

[1] https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/diskimage-builder/tree/diskimage_builder/elements/dhcp-all-interfaces/install.d/dhcp-all-interfaces.sh#n94'}, {'account_id': 17280, 'date': '2018-04-19 13:42:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Yeah I would say the existence of this systemd service and dhcp-all-interfaces script exists only because of that very problem with Linux networking service.  Otherwise, why would we need this at all?  When the server first boots it tries to DHCP on all interfaces, sequentially in the networking service.  When it does ifup and the interfaces fails to DHCP, it then halts the linux networking service and the service reports status as failure, stopping subsequent interfaces from coming up.  That's why we needed this script (runs post network target) in the first place, because in TripleO we cannot guarantee that the provisioning interface will be the first interface on the system, and if one of the prior interfaces fails, we need a way to still bring that interface up during initial deployment before we configure static IPs.

I will provide logs to the bug which show this behavior."}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-04-20 05:51:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I mean my understanding of this, and glean's similar behaviour has always been that it writes out the initial /etc/network/interfaces.d/XXX file for each interface the first time it runs, and subsquently it's just the regular network bringup that handles everything.  so

 eno1 - able to dhcp
 eno3 - will fail dhcp
 enp4s0f3 - has an ifcfg already, able to dhcp

eno3 presumably has an /etc/network/interfaces.d/eno3 file that specifies DHCP?  so maybe regular networking is acting as expected when it fails out when this doesn't get an address?  Wouldn't the solution be that eno3 *didn't* have an interfaces definition -- or a static one -- and then it would be ignored?

Sorry to be a pain but I'm just a little wary about changing the behaviour of this to always start interfaces as it is counter to what i understood it to do"}, {'account_id': 17280, 'date': '2018-04-23 15:57:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I mean my understanding of this, and glean's similar behaviour has
 > always been that it writes out the initial /etc/network/interfaces.d/XXX
 > file for each interface the first time it runs, and subsquently
 > it's just the regular network bringup that handles everything.  so
 > 
 > eno1 - able to dhcp
 > eno3 - will fail dhcp
 > enp4s0f3 - has an ifcfg already, able to dhcp
 > 
 > eno3 presumably has an /etc/network/interfaces.d/eno3 file that
 > specifies DHCP?  so maybe regular networking is acting as expected
 > when it fails out when this doesn't get an address?  Wouldn't the
 > solution be that eno3 *didn't* have an interfaces definition -- or
 > a static one -- and then it would be ignored?
 > 
 > Sorry to be a pain but I'm just a little wary about changing the
 > behaviour of this to always start interfaces as it is counter to
 > what i understood it to do

NP.  I am wary as well since it is a fundamental change that affects everyone, but I think it is correct.  So in the TripleO process when we first boot load a node, it PXE boots and then reboots, with no networking configuration.  As mentioned, Linux Networking tries to DHCP all interfaces when the kernel boots, and it fails at eno3.  So there is no opportunity for eno3 to have static configuration yet, this is the first time the node has ever come up.  With TripleO we have one interface (ctlplane network, same network used to pxe boot, enp4s0f3) which is offering DHCP.  In a typical deployment dhcp-interface or Linux networking service will bring this interface up (and usually it is the first NIC on the box so there is no issue with bring up).  eno3 fails because there is no dhcp offered on that network (it is to be used for private tenant traffic, and to be configured later).  After the ctlplane interface (enp4s0f1) comes up, a python process will start (os-collect-config), which will download metadata from the undercloud.  That metadata includes instructions for how to configure each interface.  At that point eno3 will be statically configured by a tool called os-net-config.

So as you can see, we just need something to bring up the ctlplane interface (boot load the network connectivity so to speak), so that os-net-config can do its thing and reconfigure all the interfaces.  That is this service's purpose, but we also need it to bring up the ctlplane interface even if it already has a DHCP NIC config written.  We of course don't want this service to override the NIC config if it already exists (handled by a check in the dhcp-all-interfaces.sh) because os-net-config handles writing the final NIC configs, but the ifup should be safe to do."}, {'account_id': 21626, 'date': '2018-05-09 15:54:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I think I'm hitting the same issue again in another environment. Please, check this out:

http://paste.openstack.org/show/720693/"}, {'account_id': 12398, 'date': '2020-11-12 23:41:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm really not sure what the right thing to do is, but I will point out that the original purpose of this script was to allow a node which had failed network configuration to be reachable for debugging and troubleshooting. To that end, it seems like we should try and bring up any and all interfaces in the hope that one of them will be usable by the installer to troubleshoot."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-12 18:27:23.000000000', 'message': 'Removes systemd condition for dhcp-interface

The condition that the file path exists is redundant and prevents
interfaces that already have config files from starting.  The
dhcp-all-interfaces script already checks if the ifcfg exists and will
return 0 without writing any configuration.  Afterwards an ifup attempt
will happen.  Therefore there is no reason to have the condition in the
systemd service itself.

Closes-Bug: 1763474

Change-Id: Ic5ced5be01208411f1ee6df1dfbb1b2936098615
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Removes systemd condition for dhcp-interface

The condition that the file path exists is redundant and prevents
interfaces that already have config files from starting.  The
dhcp-all-interfaces script already checks if the ifcfg exists and will
return 0 without writing any configuration.  Afterwards an ifup attempt
will happen.  Therefore there is no reason to have the condition in the
systemd service itself.

Closes-Bug: 1763474

Change-Id: Ic5ced5be01208411f1ee6df1dfbb1b2936098615
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>

First, use default_boot_mode in get_boot_mode instead of BIOS.

Second, call sync_boot_mode for all ramdisk types in the PXE boot,
not only during deployment.

Change-Id: I3f13bacbdcb319c191eeb8ae93aecf8fba68f9ec
(cherry picked from commit 5f9efb34e935e55764d70b1f6f09abc4b6986f56)

commit_message:
Handle default_boot_mode during cleaning/inspection with PXE/iPXE

First, use default_boot_mode in get_boot_mode instead of BIOS.

Second, call sync_boot_mode for all ramdisk types in the PXE boot,
not only during deployment.

Change-Id: I3f13bacbdcb319c191eeb8ae93aecf8fba68f9ec
(cherry picked from commit 5f9efb34e935e55764d70b1f6f09abc4b6986f56)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-12 15:03:11.000000000', 'message': "Remove the need for docker

This change moves our one tox-molecule job to simply depending on
the zuul tox job. To ensure we're not depending on the docker
driver at all, docker has been replaced with podman in the
tripleo_redhat_enforce test job.

Change-Id: I590a500b397d22d2e6fd4336f306caadcb690f45
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 03cae88d6373a38e55f717eecfbb69fe82110070)
"}]
commit_message:
Remove the need for docker

This change moves our one tox-molecule job to simply depending on
the zuul tox job. To ensure we're not depending on the docker
driver at all, docker has been replaced with podman in the
tripleo_redhat_enforce test job.

Change-Id: I590a500b397d22d2e6fd4336f306caadcb690f45
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 03cae88d6373a38e55f717eecfbb69fe82110070)

"}, {'created': '2020-10-13 18:43:57.000000000', 'message': "[train-only] Introduce hybrid state also for ovn_controller

Turns out OVN Controllers can't talk to DB with different versions.

Also we can't restart docker service after setting the insecure
registries as that will restart containers we stopped during
the data transfer stage.

Resolves: rhbz#1885212
Change-Id: I0e775e15b6e5e117e7ad01574a27081f337ecf20
"}, {'created': '2020-10-14 18:57:18.000000000', 'message': "[train-only] Introduce hybrid state also for ovn_controller

Turns out OVN Controllers can't talk to DB with different versions.

Also we can't restart docker service after setting the insecure
registries as that will restart containers we stopped during
the data transfer stage.

Resolves: rhbz#1885212
Change-Id: I0e775e15b6e5e117e7ad01574a27081f337ecf20
"}, {'created': '2020-10-15 11:17:36.000000000', 'message': "[train-only] Introduce hybrid state also for ovn_controller

Turns out OVN Controllers can't talk to DB with different versions.

There is issue with docker insecure registries:
- When setting insecure registries in /etc/containers docker
  ignores upate to this file on daemon reload. The registry
  settings will be ingored unless you restart.
- Restarting docker restarts all the containers back up which
  might contradict with system_upgrade_stop_services.
- Setting the insecure registries in /etc/docker/daemon.json
  would be an option if we didn't also provide the
  INSECURE_REGISTRY environment option to /etc/sysconfig/docker.
  This causes docker to compla on reload on duplicate option and
  it will ignore the /etc/docker/daemon.json settings.
- This leaves us no other option than to restart docker. For this
  we list containers that were running before restart and compare
  it against containers running after the restart to shut down
  anything that should not be running. This is a bit racy but
  should work as one shot solution.
- As a bonus we apply the change of image to hybrid state by
  applying the paunch config. This in any case will try to restart
  all the containers. This is potential issue for the neutron-sriov
  hybrid state as well as for the nova-compute hybrid state. If we
  hit same issue there we will have to apply fix in separate
  commit.

Resolves: rhbz#1885212
Change-Id: I0e775e15b6e5e117e7ad01574a27081f337ecf20
"}, {'created': '2020-10-15 12:05:44.000000000', 'message': "[train-only] Introduce hybrid state also for ovn_controller

- Restarting docker restarts all the containers back up which
  might contradict with system_upgrade_stop_services.
- Setting the insecure registries in /etc/docker/daemon.json
  would be an option if we didn't also provide the
  INSECURE_REGISTRY environment option to /etc/sysconfig/docker.
  This causes docker to complain on reload on duplicate option
  and it will ignore the /etc/docker/daemon.json settings.
- This leaves us no other option than to restart docker. For this
  we list containers that were running before restart and compare
  it against containers running after the restart to shut down
  anything that should not be running. This is a bit racy but
  should work as one shot solution.
- As a bonus we apply the change of image to hybrid state by
  applying the paunch config. This in any case will try to restart
  all the containers. This is potential issue for the neutron-sriov
  hybrid state as well as for the nova-compute hybrid state. If we
  hit same issue there we will have to apply fix in separate
  commit.

Resolves: rhbz#1885212
Change-Id: I0e775e15b6e5e117e7ad01574a27081f337ecf20
"}]
commit_message:
[train-only] Introduce hybrid state also for ovn_controller

Turns out OVN Controllers can't talk to DB with different versions.

There is issue with docker insecure registries:
- When setting insecure registries in /etc/containers docker
  ignores upate to this file on daemon reload. The registry
  settings will be ingored unless you restart.
- Restarting docker restarts all the containers back up which
  might contradict with system_upgrade_stop_services.
- Setting the insecure registries in /etc/docker/daemon.json
  would be an option if we didn't also provide the
  INSECURE_REGISTRY environment option to /etc/sysconfig/docker.
  This causes docker to complain on reload on duplicate option
  and it will ignore the /etc/docker/daemon.json settings.
- This leaves us no other option than to restart docker. For this
  we list containers that were running before restart and compare
  it against containers running after the restart to shut down
  anything that should not be running. This is a bit racy but
  should work as one shot solution.
- As a bonus we apply the change of image to hybrid state by
  applying the paunch config. This in any case will try to restart
  all the containers. This is potential issue for the neutron-sriov
  hybrid state as well as for the nova-compute hybrid state. If we
  hit same issue there we will have to apply fix in separate
  commit.

Resolves: rhbz#1885212
Change-Id: I0e775e15b6e5e117e7ad01574a27081f337ecf20

messages:
[{'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2020-10-26 07:08:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2020-10-26 11:27:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2020-10-27 10:04:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2020-10-27 10:38:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Are we sure we want to do this?
Like pointed out in early reviews on https://review.opendev.org/752367, and again brought up by the upgrades team in yesterday's PTG meeting.

We don't have a good way to convert heat templates to ansible templates yet. We don't have any user feedback yet. Yet, we deprecate the heat templates and remove them. This feels rushed."}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2020-10-27 10:45:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> We don't have a good way to convert heat templates to ansible templates yet.

Not sure I understand what you mean and what's the link to the upgrade discussion. How is that related to removing these in-tree ones which have already been converted to the new format?

If someone is using these there won't be any conversion needed.

The only thing from upgrades pov is to convert any custom nic configs (not in tree) used."}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2020-10-27 11:04:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

> > We don't have a good way to convert heat templates to ansible
 > templates yet.
 > 
 > Not sure I understand what you mean and what's the link to the
 > upgrade discussion. How is that related to removing these in-tree
 > ones which have already been converted to the new format?
 > 
 > If someone is using these there won't be any conversion needed.
 > 
 > The only thing from upgrades pov is to convert any custom nic
 > configs (not in tree) used.

I think we should have had a spec and gotten upgrade teams input before doing the conversion, and deprecating the heat templates. -1 removed."}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2020-10-27 11:17:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> I think we should have had a spec and gotten upgrade teams input before doing the conversion, and deprecating the heat templates. -1 removed.

I did not see any concern from the upgrade team other than how/when custom configs should be converted. We would never be able to provide a tool that can address all customized nic config templates. I agree that we should document it well as a pre-upgrade pre-req.

What confuses me is on one-hand we say that nic config heat templates are difficult to manage and understand; is a major pain point and on the other, we are quite conservative on asking users to use the new format. I think there is an added incentive for users to move to the new format if they are not happy with the existing interfaces.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2020-11-11 21:37:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2020-11-12 03:38:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2020-11-12 11:17:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}]

commit_message:
Remove old nic config templates

This removes all in-tree nic config templates as we've migrated
them. Users can still use copy of those (modified/un-modified).

Change-Id: Ie0be19e416058d33dbe758ebb2a06e55c651a7e9

commit_message:
[train-only] Switch sriov agent in hybrid state

As there is no support on neutron side to make the Queens version of
neutron sriov agent to talk with Train version we need to workaround
this by switching the container to Train version. As it's only
python service container this action should be fine.

Resolves: rhbz#1882400

Change-Id: If316a16332155ac7620a312c8a306f84c7066b6d

commit_message:
Fix ovs agent, avoiding import error

A recent change[1] added a "iptables_firewall" import to the
ovs agent, which isn't importable on Windows[2]. This prevents
the neutron ovs agent from starting on Windows.

This patch updates the security group driver check, avoiding the
unsupported import.

[1] Iecf9cffaf02616342f1727ad7db85545d8adbec2
[2] http://paste.openstack.org/raw/799030/

Closes-Bug: #1899775

Change-Id: I8877dbf4b0b9cd185ae0b8715b7e8e6d87e0afcc
(cherry picked from commit 2ece1002d258e3388607e7df7677a0afae98d2cd)

commit_message:
Properly compute hostname when looking for the ceph-mon container

There are some cases when the return value of the ${HOSTNAME) variable
is different from {{ ansible_hostname }}, especially when tls-everywhere
framework is involved.
This purpose of this review is to fix the FFU section that needs to know
the hostname to find the running container on the delegated host.

Change-Id: Ib269a25fcf0db66ad3144c3e20031a4da6e2e2fb
Closes-Bug: #1903537
(cherry picked from commit 4e0f61d9e2affd107b0ac9a195e23f2a71083383)

Some of the 3rd party vswitch providers does not follow the regular ovs db and
vswitchd is split and it is implementation specific. But in general the openvswitch.service
will be used as base even for the 3rd party providers. Moving the dependency from
vswitchd to openvswitch make sriov_config.service to work with other providers.

commit_message:
Fixing the dependency for sriov_config service

Some of the 3rd party vswitch providers does not follow the regular ovs db and
vswitchd is split and it is implementation specific. But in general the openvswitch.service
will be used as base even for the 3rd party providers. Moving the dependency from
vswitchd to openvswitch make sriov_config.service to work with other providers.

Closes-Bug: #1903550

Change-Id: Id23051e12dad8d4b84df1821e670661a0891e780
(cherry picked from commit 87702f33c0dd6902de016e4bb18d4ffde41d74ae)

commit_message:
Remove the need for docker

This change moves our one tox-molecule job to simply depending on
the zuul tox job. To ensure we're not depending on the docker
driver at all, docker has been replaced with podman in the
tripleo_redhat_enforce test job.

Change-Id: I590a500b397d22d2e6fd4336f306caadcb690f45
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 03cae88d6373a38e55f717eecfbb69fe82110070)

[{'created': '2020-11-10 13:36:44.000000000', 'message': 'Use assertCountEqual instead of assertItemsEqual

The assertItemsEqual method has been removed in Python 3.3 [1] but
it was kept alive by unittest2, imported by testtools.
To prevent mayhem and despair caused by testtools removing unittest2
from its requirements in the near future, we switch to assertCountEqual.

[1] https://bugs.python.org/issue17866

Change-Id: I614bcedc9981370fb54cfe3da997a3d52484c07f
(cherry picked from commit ca1c1b87af73810599a3192c82cd19a7846f4ace)
'}]
commit_message:
Use assertCountEqual instead of assertItemsEqual

The assertItemsEqual method has been removed in Python 3.3 [1] but
it was kept alive by unittest2, imported by testtools.
To prevent mayhem and despair caused by testtools removing unittest2
from its requirements in the near future, we switch to assertCountEqual.

[1] https://bugs.python.org/issue17866

Change-Id: I614bcedc9981370fb54cfe3da997a3d52484c07f
(cherry picked from commit ca1c1b87af73810599a3192c82cd19a7846f4ace)

commit_message:
Retrieve BIOS configuration when moving node to ``manageable``

When moving the node to ``manageable``, in addition to
``cleaning``, retrieve the BIOS configuration settings.  In the
case of ``manageable``, this may allow the settings to be used
when choosing which node to deploy.

Change-Id: Ic2b162f31d4a1465fcb61671e7f48b3d31de788c
Story: 2008326
Task: 41224

commit_message:
Import HTTPStatus instead of http_client

We don't need an HTTP client for this, we only
need status codes.  Just load that instead.

https://docs.python.org/3/library/http.html

Change-Id: Ie9f06cce9cab3aa83044eaee4c691a10f9d9147a

commit_message:
[kuryr] Transition Stein to EM

This transition the stein branch to extended maintenance.
Changes for bugfixes and things the team deems important are
still encouraged, but there will no longer be official releases
off of the branch.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this
transition, or -1 if there are any final backports currently in
flight that we should wait for. For the latter case, please
update the patch with the new commit hash after doing a final
release to get those changes out so we know to proceed with the
transition.

Change-Id: Idb12c8407be1acdffc4e2b14e70a54d0dabd9ce7

commit_message:
[trove] Transition Stein to EM

This transition the stein branch to extended maintenance.
Changes for bugfixes and things the team deems important are
still encouraged, but there will no longer be official releases
off of the branch.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this
transition, or -1 if there are any final backports currently in
flight that we should wait for. For the latter case, please
update the patch with the new commit hash after doing a final
release to get those changes out so we know to proceed with the
transition.

Change-Id: Ie036cbb9eadf6870894acf60a0deb50780ce406c

commit_message:
[zun] Transition Stein to EM

This transition the stein branch to extended maintenance.
Changes for bugfixes and things the team deems important are
still encouraged, but there will no longer be official releases
off of the branch.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this
transition, or -1 if there are any final backports currently in
flight that we should wait for. For the latter case, please
update the patch with the new commit hash after doing a final
release to get those changes out so we know to proceed with the
transition.

Change-Id: Id36b8a25e069dca32d623548598ec11f6fa0462b

commit_message:
Add retry to build

In order to mitigate network issues this patch adds retry decorator to
try to build 3 times with 1 sec delay betweeen tries.

Change-Id: I58e8e2dc031c9c4d028226bfab489e189378634b

commit_message:
Log configuration options on start-up

This is very convenient for debugging and is something ironic and
ironic-inspector already do.

Register SSL options earlier so that they're accounted for.

Change-Id: I56aca8eec1dfeb065ac657452a7076a9e3d17cc3

commit_message:
[reno] Ignore backported release note

Release notes can be only edited in the branch were they were created
In case of edit and backport, release note will show up for
the upcoming release

Change-Id: I0ab23569b42fbd8a7792ca113779b26558d17999

commit_message:
Move the multinode grenade job to the experimental pipeline

It's hopelessly broken, let's not waste resources on it until we
get back to making it work.

Change-Id: I171fa566e36ad5ac8659ecb0578029df270497d6
(cherry picked from commit 2e2b07bb91a95dcafbd85bc6c2c92016bd027c0d)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-11 23:48:58.000000000', 'message': "Fix redfish BIOS apply config error handling

Instead of using process_event('fail') use error_handlers,
otherwise in case of failure node gets stuck and fails
because of timeout, instead of failing earlier due to
step failure.

Besides adding new unit tests, also update related unit tests
to test for success correctly and have realistic data.

Story: 2008307
Task: 41196
Change-Id: If28ccb252a87610e3fd3dc78e1ed75bb8ca1cdcf
(cherry picked from commit 70b7ca345f39b5126b5e68aa507298b623932dd5)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix redfish BIOS apply config error handling

Instead of using process_event('fail') use error_handlers,
otherwise in case of failure node gets stuck and fails
because of timeout, instead of failing earlier due to
step failure.

Besides adding new unit tests, also update related unit tests
to test for success correctly and have realistic data.

Story: 2008307
Task: 41196
Change-Id: If28ccb252a87610e3fd3dc78e1ed75bb8ca1cdcf
(cherry picked from commit 70b7ca345f39b5126b5e68aa507298b623932dd5)

[{'created': '2020-11-11 10:29:37.000000000', 'message': 'Fix handling rootwrap.d filters

First, ironic-lib filters are never copied from the venv.

Second, using `cp` for copying results in rootwrap.d copied inside
of rootwrap.d on upgrade/update.

Change-Id: I1c70c908a2576fd9da82ef89ad7e8e4b1caf4e8f
'}]
commit_message:
Fix handling rootwrap.d filters

First, ironic-lib filters are never copied from the venv.

Second, using `cp` for copying results in rootwrap.d copied inside
of rootwrap.d on upgrade/update.

Change-Id: I1c70c908a2576fd9da82ef89ad7e8e4b1caf4e8f

commit_message:
Make greande jobs n-v for EM and oldest stable

As discussed in ML thread[1], we are going to
make grenade jobs as non voting for all EM stable and
oldest stable. grenade jobs are failing not and it might take
time to fix those if we are able to fix. Once it jobs are
working depends on project team, they can bring them back to
voting or keep non-voting.

If those jobs are failing consistently and no one is fixing them
then removing those n-v jobs in future also fine.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-June/015499.html

StableOnly

Change-Id: I5ef940c6093aa1ccc660b7d82ba136f261086a4a

commit_message:
Increase max_stacks_per_tenant for tests

Default value for max_stacks_per_tenant is set to 100.
Increase stack count, so we can get higher chances to avoid error in test
when multiple test jobs in progress and hit the limit [1].

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/799401/

Change-Id: Ia218563190b61ad646215f0693b533b824e3ed41

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 7353, 'name': 'Kevin Carter', 'email': 'kevin@cloudnull.com', 'username': 'cloudnull'}, {'_account_id': 9592, 'name': 'wes hayutin', 'email': 'whayutin@redhat.com', 'username': 'weshayutin'}, {'_account_id': 21129, 'name': 'Alan Bishop', 'email': 'abishop@redhat.com', 'username': 'ASBishop'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22865, 'name': 'Jaganathan Palanisamy', 'email': 'jpalanis@redhat.com', 'username': 'jaganathancse'}, {'_account_id': 24162, 'name': 'Sorin Sbârnea', 'display_name': 'zbr', 'email': 'ssbarnea@redhat.com', 'username': 'ssbarnea', 'status': 'do not feed the troll 🥕'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2020-11-10 19:47:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2020-11-10 21:25:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Analyzing tripleo-ansible-centos-8-role-addition log file [1]

[1] https://9dc3a9f557f77d30cc7f-7e6869245293128d56e01a00a2a8b1fe.ssl.cf1.rackcdn.com/762200/1/check/tripleo-ansible-centos-8-role-addition/61024dc/job-output.txt

bindep.txt pulls in podman:

2020-11-10 20:09:04.318388 | TASK [Get list of packages to install from bindep]
2020-11-10 20:09:06.661144 | centos-8 | gcc-c++
2020-11-10 20:09:06.661239 | centos-8 | libffi-devel
2020-11-10 20:09:06.661260 | centos-8 | openssl-devel
2020-11-10 20:09:06.661275 | centos-8 | podman

Yup, see https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible/src/branch/master/bindep.txt#L21

But later, [2] fails:

[2] https://opendev.org/zuul/zuul-jobs/src/branch/master/roles/ensure-docker/tasks/docker-upstream.yaml#L32

2020-11-10 20:11:08.781943 | TASK [ensure-docker : Install upstream docker using package]
2020-11-10 20:11:10.553605 | centos-8 | ERROR
2020-11-10 20:11:10.554246 | centos-8 | {
2020-11-10 20:11:10.554352 | centos-8 |   "failures": [],
2020-11-10 20:11:10.554448 | centos-8 |   "msg": "Depsolve Error occured: \n Problem: problem with installed package podman-1.6.4-10.module_el8.2.0+305+5e198a41.x86_64\n  - package podman-1.6.4-10.module_el8.2.0+305+5e198a41.x86_64 requires runc >= 1.0.0-57, but none of the providers can be installed\n  - package containerd.io-1.3.7-3.1.el8.x86_64 conflicts with runc provided by runc-1.0.0-65.rc10.module_el8.2.0+305+5e198a41.x86_64\n  - package containerd.io-1.3.7-3.1.el8.x86_64 obsoletes runc provided by runc-1.0.0-65.rc10.module_el8.2.0+305+5e198a41.x86_64\n  - conflicting requests\n  - package runc-1.0.0-64.rc10.module_el8.2.0+304+65a3c2ac.x86_64 is filtered out by modular filtering",
2020-11-10 20:11:10.554551 | centos-8 |   "rc": 1,
2020-11-10 20:11:10.554643 | centos-8 |   "results": []
2020-11-10 20:11:10.554733 | centos-8 | }

So both podman and docker get installed. Apparently podman-1.6.4-10 needs runc, but the new docker needs containerd.io and containerd.io conflicts with runc.'}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2020-11-11 15:52:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2020-11-11 19:44:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Looking at https://c6d1c73a953d4adf2793-a619ea89024f9935a8230ca8f397a8a1.ssl.cf5.rackcdn.com/762200/2/check/tripleo-ansible-centos-8-role-addition/e5c0214/job-output.txt

This:

2020-11-11 16:21:57.633700 | PRE-RUN START: [untrusted : opendev.org/zuul/zuul-jobs/playbooks/tox/pre-molecule.yaml@master]

And the tox/pre-molecule.yaml playbook wants to ensure-docker :

https://opendev.org/zuul/zuul-jobs/src/branch/master/playbooks/tox/pre-molecule.yaml#L5

So we're still pulling in docker. 

Why is this job running the tox/pre-molecule.yaml playbook, when the other tripleo-ansible molecule tests don't? Could it be this?

https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible/src/branch/master/tox.ini#L103"}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2020-11-11 20:00:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2020-11-11 20:40:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

Voting on this because all code supplied or suggested by others'}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2020-11-12 04:09:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 22865, 'date': '2020-11-12 05:44:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2020-11-12 12:23:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2020-11-12 12:23:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2020-11-12 15:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/victoria as commit 5ddee05d7670ef27322352c3bf726cd5116208d9'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2020-11-12 15:03:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/ussuri as commit bc573ba5acd7939028dade6097b1f34465085e3e'}]

commit_message:
Remove the need for docker

This change moves our one tox-molecule job to simply depending on
the zuul tox job. To ensure we're not depending on the docker
driver at all, docker has been replaced with podman in the
tripleo_redhat_enforce test job.

Change-Id: I590a500b397d22d2e6fd4336f306caadcb690f45
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Replace deprecated UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE variable

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is deprecated and TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is
the new environment variable name that replaces it [1].

This allows to use upper-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

[1] https://zuul-ci.org/docs/zuul-jobs/python-roles.html#rolevar-tox.tox_constraints_file
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/722814/

Change-Id: I362ea7f5a3064892503b6e8e4d663f72ac23bea3

subject: Revert "validate static configuration"
messages:
[{'account_id': 19159, 'date': '2019-04-03 08:15:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 19159, 'date': '2019-04-03 08:16:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm reverting the change in stable/stein. In master, we can either revert or fix it (and add tempest tests)"}, {'account_id': 19159, 'date': '2019-04-03 09:51:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 29383, 'date': '2019-04-05 02:56:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2019-04-05 14:31:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Please, propose this patch to master first. Also, it would good to use 'revert' button in Gerrit UI  to have more details in a commit message for history."}, {'account_id': 19159, 'date': '2019-04-08 08:31:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Please, propose this patch to master first. Also, it would good to
 > use 'revert' button in Gerrit UI  to have more details in a commit
 > message for history.
I never noticed the 'revert' button... I'll use it.

Regarding the master branch, I think we could fix the change instead of reverting it."}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2019-04-08 15:36:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

According to [1] we need to do all fixes/reverts in master first. IMO, it's not a case when we should have an exception from this rule.

I agree that it's better to fix it rather than revert the commit, but this should be done in the same way both in master and stable/stein branches

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/stable-branches.html#proposing-fixes"}, {'account_id': 19159, 'date': '2019-04-10 10:46:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> According to [1] we need to do all fixes/reverts in master first.
 > IMO, it's not a case when we should have an exception from this
 > rule.
 > 
 > I agree that it's better to fix it rather than revert the commit,
 > but this should be done in the same way both in master and
 > stable/stein branches
 > 
 > [1] https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/stable-branches.html#proposing-fixes

I think that the concept of master-first is right in general, but I'm not sure it fits here. I am not suggesting two different solutions to the same problem - I'm suggesting to completely remove the check from stable/stein, because it causes a bug, and I'm not sure when we'll introduce the fix. 

If stable/stein was cut two weeks earlier, you would get the same result. Also, if I ask to revert the change in master (which I will do if you insist ;-)), merge it to stable/stein and then in a few weeks we'll have a fixed implementation in master - it will also be the same result."}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-11-12 14:40:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Do we want to continue with these changes?

stein is now in extended maintainance and your branches will be moved too EM soon.

commit_message:
Revert "validate static configuration"

Apparently the validation does not work well - it fails for static
files that do not have any relationships (although it is considered a
valid case in Vitrage).

The validation schema should be fixed and we must have tempest tests
with different static files examples. I'm reverting the patch since
there is no time left to handle it in Stein.

Change-Id: I362447f313508e69a4ee8cdb6c6d7814ff1a3249

commit_message:
Update master for stable/victoria

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/victoria.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/victoria.

Change-Id: Iedf3cb71a2554faae75e0fe40bcdc889476cf4b5
Sem-Ver: feature

I'm not sure that we can remove undercloud parameters for Mistral and Zaqar(*1) until we completely remove support of Zaqar and Mistral in undercloud. I know that these components are no longer used in tripleo operations but there might be some users still using the deprecated module in undercloud for some reason.
I see that some Zaqar parameters have been removed when it was deprecated, and I think we should revert that part as well, if we don't remove Zaqar support in undercloud.

I definitely agree to remove them if we remove Zaqar/Mistral support in undercloud in this cycle."}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2020-11-11 11:03:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I'm not sure that we can remove undercloud parameters for Mistral and Zaqar(*1) until we completely remove support of Zaqar and Mistral in undercloud.

We've removed all overcloud deployment related workflows, so enabling mistral/zaqar on undercloud is of very little use. If at all someone enables it they will have the default configs and not these custom ones."}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-11-11 14:01:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2020-11-11 22:31:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Needs a follow-up once it's published.

subject: Fix running in a venv
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16068, 'name': 'Tobias Henkel', 'email': 'tobias.henkel@bmw.de', 'username': 'tobias.henkel'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 16068, 'date': '2020-10-06 14:30:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2020-10-08 21:46:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This is running in an *unactivated* vm right?  as in running ./bin/disk-image-create without first ". ./bin/activate"?

I have to admit, when we removed the non-working auto-activation I was pretty happy to say that running out of a non-activated venv wasn't supported.  

Am I correct that this is the core problem?'}, {'account_id': 16068, 'date': '2020-10-13 19:09:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> This is running in an *unactivated* vm right?  as in running
 > ./bin/disk-image-create without first ". ./bin/activate"?
 > 
 > I have to admit, when we removed the non-working auto-activation I
 > was pretty happy to say that running out of a non-activated venv
 > wasn't supported.
 > 
 > Am I correct that this is the core problem?

Yes, that's the core problem. However it worked before and within nodepool we cannot use pre-activation. We had to temporarily revert Ide4b617f419b57ca8be53bc36b1c506fd399d3e6 in our nodepool installation but this is only a temporary solution.

I tried to keep this change as minimal as possible so we can keep the auto activation removal while still supporting to run dib in an unactivated venv just like any other python application.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2020-11-09 11:21:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Sorry I didn't get back to this, I felt like maybe we should reevaluate why this was necessary but got distracted.  I feel like we can just drop these as console scripts because they are not useful outside the context of disk-image-build and have proposed a couple of changes.  It looks like ci is having issues so I'll chase that tomorrow and we can evaluate"}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2020-11-12 03:25:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

-1 for visibility to discuss this

I think that having these tools as entry-points is wrong; there's nothing they can do outside the context of actually being run under disk-image-create.

I have proposed

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/761857/
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/761858/

that moves it into /lib.  This is very similar to dib-run-parts, which we moved to an internal tool as well.

Does this work for you?"}, {'account_id': 16068, 'date': '2020-11-12 14:16:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thanks, I'll test those :)"}, {'account_id': 16068, 'date': '2020-11-12 14:41:53.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

I tested your alternative changes and can confirm that they work. Thanks a lot!'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-06 14:30:30.000000000', 'message': 'Fix running in a venv

Change Iede929ea2d278008220aac8b1d678ba41eba0d8a removed the
virtualenv activation to make diskimage-builder more compatible with
python 3 and venv instead of virtualenv. This actually broke running
in a venv since some scripts that are installed along
diskimage-builder are not found anymore. Fix this by exporting a new
variable DIB_BIN_DIR and call those tools using absolute paths.

Change-Id: Id590b00805d0fef00a2ddb1d7d78bad96016fbf9
'}]
commit_message:
Fix running in a venv

Change Iede929ea2d278008220aac8b1d678ba41eba0d8a removed the
virtualenv activation to make diskimage-builder more compatible with
python 3 and venv instead of virtualenv. This actually broke running
in a venv since some scripts that are installed along
diskimage-builder are not found anymore. Fix this by exporting a new
variable DIB_BIN_DIR and call those tools using absolute paths.

Change-Id: Id590b00805d0fef00a2ddb1d7d78bad96016fbf9

commit_message:
Removed ubi-8 based jobs

ubi-8 based jobs uses tcib method of building containers
and same method also used by content-provider jobs.

We nearly migrated to content-provider, this jobs
are no longer in use.

Change-Id: I499a1d8f985843cf11dfb3b620e119a895380fe1
Signed-off-by: Amol Kahat <amolkahat@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 63e6bde6f4708a77cd30900374039e18a51821ac)

commit_message:
Install python/pyton3-setuptools based on python version

Id884b75719ca4c5326404e557e0aa14737ee8476 installed
python3-setuptools. However, the task runs on python2 also.
We should install python-setuptools on python2 environment
instead of python3-setuptools.

Closes-bug: #1902986
Change-Id: Ieebd970cdd9775faf50ef5e1ac2b6f1eb5a240df

fi
set -o pipefail

echo "[$(date)] Run online data migration for overcloud during update"

commit_message:
Run online migration tasks from external_update_tasks too.

The minor update procedure has been suggesting the execution of the
online db migrations step for few releases already, by the execution
of the openstack overcloud external-update run --tags online_upgrade.
However, this command has never executed any task at all as the
online_upgrade tasks belong to the external_upgrade_tasks section.
Instead of changing the interface in all releases by modifying the docs
let's just fix this in the code.

Change-Id: I4453e7c755cccc52bb135a14be1b04fdea53de6b
Closes-Bug: #1900467

Please adjust the commit message to be a sync commit (and include other additional files synced, if any) after the PR https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/516 is merged'}, {'account_id': 31959, 'date': '2020-11-12 14:13:27.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-27 21:29:26.000000000', 'message': "core/host: optimize chownr function

chownr function calls os.path.exists and os.path.lexists
for every file. This can be avoided by checking the error
case that they were meant to handle (i.e. the symlink's
target is missing).

Closes-bug: #1898605

Change-Id: Ibbdedac312911826013f65d235086e82a91c37f3
Signed-off-by: Ponnuvel Palaniyappan <ponnuvel.palaniyappan@canonical.com>
"}]
commit_message:
core/host: optimize chownr function

chownr function calls os.path.exists and os.path.lexists
for every file. This can be avoided by checking the error
case that they were meant to handle (i.e. the symlink's
target is missing).

Closes-bug: #1898605

Change-Id: Ibbdedac312911826013f65d235086e82a91c37f3
Signed-off-by: Ponnuvel Palaniyappan <ponnuvel.palaniyappan@canonical.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-09 13:55:59.000000000', 'message': 'Drop invalid rootwrap filters

A recent change introduced a couple of rootwrap filters that are
supposed to allow running ping within a network namespace.

Those filters will actually replace the "ip" command with "ping",
which leads to an invalid command.

Since those two filters are now superfluous, we're going to drop
them.

Conflicts:
    etc/neutron/rootwrap.d/debug.filters

Change-Id: I57869c68e858503ed8d6b86506c79c289f2820e1
Closes-Bug: #1864186
'}]
commit_message:
Drop invalid rootwrap filters

A recent change introduced a couple of rootwrap filters that are
supposed to allow running ping within a network namespace.

Those filters will actually replace the "ip" command with "ping",
which leads to an invalid command.

Since those two filters are now superfluous, we're going to drop
them.

Conflicts:
    etc/neutron/rootwrap.d/debug.filters

Change-Id: I57869c68e858503ed8d6b86506c79c289f2820e1
Closes-Bug: #1864186

commit_message:
Local mac direct flow for non-openflow firewall

When there is no openflow firewall, aka the ovs agent security group
is disabled or Noop/HybridIptable, this patch will introduce a different
ingress pipeline for bridge ports which will avoid ingress flood:
(1) table=0,  in_port=patch_bridge,dl_vlan=physical_vlan action=mod_vlan:local_vlan,goto:60 (original)
(2) table=60, in_port=patch_bridge                       action=goto:61                     (new)
(3) table=61, dl_dst=local_port_mac,dl_vlan=local_vlan,  action=strip_vlan,output:<ofport>  (changes)

And changes the local ports pipeline:
(1) table=0,  in_port=local_ofport                       action=goto:25                  (original)
(2) table=25, in_port=local_ofport,dl_src=local_port_mac action=goto:60                  (original)
(3) table=60, in_port=local_ofport,dl_src=local_port_mac action=local_vlan->reg6,goto:61 (changes)
(4) table=61, dl_dst=local_port_mac,reg6=local_vlan,     action=output:<ofport>          (changes)

Closes-Bug: #1884708
Closes-Bug: #1881070
Related-Bug: #1732067
Related-Bug: #1866445
Related-Bug: #1883321

Conflicts:
    neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py
    neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/openflow/native/test_br_int.py

Change-Id: Iecf9cffaf02616342f1727ad7db85545d8adbec2
(cherry picked from commit 959d8b6d73e2a6ab1a45c9a7b0b05ae163e650fc)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-11 09:41:17.000000000', 'message': 'Replace ctype.CDLL by ctypes.PyDLL in linux.ip_lib

Some linux.ip_lib functions make use of "ctype.CDLL" methods
(create_netns, remove_netns). Those methods are called inside a
"privsep" context; that means the function reference and the
arguments are passed to a privileged context that will execute
the method.

"privsep" library makes use of eventlet to implement multitasking.
If the method executed returns the GIL, nothing guarantees that
the "eventlet" executor will return it again to this task. This
could lead to timeouts during the execution of those methods.

From https://docs.python.org/3.6/library/ctypes.html#ctypes.PyDLL:
  "Instances of this class behave like CDLL instances, except that
   the Python GIL is not released during the function call, and
   after the function execution the Python error flag is checked."

Change-Id: I36ef9bf59e9c93f50464457a5d9a968738844079
Closes-Bug: #1870352
(cherry picked from commit 306280813f34f8bbe384ae5bea67f0f66e316b61)
'}, {'created': '2020-09-22 08:48:55.000000000', 'message': 'Replace ctype.CDLL by ctypes.PyDLL in linux.ip_lib

Some linux.ip_lib functions make use of "ctype.CDLL" methods
(create_netns, remove_netns). Those methods are called inside a
"privsep" context; that means the function reference and the
arguments are passed to a privileged context that will execute
the method.

"privsep" library makes use of eventlet to implement multitasking.
If the method executed returns the GIL, nothing guarantees that
the "eventlet" executor will return it again to this task. This
could lead to timeouts during the execution of those methods.

From https://docs.python.org/3.6/library/ctypes.html#ctypes.PyDLL:
  "Instances of this class behave like CDLL instances, except that
   the Python GIL is not released during the function call, and
   after the function execution the Python error flag is checked."

Change-Id: I36ef9bf59e9c93f50464457a5d9a968738844079
Closes-Bug: #1870352
(cherry picked from commit 306280813f34f8bbe384ae5bea67f0f66e316b61)
'}]
commit_message:
Replace ctype.CDLL by ctypes.PyDLL in linux.ip_lib

Some linux.ip_lib functions make use of "ctype.CDLL" methods
(create_netns, remove_netns). Those methods are called inside a
"privsep" context; that means the function reference and the
arguments are passed to a privileged context that will execute
the method.

"privsep" library makes use of eventlet to implement multitasking.
If the method executed returns the GIL, nothing guarantees that
the "eventlet" executor will return it again to this task. This
could lead to timeouts during the execution of those methods.

From https://docs.python.org/3.6/library/ctypes.html#ctypes.PyDLL:
  "Instances of this class behave like CDLL instances, except that
   the Python GIL is not released during the function call, and
   after the function execution the Python error flag is checked."

Change-Id: I36ef9bf59e9c93f50464457a5d9a968738844079
Closes-Bug: #1870352
(cherry picked from commit 306280813f34f8bbe384ae5bea67f0f66e316b61)

[{'created': '2020-11-10 18:31:07.000000000', 'message': 'Generic cluster properties support

Sometimes in certain environments we need to set specific cluster
properties to tune the control plane to that specific situation.
Tested with:
    tripleo::profile::base::pacemaker::cluster_properties:
      test:
        property: shutdown-escalation
        value: 6m
        tries: 5
      test2:
        property: priority-fencing-delay
        value: 10
        tries: 5
      test3:
        property: startup-fencing
        value: false
        tries: 5

And obtained the correctly set properties:
[root@controller-0 hieradata]# pcs property
Cluster Properties:
...
 priority-fencing-delay: 10
 shutdown-escalation: 6m
 startup-fencing: false

Change-Id: Iebd1ae24a69fb0bdc5f7f7c75a1a79e9c608ba96
(cherry picked from commit 056ace0c8cac6089948d2752825a5c3ebdd1424c)
'}]
commit_message:
Generic cluster properties support

Sometimes in certain environments we need to set specific cluster
properties to tune the control plane to that specific situation.
Tested with:
    tripleo::profile::base::pacemaker::cluster_properties:
      test:
        property: shutdown-escalation
        value: 6m
        tries: 5
      test2:
        property: priority-fencing-delay
        value: 10
        tries: 5
      test3:
        property: startup-fencing
        value: false
        tries: 5

And obtained the correctly set properties:
[root@controller-0 hieradata]# pcs property
Cluster Properties:
...
 priority-fencing-delay: 10
 shutdown-escalation: 6m
 startup-fencing: false

Change-Id: Iebd1ae24a69fb0bdc5f7f7c75a1a79e9c608ba96
(cherry picked from commit 056ace0c8cac6089948d2752825a5c3ebdd1424c)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-21 10:10:54.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Adding a tool to track project who need to drop eol branches

Since transition from the EOL model to the EM model eol branches
are no longer removed and this step is no longer in the release team
process.

Keep stale branches can be an issue in some situation especially with
zuul and our gates. To avoid this situation the release team propose
to reintroduce regular checks to ensure that we remove stale branches
that have been tagged eol previously.

These changes are split in tree parts:
1. script added to track these stale branches
2. existing code adapted to list deliverables who matches eol in a given serie
3. short term process added to regularly check this existing eol and
notify the infra to ask them to remove the stale branches. Mostly to
vaccum our environment during Wallaby and ensure to retrieve a clean env
during the next cycle.
4. long term process added to ensure that the release team will notify the
infra team as soon as a branch is tagged as eol.

Change-Id: I53aeb3211bb3251a3278472a514a39afe825cdd2
'}, {'created': '2020-10-22 14:27:34.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Adding a tool to track project who need to drop eol branches

process.

2. existing code adapted to list deliverables who matches eol in a given serie
3. short term process added to regularly check this existing eol and
notify the infra to ask them to remove the stale branches. Mostly to
vaccum our environment during Wallaby and ensure to retrieve a clean env
during the next cycle.
4. long term process added to ensure that the release team will notify the
infra team as soon as a branch is tagged as eol.

Change-Id: I53aeb3211bb3251a3278472a514a39afe825cdd2
'}, {'created': '2020-10-27 10:46:05.000000000', 'message': 'Adding a tool to track project who need to drop eol branches

Since transition from the EOL model to the EM model eol branches
are no longer removed and this step is no longer in the release team
process.

Keep stale branches can be an issue in some situation especially with
zuul and our gates. To avoid this situation the release team propose
to reintroduce regular checks to ensure that we remove stale branches
that have been tagged eol previously.

As discussed during our previous meetings soon it will be possible to design
a new job and to trigger it to remove eol branches automatically.
This will possible when the infra would have been updated and when all
the needed pieces will be in place.
